Despite macroeconomic challenges , the semiconductor industry is expected to expand over time due to increased demand for advanced technologies such as AI and IoT , as well as ongoing innovation and research . Given the industryâs growth prospects , fundamentally strong [Broadcom Inc.]1-broadcom inc. ( AVGO ) , [NVIDIA Corporation]2-nvidia corporation ( NVDA ) and [Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited]1080-taiwan semiconductor manufacturing company limited ( TSM ) could be ideal buys for solid returns . Before delving deeper into [their]1081-their fundamentals , letâs discuss whatâs happening in the semiconductor industry . [The semiconductor industry]1082-the semiconductor industry is evolving with emerging technologies such as AI , machine learning , and IoT , driven by worldwide digital and consumer electronics usage . These technologies are driving up the need for more advanced and powerful semiconductors . As a result , [the semiconductor industry]1082-the semiconductor industry is expanding rapidly and innovating to keep pace with these changing needs . The semiconductor robot market in [the United States]1084-the united states is predicted to develop at an 18.2 % CAGR , with a valuation of $ 817.9 million by 2028 . Automation is on the rise in areas such as automotive , electronics , and healthcare , thanks to advances in artificial intelligence and machine learning , which improve manufacturing efficiency . The global semiconductor chip market is anticipated to reach $ 1.12 trillion by 2032 , growing at a CAGR of 7.1 % . Moreover , investorsâ interest in chip stocks is evident from the SPDR S&P Semiconductor ETFâs ( XSD ) 27.6 % returns over the past three months . Considering these conducive trends , letâs look at the fundamentals of the three Semiconductor & Wireless Chip stocks , starting with number 3 . Stock # 3 : Broadcom Inc. ( [AVGO]3-avgo ) [AVGO]3-avgo designs , develops , and supplies various semiconductor devices with a focus on complex digital and mixed signal complementary metal oxide semiconductor - based devices and products worldwide . [The company]1085-the company operates in two segments , Semiconductor Solutions and Infrastructure Software . AVGOâs trailing-12 - month net income margin of 39.31 % is significantly higher than the industry average of 2.20 % . [Its]1085-the company trailing-12 - month ROCE of 60.31 % is significantly higher than the industry average of 1.89 % . For the fiscal fourth quarter , which ended October 29 , 2023 , AVGOâs net revenue increased 4.1 % year - over - year to $ 9.30 billion , while [its]1085-the company non - GAAP operating income rose 4.5 % from the prior - year quarter to $ 5.75 billion . The companyâs non - GAAP net income and non - GAAP EPS grew 5.9 % and 5.8 % from the year - ago value to $ 4.81 billion and $ 11.06 , respectively . In addition , [its]1085-the company adjusted EBITDA amounted to $ 6.05 billion , up 5.7 % year - over - year . Analysts expect AVGOâs revenue to increase 39.1 % year - over - year to $ 49.83 billion for the year ending October 2024 . [Its]1085-the company EPS is expected to grow 10.8 % year - over - year to $ 46.83 for the same period . It is expected to surpass [EPS]758-eps in all four trailing quarters . Stock # 2 : [NVIDIA Corporation]2-nvidia corporation ( NVDA ) NVDA provides graphics , and compute and networking solutions in the U.S. , [Taiwan]4-taiwan , [China]5-china , and internationally . [The company]1085-the company has two segments : Compute & Networking and Graphics . On February 6 , 2024 , [NVDA]760-nvda partnered together with Cisco ( CSCO ) to provide AI infrastructure solutions for [the data center]1088-the data center that are simple to deploy and operate , providing the tremendous processing capacity that [organizations]1089-organizations require to succeed in the AI era . [CSCO]761-cisco , with [its]761-cisco industry - leading experience in Ethernet networking and broad partner ecosystem , and [NVDA]760-nvda , [the creator of the GPU that fuelled the AI boom]1090-the creator of the gpu that fuelled the ai boom , share a vision and commitment to assisting [customers]1091-customers with the transition to [AI with highly secure Ethernet - based infrastructure]1092-ai with highly secure ethernet - based infrastructure . NVDAâs trailing-12 - month ROTA of 34.88 % is significantly higher than the industry average of 0.66 % . [Its]1085-the company 33.23 % trailing-12 - month ROTC is significantly higher than the 2.44 % industry average . For the fiscal third quarter that ended October 29 , 2023 , NVDAâs revenue and non - GAAP gross profit increased 205.5 % and 308 % year - over - year to $ 18.12 billion and $ 13.58 billion , respectively . Moreover , [its]1085-the company free cash flow stood at $ 7.04 billion , up significantly from the prior - year quarter . For the same quarter , [its]1085-the company non - GAAP net income and non - GAAP net income per share stood at $ 10.02 billion and $ 4.02 , up 588.2 % and 593.1 % from the year - ago quarter , respectively . About [the Author]1099-the author : [Rashmi Kumari Rashmi]764-rashmi kumari rashmi is passionate about capital markets , wealth management , and financial regulatory issues , which led [her]764-rashmi kumari rashmi to pursue a career as [an investment analyst]1100-an investment analyst . Many tech stocks soared over the past year as interest rates stabilized and [investors]1102-investors eagerly rushed toward AI - related stocks in anticipation of a major AI boom . However , that buying frenzy also inflated some tech stocks ' valuations to historical highs . So for investors who are wary of buying [the market 's priciest tech stocks]1103-the market 's priciest tech stocks , it might be a good idea to look for the cheaper value plays that pay steady dividends instead . [I]0-i believe [three underappreciated blue chip stocks]1104-three underappreciated blue chip stocks fit the bill : [IBM]765-ibm ( IBM -0.30 % ) , AT&T ( T 0.88 % ) , and [Cisco]761-cisco ( CSCO 1.23 % ) . 1 . IBM For years , [IBM]765-ibm was considered dead money . From the first trading day of 2011 to 2021 , [the tech giant]1105-the tech giant 's stock declined 16 % as the S&P 500 rallied 191 % . [It]763-tsmâs underperformed the market by such a wide margin because [it]763-tsmâs struggled to grow [its]763-tsmâs revenue and keep pace with the evolving cloud market . [It]763-tsmâs divested some of [[its]763-tsmâs lower - margin businesses]1106-its lower - margin businesses to generate fresh cash , but [it]763-tsmâs repeatedly plowed most of that cash into wasteful buybacks instead of improving [[its]763-tsmâs core businesses]1107-its core businesses . But over the past three years , [IBM]765-ibm 's stock rallied 56 % as [[its]763-tsmâs CEO Arvind Krishna -- who took the helm in 2020]766-its ceo arvind krishna -- who took the helm in 2020 -- executed an aggressive turnaround plan . [It]763-tsmâs divested [[its]763-tsmâs slow - growth managed infrastructure services unit]1108-its slow - growth managed infrastructure services unit as [Kyndryl]12-kyndryl , restructured [[its]763-tsmâs remaining businesses]1109-its remaining businesses into three simpler units ( [software , consulting , and infrastructure]1110-software , consulting , and infrastructure ) , and expanded [its]763-tsmâs higher - growth hybrid cloud and AI businesses with a goal of generating mid - single digit revenue growth again . That strategy required [IBM]765-ibm to expand Red Hat , which [it]763-tsmâs acquired in 2019 , with more open source software that could process the data between [private and public clouds]1111-private and public clouds . That niche approach expanded [its]763-tsmâs cloud ecosystem without going head - to - head against [public cloud leaders like [Amazon]767-amazon and [Microsoft]768-microsoft]1112-public cloud leaders like amazon and microsoft . As a result , [IBM]765-ibm 's revenue grew 6 % in 2022 and 2 % in 2023 , and [analysts]1113-analysts expect [its]763-tsmâs revenue and adjusted EPS to rise 3 % and 5 % , respectively , in 2024 . Those growth rates indicate that [Big Blue]769-big blue 's business is finally stabilizing -- but it still looks like a bargain at 18 times forward earnings , and [it]763-tsmâs pays a high forward yield of 3.6 % . 2 . AT&T Like [IBM]765-ibm , AT&T was once considered a dismal long - term investment . But in 2021 and 2022 , [it]763-tsmâs divested DirecTV and [Time Warner]13-time warner and abandoned [its]763-tsmâs ill - fated attempt to become [a media superpower]1114-a media superpower . After [it]763-tsmâs streamlined [its]763-tsmâs business , [it]763-tsmâs focused on strengthening [its]763-tsmâs core telecom business by upgrading [its]763-tsmâs 5 G and fiber networks . That turnaround effort paid off . [Its]763-tsmâs total number of [wireless postpaid subscribers]1115-wireless postpaid subscribers grew by 2.9 million in 2022 and 1.7 million in 2023 , while the expansion of [its]763-tsmâs fiber business offset the slower growth of [[its]763-tsmâs non - fiber broadband businesses]1116-its non - fiber broadband businesses . [Its]763-tsmâs revenue rose 2 % in 2022 ( excluding the divestment of [its]763-tsmâs U.S. video business ) and grew 1 % in 2023 . [Analysts]1113-analysts expect [its]763-tsmâs revenue to rise 1 % in 2024 and 2025 . Those growth rates might seem anemic , but [they]1118-they indicate [AT&T]431-at&t is becoming a stable blue chip investment again . Meanwhile , AT&T 's free cash flow ( FCF ) rose from $ 14.1 billion in 2022 to $ 16.8 billion in 2023 , and [it]763-tsmâs expects that figure to rise to $ 17-$18 billion in 2024 . That healthy FCF growth should easily support [its]763-tsmâs hefty forward dividend yield of 6.6 % . [Analysts]1113-analysts expect [its]763-tsmâs adjusted EPS to dip 8 % in 2024 as [it]763-tsmâs upgrades [[its]763-tsmâs networks]1120-its networks , but [they]1113-analysts also anticipate 4 % growth in 2025 as [it]763-tsmâs laps those higher expenses . At seven times forward earnings , AT&T looks dirt cheap relative to those stable growth rates . 3 . [Cisco Cisco]14-cisco cisco , [the world 's largest networking company]1121-the world 's largest networking company , is often considered a safe blue - chip tech stock to hold through economic downturns . But over the past 12 months , [its]14-cisco cisco stock only rose 6 % as [investors]1102-investors fretted over [its]14-cisco cisco near - term slowdown . [Cisco]761-cisco 's revenue only rose 3 % in fiscal 2022 ( which ended in July 2022 ) as [its]14-cisco cisco networking hardware business grappled with supply chain constraints . In fiscal 2023 , [its]14-cisco cisco revenue jumped 11 % as [it]14-cisco cisco overcame those constraints and finally satisfied [the market]1123-the market 's pent - up demand for new networking devices . But for fiscal 2024 , [Cisco]761-cisco expects [its]761-cisco revenue to dip 4%-6 % with nearly flat EPS growth . That slowdown was caused by declining orders across the enterprise , [service provider]1124-service provider , and cloud markets . [Many of those customers]1125-many of those customers had overcompensated for the aforementioned supply chain constraints by ordering too much hardware in fiscal 2023 , and [they]1125-many of those customers were now sitting on up to half a year of shipped orders that were still waiting to be deployed . That situation might seem bleak , but [Cisco]761-cisco has weathered plenty of cyclical downturns and supply gluts before . [Analysts]1113-analysts expect [its]761-cisco revenue and adjusted EPS to rise again in fiscal 2025 , and [its]761-cisco stock still looks cheap at 13 times forward earnings with a forward yield of 3.1 % . That low valuation and high yield could make it a good safe haven play in a choppy market .

The technology sector has always been a hot topic for [investors]1102-investors , and [Reddit]771-reddit is buzzing with discussions about [NVIDIA Corp NVDA]15-nvidia corp nvda and [its]15-nvidia corp nvda potential trajectory . While trading at high TTM P / E valuations of 95 , [Nvidia]16-nvidia stock is a Buy based on analyst ratings consensus . [Redditor u]17-redditor u / waterlimes sparked a conversation by drawing parallels between [Nvidia]16-nvidia and [Cisco Systems Inc CSCO]18-cisco systems inc csco , raising concerns about the companyâs high P / E ratio of around 95 . This article explores the various perspectives shared by [the Reddit community]1128-the reddit community and evaluates whether [Nvidia]16-nvidia , with [its]16-nvidia impressive growth in the chip and AI markets , is still a wise investment . Also Read : [Nvidia]16-nvidia On The Rise , ChatGPTâs Secret Sauce And AI Cracks Ancient Code : This Week In Artificial Intelligence Nvidiaâs Technological Advancements And Adaptability Competitive Landscape : [User normal_gouy]772-user normal_gouy pointed out the key reason [Cisco]761-cisco lost ground was the ease with which [competitors]1129-competitors could replicate [their]1129-competitors products . However , in the case of Nvidia , the complexity of GPUs and Tegra devices makes replication more challenging . The consensus is that Nvidiaâs products are intricate , giving [them]1130-them a competitive advantage that might persist for a considerable period . Versatility and Innovation : [Normal_gouy]773-normal_gouy countered the comparison to [Cisco]761-cisco , emphasizing Nvidiaâs versatility as [a company]1131-a company . The sentiment is that [Nvidia]16-nvidia is agile and adaptable . If a new technology emerges , [Nvidia]16-nvidia is likely to explore and capitalize on it . The comparison to Apple Inc AAPL highlights how [companies that continually innovate]1132-companies that continually innovate can thrive despite potential challenges . Advanced Technology Differentiation : [Astronaut100]775-astronaut100 dismissed the comparison with [Cisco]761-cisco , stating that Nvidiaâs technological advancements surpass anything [Cisco]761-cisco ever accomplished . The consensus is that Nvidiaâs capabilities in AI and GPU technology make it a unique and advanced player in [the industry]1133-the industry . Consideration of PE Ratio and Industry Dynamics : 3LevelACDF addressed the concerns over the companyâs P / E ratio , arguing that it may not be the best metric for evaluating a growth stock like [Nvidia]16-nvidia , especially when [its]16-nvidia revenue increased by 200 % in the last quarter . The cyclical nature of the chip industry and the potential for oversupply were acknowledged , but the immediate demand for Nvidiaâs chips and its impressive revenue growth were emphasized . Concerns Regarding Technology Shifts And Supply Chain Dependencies Technology Shift Risk : TimeTravelingChris introduced the risk that [Nvidia]16-nvidia might face , not from direct competition , but from a shift in technology that could render [their]1130-them current chip offerings obsolete for AI applications . The uncertainty of when such a shift might occur leaves [investors]1102-investors on edge . The advice is to monitor earnings reports closely and observe any signs of flattening EPS growth . Supply Chain Dependency Concerns : POPnotSODA _ expressed concerns about Nvidiaâs dependence on external suppliers like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd TSM for chip fabrication . The lack of local manufacturing capabilities raises worries about potential disruptions in the supply chain , emphasizing the need for [Nvidia]16-nvidia to secure [its]16-nvidia chip production . "[16-nvidia] [Taiwan Semiconductor]25-taiwan semiconductor is a backdoor way to play the AI revolution [Lee Samaha]779-lee samaha ( Taiwan Semiconductor ): The explosion of interest in AI and global 5 G rollouts is translating into unprecedented demand for energy - efficient computing power . [CHICAGO]41-chicago , Feb. 9 , 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- The machine - to - machine ( [M2 M ) connections market]1230-m2 m ) connections market is projected to grow from USD 2.9 billion units in 2024 to USD 5.3 billion units by 2029 , registering a CAGR of 12.7 % during the forecast period according to a new report by MarketsandMarketsâ¢. The market growth is attributed to increasing support by [the government]1231-the government towards M2 M connections and the growing popularity of smart cities and [connected cars]1232-connected cars . Furthermore , the emergence of [M2 M]789-m2 m devices in telemedicine is expected to create lucrative opportunities for the market . Download PDF Brochure : https://www.marketsandmarkets.com/pdfdownloadNew.asp?id=732 Browse in - depth TOC on " Machine - to - machine ( [M2 M ) Connections Market]42-m2 m ) connections market "[789-m2 m] 120 â Tables 60 â Figures 200 â Pages Machine Safety Market Machine - to - machine ( [M2 M ) Connections Market]1230-m2 m ) connections market Report Scope : Report Coverage Details Market Revenue in 2024 $ 2.9 billion Estimated Value by 2029 $ 5.3 billion Growth Rate Poised to grow at a CAGR of 12.7 % Market Size Available for 2020â2029 Forecast Period 2024â2029 Forecast Units Value ( USD Million / Billion ) Report Coverage Revenue Forecast , Competitive Landscape , Growth Factors , and Trends Segments Covered By Technology , End - user Industry , and Region Geographies Covered [North America]43-north america , [Europe]44-europe , [Asia Pacific]50-asia pacific , and Rest of World Key Market Challenge Privacy and security Key Market Opportunities Emergence of [M2 M devices in Telemedicine Key Market Drivers]1234-m2 m devices in telemedicine key market drivers Growing popularity of [smart cities]1235-smart cities and [connected cars]1232-connected cars [The]1237-the [short range wireless technology machine - to - machine ( M2 M ) connections]1238-short range wireless technology machine - to - machine ( m2 m ) connections segment is expected to account for the largest share of the machine - to - machine ( M2 M ) connections market in 2024 . The short - range segment is a significant market for machine - to - machine ( M2 M ) connections . Short - range technologies have a larger number of connections than cellular because cellular wireless standards are mainly used for dubbing and aggregation purposes in applications such as [hospitals]1239-hospitals , [power plants]1240-power plants , [oil and gas refineries]1241-oil and gas refineries , [retail stores]1242-retail stores , and smart appliances , while short - range modules are used for the distribution of the cellular network throughout that concerned area of application . Universal subscriber identity modules ( USIMs ) are not very suitable for application in M2 M devices , which require [modules with a higher level of resistance in severe environments , better robustness , and longer data retention]1243-modules with a higher level of resistance in severe environments , better robustness , and longer data retention . These attributes are available in Machine Identification Modules or M2 M Identification Modules ( MIM ) , which have been specifically developed for M2 M applications . Unlike conventional SIMs , which are issued to [general consumers]1244-general consumers , MIMs are used in machines communicating with [each other]1245-each other . The high demand for these modules is indicative of the high growth of [the cellular M2 M connection market]1246-the cellular m2 m connection market . The Automotive & Transportation segment is expected to account for the largest share of the machine - to - machine ( M2 M ) connections market in 2024 . The automotive & transportation segment accounted for the largest share of the machine - to - machine ( [M2 M ) connections market]1230-m2 m ) connections market in 2024 , and a similar trend is expected to be witnessed during the forecast period . The recent developments in automotive & transportation that are expected to drive the growth are : Public transportation , such as [buses]1248-buses and [trains]1249-trains , will transform through connectivity . [Subway cars]1250-subway cars in [New York City]46-new york city will be equipped with chargers , built - in Wi - Fi , and security cameras , according to [[the city]1251-the city 's [Metropolitan Transportation Authority]1253-metropolitan transportation authority]1252-the city 's metropolitan transportation authority . In June 2021 , The European Union Funded the 5G - IANA project with over USD 7 million to develop [an Automotive Open Experimental Platform ( AOEP )]1254-an automotive open experimental platform ( aoep ) . The goal is to look into the market condition and identify opportunities for innovation and sustainable long - term development of 5 G in the automotive sector . NET REVENUE IN FY 2023 Publicis Groupeâs net revenue for the full year 2023 was 13,099 million euros , up +4.2 % compared to 12,572 million euros in 2022 . Exchange rate variations over the period had a negative impact of 340 million euros and acquisitions ( net of disposals ) had a positive impact of 100 million euros . Organic growth was +6.3 % in FY 2023 versus 2022 . Compared to 2019 , this implied organic growth of +21 % , accelerating in H2 at +22 % after +19 % in [H1]83-h1 . The Groupeâs strong and consistent performance in 2023 was reflected in each and every of its unique capabilities . Media , one third of revenue , grew double - digit on top of double digits last year , benefitting from both market shares gains and organic growth at [existing clients]1375-existing clients . Data and tech activities , another third of revenue , posted a very solid growth overall . On the one hand , despite a context of slowdown in digital business transformation experienced by [comparable consulting firms]1376-comparable consulting firms , [Publicis Sapient]797-publicis achieved a solid +3.2 % organic growth on top of a very high comparable base of +19 % in FY 2022 . On the other hand , Epsilonâs performance accelerated in the second half of the year , posting +9.6 % organically in FY 2023 , supported by a sustained high demand in first - party data management . Creative , the remaining third , showed [its]1377-its resilience with organic growth in the low - single digits for the year . Creative activities were broadly stable on the year . NET REVENUE IN Q4 2023 Publicis Groupe 's net revenue in Q4 2023 was 3,540 million euros compared to 3,462 million euros in Q4 2022 , up +2.3 % . Exchange rate variations had a 139 million euros negative impact . Acquisitions ( net of disposals ) had a 28 million euros positive impact . Organic growth was +5.7 % in Q4 2023 , ahead of the Groupeâs upgraded guidance in October 2023 . Media , one third of revenue , accelerated to double - digit growth in [Q4]92-q4 , supported by a solid ramp up in new business . Data & tech activities , another third , saw contrasted trends like in Q3 . [Epsilon]800-epsilon , on the one hand , posted a second consecutive quarter of double - digit growth , led by the high demand for 1P data . As anticipated , Publicis Sapient saw ongoing delays in DBT projects , like [all comparable IT consulting firms]1385-all comparable it consulting firms , leading to a slight organic decline in [Q4]92-q4 . Creative was again resilient in [Q4]92-q4 , with low - single digit growth . Breakdown of Q4 2023 Net revenue by [region EUR]1378-region eur Net revenue Reported Organic million Q4 2023 Q4 2022 growth growth North America 2,158 2,133 +1.2 % +6.0 % [Europe]44-europe 851 814 +4.5 % +4.3 % [Asia Pacific]1263-asia pacific 318 323 -1.5 % +4.0 % Middle East & [Africa]86-africa 106 104 +1.9 % +9.7 % [Latin America]91-latin america 107 88 +21.6 % +13.9 % Total 3,540 3,462 +2.3 % +5.7 % North America net revenue was up +6.0 % organically in Q4 2023 . Taking into account a negative impact of the U.S. dollar to euro exchange rate , reported growth was at +1.2 % . The U.S. accelerated in Q4 with +6.1 % organic growth as Media grew a strong double - digit , while Creative activities were softer on [the quarter]1388-the quarter , affected by localized cuts in classic advertising and on top of a high comparable base last year . [Epsilon]800-epsilon posted +10 % organic on the quarter , largely driven by [its]800-epsilon Digital Media and Data divisions . In the context of delays in IT consulting projects , [Publicis Sapient]797-publicis was broadly stable , facing a strong comparable base of +15 % in Q4 2022 . Europe net revenue was up +4.3 % on an organic basis ( +4.5 % reported ) . [It]1389-it grew +2.5 % organically when excluding the contribution of Outdoor Media activities and [the Drugstore]1384-the drugstore . [The United Kingdom]88-the united kingdom posted a 4.2 % organic decline on the quarter , facing a particularly high comparable base of +38 % in Q4 2022 which was largely fueled by [Publicis Sapient]797-publicis . [France]58-france recorded a +6.3%1 organic growth , driven by Creative and [Publicis Sapient]797-publicis . In [Germany]89-germany , organic growth was up by +5.3 % . Net revenue in [Central & Eastern Europe]1391-central & eastern europe was up +20.3 % organically . 1 Excluding Outdoor Media activities & [the Drugstore]95-the drugstore Net revenue in [Asia Pacific]1263-asia pacific grew +4.0 % organically and declined 1.5 % on a reported basis . This was led by [China]5-china that improved sequentially to +1.4 % in Q4 , thanks to a more favorable macroeconomic context . [South - East Asia]96-south - east asia was double - digit again this quarter , mainly driven by [India]47-india , [Singapore]97-singapore , [Thailand]98-thailand , and [Malaysia]99-malaysia . [Australia]100-australia and [New Zealand]1393-new zealand posted negative performances , the latter having a very strong comparable in Q4 last year . Net revenue in [the Middle East and Africa region]1383-the middle east and africa region was up +9.7 % organically ( +1.9 % on a reported basis ) , largely driven by [Publicis Sapient]797-publicis . In [Latin America]91-latin america , net revenue was up +13.9 % organically ( +21.6 % on a reported basis ) led by [Argentina]101-argentina , a strong [Colombia]102-colombia at double digits and solid [Mexico]103-mexico and [Brazil]104-brazil . ANALYSIS OF FY 2023 KEY FIGURES Income Statement EBITDA amounted to 2,845 million euros in 2023 , compared to 2,801 million euros in 2022 , up 1.6 % . EBITDA was 21.7 % as a percentage of net revenue . Personnel costs totaled 8,514 million euros in 2023 , up by 3.7 % from 8,211 million euros in 2022 . As a percentage of net revenue , the personnel expenses represented 65.0 % in 2023 , compared to 65.3 % in 2022 . Fixed personnel costs were 7,531 million euros representing 57.5 % of net revenue versus 56.5 % in 2022 . The cost of [freelancers]1395-freelancers decreased by 124 million euros in 2023 , representing 332 million euros . Restructuring costs reached 111 million euros representing less than 1 % of net revenue , up from 82 million euros in 2022 . Non - personnel costs amounted to 2,222 million euros in 2023 , compared to 2,095 million euros in 2022 . This represented 17.0 % of net revenue versus 16.7 % in 2022 . [They]1396-they comprised : Other operating expenses ( excluding pass - through costs , depreciation & amortization ) amounted to 1,740 million euros , compared to 1,560 million euros in 2022 . This represented 13.3 % of net revenue in 2023 compared to 12.4 % in 2022 . ( excluding pass - through costs , depreciation & amortization ) amounted to 1,740 million euros , compared to 1,560 million euros in 2022 . This represented 13.3 % of net revenue in 2023 compared to 12.4 % in 2022 . Depreciation and amortization expense was 482 million euros in 2023 , versus 535 million euros in 2022 , a reduction of 10 % or 53 million euros . It reflects the consolidation of [our]1397-our real estate footprint as well as an increase in the share of SaaS platforms used by [the Groupe]1398-the groupe and directly expensed . The operating margin amounted to 2,363 million euros , up +4.3 % compared to 2022 . This represents a margin rate of 18.0 % , stable versus 2022 . Operating margin rates by [region]1399-region were 19.0 % in [North America]43-north america , 17.7 % in [Europe]44-europe , 19.0 % in [Asia - Pacific]50-asia pacific , 6.7 % in [Latin America]91-latin america and 8.7 % in [the Middle East and Africa region]1383-the middle east and africa region . Amortization of intangibles arising from acquisitions totaled 268 million euro in 2023 , down 19 million euros from 287 million euros in 2022 . Impairment losses amounted to 153 million euros ( 109 million euros in 2022 ) , essentially related to the real estate consolidation plan " All in One "[1401-the teams] , which leads to a reduction in the number of sites , while allowing better collaboration between [the teams]1401-the teams . In addition , net non - current income is negative at 202 million euros in 2023 ( versus a negative 103 million euros in 2022 ) , largely reflecting a 203 million euros net charge related to the Rosetta settlement . A comprehensive resolution was reached with all 50 State Attorneys General , [the District of Columbia]1402-the district of columbia , and [certain U.S. territories related to past work undertaken for [opioid manufacturers]1404-opioid manufacturers]1403-certain u.s. territories related to past work undertaken for opioid manufacturers primarily by [former advertising agency Rosetta]1405-former advertising agency rosetta , bringing to a close almost three years of discussions . In the context of this settlement , following the payment of 343 million dollars to [the States]1406-the states , [Publicis Health]106-publicis health was compensated 130 million dollars by [[its]106-publicis health insurers]1407-its insurers . Consequently , [it]106-publicis health has recorded a non - recurring charge of 213 million dollars before tax in the fourth quarter of 2023 . In addition , 7 million dollars to be paid to [the Attorney Generals]1408-the attorney generals for the cost of investigation and other various costs have been accounted for . The total impact of the settlement before tax in the non - current income is a charge of 220 million dollars , corresponding to 203 million euros . This settlement , in which [the Attorneys General recognized Publicis Healthâs âgood faith and responsible corporate citizenshipâ]1409-the attorneys general recognized publicis healthâs âgood faith and responsible corporate citizenshipâ , is in no way an admission of wrongdoing or liability . Operating income totaled 1,740 million euros in 2023 , after 1,767 million euros in 2022 . The financial result , comprising the cost of net financial debt and other financial charges and income , was a charge of 21 million euros compared to a charge of 117 million euros in 2022 . The cost of net financial debt was an income of 78 million euros in 2023 compared to a charge of 17 million euros in 2022 . It included 99 million euros of interest largely related to Epsilonâs acquisition debt ( 102 million euros in 2022 ) , partly mitigated by financial income of 178 million euros , improving from 85 million euros in 2022 , largely reflecting higher remuneration on cash balances . was an income of 78 million euros in 2023 compared to a charge of 17 million euros in 2022 . It included 99 million euros of interest largely related to Epsilonâs acquisition debt ( 102 million euros in 2022 ) , partly mitigated by financial income of 178 million euros , improving from 85 million euros in 2022 , largely reflecting higher remuneration on cash balances . Other financial income and expenses were a charge of 99 million euros in 2023 , notably composed by 79 million euros interest on lease liabilities and 1 million in income from the fair value remeasurement of [Mutual Funds]107-mutual funds . In 2022 , other financial income and expenses were a charge of 100 million euros , notably composed of 87 million euros interest on lease liabilities and 9 million in income from the fair value remeasurement of [Mutual Funds]1410-mutual funds . The revaluation of earn - out payments amounted to an income of 12 million euros compared to a loss of 2 million euros in 2022 . The income tax charge was 415 million euros in 2023 , corresponding to an effective tax rate of 24.1 % . This compared to 431 million euros in 2022 , corresponding to an effective tax rate of 24.8 % . The share in profit of [associates]1411-associates was an income of 6 million euros ( versus an income of 5 million euros in 2022 ) . Minority interests were a gain of 10 million euros in 2023 , when they were negligible in 2022 . Overall , net income attributable to [the Groupe]1398-the groupe was 1,312 million euros in 2023 , an increase of 7.4 % compared to 1,222 million euros in 2022 . Finally , the Groupeâs earnings per share was 5.23 euros in 2023 , an increase of 7.4 % compared to 4.87 euros in 2022 . This included two main non - recurring cash outflows . TCJA , for a net impact of 107 million euros : In January 2023 , [the Groupe]108-the groupe proceeded to an additional 107 million euros cash payment related to 2022 fiscal year ( 110 million euros at 2022 USD / EUR exchange rate ) , reflecting the implementation of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act in the U.S. ( TCJA ) that was confirmed late December 2022 . This change in tax legislation requires [companies]1187-companies to capitalize and amortize U.S. R&D expenses over five years and has no impact on effective tax rate . Including this additional payment , the free cash flow for [the Groupe]108-the groupe was 1,700 million euros for 2022 . Rosetta settlement , for a net impact of 148 million euros . Adjusted for this settlement , the free cash flow for [the Groupe]1398-the groupe was 1,695 million euros for 2023 , in line with the guidance of the Groupe of close to 1.7 billion euros . Financial interests were an income of 93 million euros , compared to financial interest paid of 17 million euros in 2022 , reflecting higher remuneration on cash balances . 1 Adjusted for the net impact of the Rosetta settlement for 148 million euros in 2023 and the additional 107 million euros cash tax payment made in January 2023 relating to 2022 ( 110 million euros at 2022 rates ) . Repayment of lease liabilities and related interests amounted to 423 million euros in 2023 ( 404 million euros in 2022 ) . Net investments in fixed assets amounted to 178 million euros , decreasing by 16 million euros compared to 194 million euros in 2022 . Tax paid amounted to 669 million euros , compared to 430 million euros in 2022 , rising by 239 million euros of which 107 million euros were due to the additional TCJA tax payment realized in January 2023 and related to 2022 . Net debt [The Groupe]108-the groupe reported a net cash position of 909 million euros as of December 31 , 2023 compared to a 634 million euros net cash position as of December 31 , 2022 . The Groupe 's average net debt in 2023 amounted to 432 million euros , down from 685 million euros in 2022 . GROUPE AI STRATEGY On January 25 , 2024 , [the Groupe]108-the groupe announced [its]108-the groupe ambition to become the industryâs first AI - powered Intelligent System . In a presentation hosted by [Arthur Sadoun]796-arthur sadoun , [Chairman and CEO]1415-chairman and ceo , and Directoire+ members [Carla Serrano]801-carla serrano , [Chief Strategy Officer]1416-chief strategy officer , [Nigel Vaz]802-nigel vaz , [CEO Publicis Sapient]1417-ceo publicis sapient and [Dave Penski]803-dave penski , [CEO Publicis Media]1418-ceo publicis media , [the Groupe]1398-the groupe introduced CoreAI , which infuses a layer of AI across the Groupeâs platform organization to connect [its]108-the groupe enterprise knowledge under a single entity . Held at [the centre of [the Groupe]108-the groupe]1420-the centre of the groupe , [CoreAI]804-coreai unifies and standardizes Publicisâ expansive bank of proprietary data and combines this with 35 years of business transformation data and coding owned exclusively by [Publicis Sapient]797-publicis . CoreAI makes these assets shareable and accessible to everyone across [the Groupe]1398-the groupe , empowering [them]1422-them across five key disciplines : Insight , Media , Creative and Production , Software and Operations . [Publicis]797-publicis plans to invest 300 million euros in this strategy over the next three years . In 2024 , [the Groupe]1398-the groupe anticipates an investment of 100 million euros with 50 % dedicated to [people , focused on upskilling , training and recruitment]1424-people , focused on upskilling , training and recruitment , and 50 % to technology , through licenses , [IT software and cloud infrastructure]1425-it software and cloud infrastructure . This investment will be fully accounted for in the P&L. It will have no dilutive impact on the Groupeâs operating margin in 2024 as it will be funded by internal efficiencies . [It]1426-it will be slightly accretive on the operating margin in 2025 . [The Groupe]108-the groupe began engineering CoreAI in the second half of 2023 and plans to iteratively roll out capabilities in the first half of 2024 . [It]108-the groupe will present [MVPs]805-mvps at Viva Tech in May 2024 . ACQUISITIONS AND DISPOSALS On January 4 , 2023 , [Publicis]797-publicis announced the acquisition of [Yieldify]806-yieldify , [a London - based marketing technology company]1427-a london - based marketing technology company . Founded in 2013 , Yieldifyâs leading platform and service enable [companies]1187-companies to better personalize consumersâ website experiences , driving incremental revenue and other desired outcomes by delivering the right message at the right time based on [a consumer]1429-a consumer 's profile and stage in [their]1429-a consumer purchase journey . [Yieldify]806-yieldify will become part of [Epsilon]800-epsilon , and [its]806-yieldify onsite personalization , conversion optimization and customer journey offerings will complement Epsilon PeopleCloud to better address the mid - market . On January 10 , 2023 , [Publicis]797-publicis announced the acquisition of Advertise BG , one of [the leading performance marketing agencies in [Bulgaria]111-bulgaria]1430-the leading performance marketing agencies in bulgaria . The strategic acquisition will further reinforce Publicis Groupe Bulgariaâs competencies in digital transformation , adding firepower to [its]108-the groupe existing offering across digital strategy , data , social media , and digital content creation . On March 30 , 2023 , [Publicis]797-publicis announced the acquisition of Practia , based in [Buenos Aires]112-buenos aires , a leading [Latin America independent technology company and provider of digital business transformation services]1431-latin america independent technology company and provider of digital business transformation services . With [[its]108-the groupe 1,200 [experienced professionals]1433-experienced professionals]1432-its 1,200 experienced professionals , this acquisition will position Publicis Sapient to enter the [Latin America]91-latin america market while establishing a foundation for a nearshore delivery platform that will enable [the company]1085-the company to better service clients based in [North America]43-north america . On May 23 , 2023 , [Publicis]797-publicis announced the acquisition of full stake in [Publicis Sapient AI Labs]1435-publicis sapient ai labs , an innovative artificial intelligence research and development joint venture launched in 2020 in partnership between [Publicis Sapient]797-publicis , [Elder Research]1436-elder research and [Tquila]113-tquila . The acquisition will further strengthen Publicis Sapientâs data & AI capabilities and enable [the company]1085-the company to develop innovative solutions across industries for a wide range of applications , such as generative AI , natural language processing ( NLP ) , computer vision and autonomous systems . On June 5 , 2023 , [Publicis]797-publicis announced the acquisition of [Corra]115-corra , based in [New York]71-new york , [an ecommerce leader recognized by [Adobe]114-adobe]1438-an ecommerce leader recognized by adobe as [one of [the top commerce firms in [North America]43-north america]1440-the top commerce firms in north america]1439-one of the top commerce firms in north america . [Corra]115-corra will augment Publicis Sapientâs existing expertise in commerce solutions , including Adobe Commerce , while extending Publicis Sapientâs offerings in digital and omnichannel commerce . By acquiring [Corra]115-corra , Publicis Sapient will further establish [itself]797-publicis as a global leader across the entire [Adobe Product Suite]1441-adobe product suite , in addition to further cementing [its]797-publicis already leading capabilities . On June 15 , 2023 , [Publicis]797-publicis and [Carrefour]808-carrefour announced the launch of [[their]1442-their joint venture [Unlimitail]116-unlimitail]1443-their joint venture unlimitail , to address the booming retail media market in [Continental Europe]117-continental europe , [Brazil]104-brazil and [Argentina]101-argentina . The launch of [the company]1085-the company comes six months after the initiative was announced and has been unveiled during Viva Tech . [Unlimitail]116-unlimitail will partner with [retailers]1445-retailers and [brands]1446-brands , bringing the scale , connectivity and consistency for retail media to reach its full potential in those geographies . It is built on the most advanced technologies , âCitrusAd powered by [Epsilonâ]809-epsilonâ , and the deepest retail expertise from [Carrefour]808-carrefour . [Unlimitail]116-unlimitail has already converted [[its]116-unlimitail first 13 retail partners]1447-its first 13 retail partners , representing together more than [120 million loyalty customers]1448-120 million loyalty customers . OUTLOOK While the macroeconomic context remains uncertain as [we]1449-we enter 2024 , [the Groupe]108-the groupe is confident in [its]108-the groupe ability to deliver profitable growth that outperforms the market . For the full year 2024 , [the Groupe]108-the groupe aims at delivering a 4 % to 5 % organic growth . [Publicis]797-publicis intends to achieve a solid +4 % despite the macroeconomic challenges that currently affect classic advertising and delay business transformation projects . Organic growth could reach +5 % assuming an improvement in global conditions in the second half of the year . In Q1 2024 , [the Groupe]1398-the groupe expects to deliver organic growth within the full year range . [The Groupe]108-the groupe expects to maintain financial ratios again in 2024 at historical highs , including : Operating margin at 18 % . This includes the Groupeâs Opex investment of 100 million euros in [its]108-the groupe AI plan . . This includes the Groupeâs Opex investment of 100 million euros in [its]108-the groupe AI plan . Free cash flow between 1.8 and 1.9 billion euros1 in 2024 . GROUPE CSR POLICY IN 2023 With a view to the entry into force in 2025 of the European CSRD ( Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive ) , which requires [companies to carry out in - depth sustainability work]1456-companies to carry out in - depth sustainability work , in 2023 [Publicis Groupe]81-publicis groupe launched internal projects to prepare the required double materiality exercise , as well as the expected level of granularity for the 12 themes set out in the ESRS ( European Sustainability Reporting Standards ) . ESG risk mapping has been presented to [the Audit Committee]119-the audit committee and [the ESG Committee of the Supervisory Board]1457-the esg committee of the supervisory board . CSR was one of the themes discussed with [employees]1458-employees at the fourth Viva la Difference internal seminar , which brought together [virtually all [the Groupe]1398-the groupe 's employees]1459-virtually all the groupe 's employees in December 2023 to review the year and look ahead to 2024 . This seminar provided an opportunity to detail [the Groupe]108-the groupe 's strategic ambitions in terms of artificial intelligence and its application to [the Groupe 's various businesses]1461-the groupe 's various businesses . This was followed by a day of internal round - table discussions with [each region]1462-each region , to enable [Top Management]1463-top management to respond at greater length to any questions [employees]1458-employees might have . E â Environment & the fight against Climate Change The Groupe 's climate targets , validated by SBTi ( [Science Based Targets Initiative]1465-science based targets initiative ) , outline a trajectory to reduce carbon emissions by 50 % by 2030 ( Near - Term Target - Scopes 1 + 2 + 3 ) and by 90 % by 2040 ( Long - Term Target - Scopes 1 + 2 + 3 ) . [The Groupe]108-the groupe remains aligned with the Paris Agreement and the 1.5Â ° scenario , and continues to focus all [its]108-the groupe efforts on drastically reducing carbon emissions . In terms of direct - source renewable energies , [the Groupe]108-the groupe is making progress towards [its]108-the groupe target of 100 % by 2030 , having reached the 2023 milestone at over 50 % . Reducing all environmental impacts remains the absolute priority , and various initiatives have been launched to strengthen direct and indirect action levers . In view of the residual unavoidable carbon emissions , and to anticipate [the Groupe]108-the groupe 's future needs to achieve Net Zero by 2040 , [Publicis Groupe]81-publicis groupe has joined [the Climate Fund for Nature]1466-the climate fund for nature ( [Mirova]811-mirova / Natixis ) . [The fund]1467-the fund will support projects dedicated to the protection and restoration of nature with associated benefits for biodiversity and communities . This represents a commitment of â¬20 million for the delivery of voluntary carbon credits over fifteen years . Following on from the work carried out in 2022 on climate risks , an ad hoc project was carried out in 2023 to analyse the impact on biodiversity , with the support of [an external consultancy]1468-an external consultancy . S â Social , Diversity , Equity and Inclusion The end of 2023 was marked by the Hamas attacks in [Israel]120-israel , where [the Groupe]1398-the groupe has [some 440 employees]1470-some 440 employees . The absolute priority was to ensure the safety of [the teams]1401-the teams and [[their]1401-the teams families]1472-their families , as had been the case in February 2022 during the Russian invasion of [Ukraine]121-ukraine . These wars disrupt many lives and each time [we]1473-we have to put in place tailor - made measures to help [[our]1473-we employees]1474-our employees . In [Ukraine]121-ukraine , [the Groupe]108-the groupe has continued to pay the salaries of [local teams]1475-local teams in 2023 , as it did in 2022 . Donations made by [employees]1458-employees and the Groupe to [a fund dedicated to [employees]1458-employees and [[their]1458-employees families in [Ukraine]121-ukraine]1479-their families in ukraine]1477-a fund dedicated to employees and their families in ukraine have helped [32 families]1480-32 families since July 2022 . By the end of 2023 , the international # WorkingWithCancer programme launched by [the Chairman of the Directoire to combat the taboo of cancer in [the workplace]1482-the workplace]1481-the chairman of the directoire to combat the taboo of cancer in the workplace had been signed up by [1,500 companies]1483-1,500 companies , representing [40 million employees worldwide]1484-40 million employees worldwide . [The Groupe]108-the groupe 's objective of having [45 % women in key positions of responsibility within [the Groupe]108-the groupe]1485-45 % women in key positions of responsibility within the groupe by 2025 , with a target of 43 % by 2023 , has been achieved . In [the United States]1084-the united states , [the United Kingdom]1487-the united kingdom , [France]58-france , [India]47-india and [many other countries]1488-many other countries , efforts have continued to focus on more open and inclusive recruitment , in particular for [young people who are far removed from [[our]1490-our businesses]1491-our businesses , with several programmes , such as the MCTP for the 14th year in [the United States]122-the united states , or Publicis Track in [France]58-france]1489-young people who are far removed from our businesses , with several programmes , such as the mctp for the 14th year in the united states , or publicis track in france . The diversity and inclusion programmes in place in [the United States]122-the united states were presented to [the ESG Committee]123-the esg committee . In terms of training , [the Marcel Classes platform]1492-the marcel classes platform has stepped up [its]1492-the marcel classes platform personalised support for [employees]1458-employees with the Growth Dashboard . In October 2023 , the organisation of remote working was specified for 2024 , requiring [everyone]1494-everyone to be in [the office]1495-the office three days a week , in order to give priority to interpersonal relations in situ and encourage team cooperation . Since May 1896 , the iconic Dow Jones Industrial Average ( ^DJI -0.18 % ) has served as one of the most - watched barometers of [Wall Street]134-wall street 's health . What was once an index of [12 mostly industrial components]1540-12 mostly industrial components has evolved into an index containing [30 relatively diverse , historically profitable , multinational businesses]1541-30 relatively diverse , historically profitable , multinational businesses . Unfortunately , diversification does n't fix the Dow Jones Industrial Average 's biggest flaw : its point - weighted structure . Whereas the benchmark S&P 500 is a market cap - weighted index -- i.e. , [larger companies ( by market cap]1542-larger companies ( by market cap ) exert greater influence -- [the Dow Jones]815-the dow is a price - weighted index . In other words , share price , not market cap , is all that matters . As of this past August , [the Dow 's divisor]1543-the dow 's divisor was 0.15172752595384 . In simpler terms , every dollar in share price equates to about 6.59 Dow points . Thus , if a Dow component gains or loses $ 1 in share price , the Dow Jones Industrial Average rises or falls by 6.59 points . An example of this price - weighted inefficiency can be seen in [tech stock Apple , which is currently the second - largest publicly traded company at a market cap of $ 2.9 trillion]1544-tech stock apple , which is currently the second - largest publicly traded company at a market cap of $ 2.9 trillion . However , [it]1544-tech stock apple , which is currently the second - largest publicly traded company at a market cap of $ 2.9 trillion only has the 14th - highest share price among [the Dow 's 30 components]1545-the dow 's 30 components . Thus , [Apple]780-apple has less influence in the Dow than [aerospace and building technologies company Honeywell International]1546-aerospace and building technologies company honeywell international , which has a market cap of " just "[780-apple] $ 127 billion , or around 4 % that of [Apple]780-apple . The five Dow components with the lowest share prices in the ageless index -- [Walgreens Boots Alliance]135-walgreens boots alliance , [Verizon Communications , Intel , Cisco Systems]1547-verizon communications , intel , cisco systems , and [Dow Inc.]136-dow inc. -- collectively account for just 3.6 % of [its]132-digital alpha weighting . By comparison , the following five stocks add up to almost 34 % of [its]132-digital alpha weighting ( as of Feb. 2 , 2024 ) . [UnitedHealth Group]1548-unitedhealth group : 8.70 % weighting in the Dow Sporting a share price north of $ 510 as of the closing bell on Feb. 2 , [health insurance and healthcare services company UnitedHealth Group]1549-health insurance and healthcare services company unitedhealth group ( UNH -0.07 % ) accounted for almost 3,363 Dow points by [itself]1548-unitedhealth group . If [you]1550-you 're wondering why UnitedHealth has n't split [its]1548-unitedhealth group stock , giving up its importance within the Dow might be a key reason . [Most people]1551-most people are familiar with [UnitedHealth Group]137-unitedhealth group because of [its]137-unitedhealth group consumer - facing insurance operations . Although the Affordable Care Act has somewhat crimped the ability of [health insurers]1552-health insurers to raise premiums , [UnitedHealth]816-unitedhealth is still generating plenty of profit from this segment . The real bread - and - butter growth driver for [UnitedHealth]816-unitedhealth has been [[its]816-unitedhealth Optum subsidiary]1553-its optum subsidiary . Optum is divided into three operating segments and is responsible for everything from pharmacy services and care management to the software used by [[hospitals]1239-hospitals and [care centers]1556-care centers]1555-hospitals and care centers . [It]1557-it 's [a considerably faster - growing division that 's generating a consistently juicier operating margin than [[UnitedHealth]816-unitedhealth 's insurance operations]1559-unitedhealth 's insurance operations]1558-a considerably faster - growing division that 's generating a consistently juicier operating margin than unitedhealth 's insurance operations . [Microsoft]768-microsoft : 7.01 % weighting [The largest publicly traded company by market cap , Microsoft ( MSFT -0.71 % )]1560-the largest publicly traded company by market cap , microsoft ( msft -0.71 % ) , is the second - most - influential Dow component . A closing price above $ 411 per share as of Feb. 2 means [it]768-microsoft accounts for around 2,710 Dow points . As [I]0-i 've pointed out in the past , [Microsoft]768-microsoft 's undeniable success is a reflection of [its]768-microsoft blending of the old and the new . Today , the tech titan is being fueled by [dominant cloud infrastructure service Azure]1561-dominant cloud infrastructure service azure , as well as [its]768-microsoft aggressive investments in OpenAI and seemingly all things artificial intelligence ( AI ) . Enterprise spending on the cloud and AI is still in its relative infancy , which offers hope that [Azure]139-azure can sustain a double - digit growth rate for a long time to come . At the same time , [Microsoft]768-microsoft 's legacy segments remain important . For instance , even though Windows is n't the growth story it was 25 years ago , it 's still the dominant operating system on [desktops worldwide]1562-desktops worldwide . The high - margin cash flow [Microsoft]768-microsoft generates from [its]768-microsoft legacy products is what fuels investments in fast - paced initiatives , as well as earnings - accretive acquisitions . [Goldman Sachs]140-goldman sachs : 6.61 % weighting [Global investment banking giant Goldman Sachs]1563-global investment banking giant goldman sachs ( GS -0.37 % ) exerts the third - largest influence within the widely followed Dow Jones . A nearly $ 388 share price as of Feb. 2 means [Goldman Sachs]140-goldman sachs is singlehandedly responsible for 2,556 Dow points . History is the big catalyst that 's long worked in [Goldman Sachs]140-goldman sachs ' favor . Even though recessions are an inevitable part of the U.S. and [global economies]1564-global economies , history shows that economic downturns do n't last long . Only three of the 12 recessions that have taken place in [the U.S.]141-the u.s. since the end of World War II reached 12 months in duration , with none surpassing 18 months . Meanwhile , periods of expansion usually last for years . These long - tailed expansions allow [Goldman Sachs]140-goldman sachs to take advantage of merger - and - acquisition activity and [businesses]1180-businesses ' desire to borrow . [Goldman Sachs]140-goldman sachs has also done a good job of reining in costs over the past year . [It]140-goldman sachs 's aiming to reduce [its]140-goldman sachs annual operating expenses by $ 1 billion through combination of job cuts and a willingness to let go of business segments that are n't working out . This is why [it]140-goldman sachs sold buy now , pay later service [GreenSky]818-greensky to a consortium of investors at [Sixth Street]142-sixth street in October . [Home Depot]1566-home depot : 6.09 % weighting The Dow component with the fourth - highest weighting is none other than [do - it - yourself home improvement chain [Home Depot]1566-home depot]1567-do - it - yourself home improvement chain home depot ( HD -0.85 % ) . Based on a closing share price of more than $ 357 on Feb. 2 , [Home Depot]143-home depot accounted for roughly 2,354 Dow points . The beauty of [Home Depot]143-home depot 's operating model is that it tends to benefit no matter what 's going on with [the U.S. housing market]1569-the u.s. housing market . If the U.S. economy is booming and [home]1570-home prices are rising , it 's liable to see healthy gains from [contractors]1571-contractors and [its]143-home depot enterprise - facing segments . Meanwhile , if mortgage rates are increasing and/or there 's uncertainty in the housing market , [Home Depot]143-home depot benefits from [homeowners]1572-homeowners upgrading or renovating [[their]1572-homeowners existing homes]1573-their existing homes . Furthermore , [Home Depot]1566-home depot 's aggressive investments in digitization are paying off handsomely . [The company]1085-the company 's efforts to create a seamless omnichannel shopping experience have led [more consumers]1576-more consumers to buy products online and book high - margin projects completed by [professionals]1577-professionals . [It]1578-it 's also investing in AI and machine learning tools to improve inventory management and streamline the ordering process . [Amgen]819-amgen : 5.51 % weighting The stock with the fifth - highest weighting the Dow Jones Industrial Average is [biotech company Amgen]819-amgen ( AMGN 0.33 % ) . [Amgen]819-amgen 's roughly $ 323 share price as of Feb. 2 equates to about 2,130 Dow points . Altogether , [UnitedHealth Group]137-unitedhealth group , [Microsoft]768-microsoft , [Goldman Sachs]140-goldman sachs , [Home Depot]1566-home depot , and [Amgen]819-amgen were responsible for 13,113 Dow points as of the end of last week . A big reason for [Amgen]819-amgen 's long - term success is the simple fact that healthcare is a very defensive sector . Since [we]1580-our ca n't control when [we]1580-our become ill or what ailments [we]1580-our develop , demand for prescription drugs tends to be constant in any economic climate . This means relatively predictable cash flow and a transparent growth outlook for [a drug developer with a broad portfolio of products]1581-a drug developer with a broad portfolio of products . Innovation is the other force behind [Amgen]819-amgen 's steady long - term climb . Even though it 's no longer growing at the same rapid clip it was 15 years ago , [it]819-amgen 's still enjoying double - digit unit volume growth for [its]819-amgen therapies . Examples include hyperlipidemia treatment Repatha , which saw worldwide sales and unit growth of 31 % and 44 % , respectively , in the quarter ending in September , as well as severe asthma treatment Tezspire , whose sales nearly tripled in Q3 from the prior - year period .

[We]1580-our believe [our]1580-our positive peer group performance is due both to [our]1580-our strategy and [our]1580-our turnaround execution . And across all products for [Large Enterprise and [Public Sector customers]1627-public sector customers]1626-large enterprise and public sector customers , [we]1580-our 're already seeing a 17 - point year - over - year improvement in net promoter scores based on [our]1580-our process improvement work . Time to talk about innovation , innovating for growth . As [we]1580-our announced last month , [Dr. Satish Lakshmanan]826-satish , joined [Lumen]824-lumen as [[our]1580-our chief product officer]1628-our chief product officer . [Our]1580-our vision is to empower [enterprises]1637-enterprises to leverage the Lumen digital platform as [we]1580-our are calling it , enabling [customers]1091-customers to digitally consume [our]1580-our secured network services . This innovative platform will help [customers]1091-customers build AI - powered applications across on - prem , colo and cloud environments seamlessly , while also simplifying network on - boarding and management to save costs . [Chris Stansbury]823-chris stansbury -- [Executive Vice President]1658-executive vice president and [Chief Financial Officer]1659-chief financial officer Thanks [Kate]822-kate , and good afternoon , [everyone]1494-everyone . [Kate]822-kate spoke about [our]1580-our progress and how [we]1580-our are disrupting an industry ripe for change as [Lumen]824-lumen transforms into [the leading digital enterprise solutions provider]1661-the leading digital enterprise solutions provider . [She]822-kate also spoke of [our]1580-our success in reaching agreement on an amended TSA with [a broadened group of [creditors]1663-creditors]1662-a broadened group of creditors to extend [our]1580-our debt maturities . On [our]1580-our Q2 earnings call , [we]1580-our said [we]1580-our viewed the formation of [the creditor group]1664-the creditor group as an opportunity to address a large part of the capital structure in a very efficient way , and the amended agreement [we]1580-our announced in January accomplishes that . [The amended TSA]154-the amended tsa has support from [a broadened group of creditors]1662-a broadened group of creditors , and when finalized , will address approximately $ 9 billion of outstanding indebtedness , including more than 77 % of debt maturing through 2027 . The TSA transactions will extend debt maturities to primarily 2029 and beyond , provide $ 1.325 billion of new money , and provide access to a new approximately $ 1 billion revolver . This agreement and the broad support for it speaks to the confidence [[our]1580-our banks]1666-our banks and [creditors]1663-creditors have in [our]1580-our plan and provides [Lumen]828-lumen ample runway to execute on [our]1580-our business turnaround . In short , [our]1580-our capital structure is no longer a limiting factor in [our]1580-our transformation . [We]1580-our expect to complete the transactions contemplated by [the TSA]154-the amended tsa in the first quarter subject to the satisfaction of limited remaining closing conditions . Before covering [our]1580-our fourth quarter results , [I]0-i 'd like to take a moment to discuss some changes to [our]1580-our 2024 financial reporting to enhance comparability with prior periods and better align with how [we]1580-our manage the business . First , [we]1580-our are updating [our]1580-our business sales channel reporting by breaking out a new international and other channel , including CDN . Secondly , given the sale of substantially all of [our]1580-our CDN contracts during the fourth quarter of ' 23 , [we]1580-our are updating [our]1580-our business product category reporting to move CDN from harvest to other within [the international and other channel]1668-the international and other channel . And finally , with the sale of [our]1580-our EMEA business and select CDN contracts completed in the fourth quarter of ' 23 , [we]1580-our have updated [our]1580-our financial trending schedules to provide the historical contributions of these sales , as well as the associated commercial agreement impacts . Keep in mind , when these impacts are excluded from results , [our]1580-our sequential and year - over - year growth rates are substantially better than the reported rates . [I'll]0-i now discuss the financial summary of [our]1580-our fourth quarter . [Our]1580-our fourth quarter total reported revenue declined 7.4 % year over year to $ 3.517 billion . Approximately 39 % of the decline was due to the impact of divestitures , commercial agreements and [CDN]829-cdn . Adjusted EBITDA was $ 1.099 billion in the fourth quarter with a 31.2 % margin . Free cash flow was $ 50 million in the fourth quarter . In 2023 , [we]1580-our delivered on [our]1580-our expectations for both adjusted EBITDA and free cash flow . Next , [I]0-i 'll review [our]1580-our detailed revenue results for the quarter on a year - over - year basis . Within [[our]1580-our North America Enterprise channels]156-our north america enterprise channels , which is [our]1580-our business segment excluding wholesale and international and other , revenue declined 0.1 % . This quarter , [we]1580-our had a Public Sector benefit in [our]1580-our other product group . As a reminder , [our]1580-our other category tends to fluctuate quarter to quarter given the nature of these revenue streams . Overall , [North America]43-north america business declined 3.5 % . [We]1580-our again significantly outperformed [[our]1580-our two largest historical competitors]1669-our two largest historical competitors in the fourth quarter . While results can vary in any given quarter , [we]1580-our expect this trend of divergence between performance at [Lumen]824-lumen and [the legacy business wireline providers]1670-the legacy business wireline providers to continue to widen over time as [we]1580-our expand [our]1580-our digital service offerings . Large Enterprise revenue declined 3.6 % in the fourth quarter . Large Enterprise revenue was impacted by lower other product revenue and also the timing of large infrastructure revenue benefiting the year ago quarter . [Our]1580-our year - over - year growth rate within Grow moderated . [We]1580-our expect continued variability in trends as [we]1580-our drive toward overall stabilization . Now , moving on to mid - markets . Revenue declined 6 % year over year . [Mid - markets]1671-mid - markets is a very important channel for [us]1580-our , and one where [we]1580-our had lost considerable share prior to [our]1580-our focus and investment in this important area . [We]1580-our are leaning into this channel with products and buying tools to make ordering and provisioning more frictionless . As [Kate]822-kate mentioned , [we]1580-our 're seeing improved leading indicators and are taking share in both IP and SASE products . This is a channel that [we]1580-our expect will be extremely interested in [our]1580-our NaaS offering given the flexibility and ease of provisioning it provides . Public Sector revenue grew 14.8 % year over year . Trends improved , driven primarily by continued Strength in Grow revenue , moderating declines in Nurture and higher other revenue as mentioned earlier . Over the past 12 to 18 months , [investors]1102-investors have asked [us]1580-our when [we]1580-our will start to see the benefits of the big contracts signed with [the USDA]157-the usda , [the US Postal Service]1673-the us postal service , [the Department of Defense and other Public Sector]1674-the department of defense and other public sector wins . As [our]1580-our results demonstrate , [we]1580-our are seeing revenue strength in part due to those and other deals ramping as [we]1580-our work diligently to deploy these mission critical services . Given [our]1580-our visibility to sales bookings and the longer install cycles related to the complexity of the solutions [we]1580-our 're deploying within [Public Sector]1675-public sector , [we]1580-our have high confidence that [we]1580-our 'll be [the first sales channel to return to sustainable growth]1676-the first sales channel to return to sustainable growth . Wholesale revenue declined 11.2 % year over year . The majority of wholesale represents the balance of trade with other carriers as [we]1580-our negotiate with each other on buy - side and sell - side arrangements . The historical industry behavior between [carriers]1677-carriers has been to leverage pricing and rate changes to drive results instead of delivering incremental value to [customers]1091-customers . In [our]1580-our opinion , these actions are often to the detriment of [[the industry]1133-the industry 's customers]1680-the industry 's customers and is also generally unhealthy for [the industry]1133-the industry , while also creating volatility in [our]1580-our and others results . Within wholesale , approximately 39 % of [our]1580-our revenue comes from Harvest products , which declined 15.9 % year over year in the fourth quarter and contributed to a majority of the 11.2 % decline . [Our]1580-our Harvest product revenue will likely continue to decline over time and is an area [we]1580-our will continue to manage for cash . International and other revenue declined 43.5 % year over year , driven by the divestiture of [[our]1580-our EMEA business]1682-our emea business and the sale of select CDN contracts in the fourth quarter of ' 23 . Moving to [our]1580-our business product lifecycle reporting , [I]0-i 'll reference results based on [our]1580-our North America Enterprise channels which represent [our]1580-our core strategic categories . Grow products revenue increased 5.7 % , driven by Strength in IP across all enterprise channels , cloud services and infrastructure product growth , particularly within colocation and dark fiber . [Grow]1683-grow represented approximately 40 % of [our]1580-our North America Enterprise revenue and for [our]1580-our total business segment carried an approximate 80 % direct margin this quarter . Within Nurture and Harvest , [we]1580-our continue to expect headwinds in these categories as [we]1580-our take proactive steps to migrate [customers]1091-customers to newer technologies . These actions improve [[our]1580-our customers]1599-our customers experience and provide an uplift in customer lifetime value for [Lumen]828-lumen . As [Kate]822-kate mentioned , [we]1580-our continue to see positive leading indicators that [our]1580-our initiatives are working , and it will take some time to be reflected in [our]1580-our results . Nurture products revenue declined 9.7 % year over year . Pressure within VPN and Ethernet services drove the decline . Nurture represents about 30 % of [our]1580-our North America Enterprise revenue and for [our]1580-our total business segment carried an approximate 69 % direct margin this quarter . Harvest products revenue declined 10.4 % year over year . Harvest continues to be negatively impacted by declines in TDM - based voice and other legacy services . Now , [I]0-i want to take a minute to discuss Harvest in more detail . [We]1580-our have a very tactical approach to [our]1580-our Harvest portfolio , which contains a mixture of [customers that are on - net , as well as off - net]1686-customers that are on - net , as well as off - net . These off - net customer contracts carry a much different margin profile and in some cases are margin dilutive . [We]1580-our utilize rerates to manage the margin , and in some cases , this can result in non - regrettable churn . In other cases , [we]1580-our will seek to migrate [customers]1091-customers to [[our]1580-our newer Grow technologies]1688-our newer grow technologies . [Another set of customers within [Harvest]1690-harvest]1689-another set of customers within harvest are quite profitable and [their]1689-another set of customers within harvest needs can be met with existing services . [Our]1580-our data - driven approach drives [our]1580-our product migration and pricing strategies for [each of [these customers]1608-these customers]1691-each of these customers , enabling [us]1580-our to optimize [our]1580-our return profile . [Harvest]830-harvest represented less than 17 % of [our]1580-our North America Enterprise revenue in the fourth quarter , an improvement of approximately 200 basis points year over year . For [our]1580-our total business segment , it carrying approximate 81 % direct margin this quarter . Other products revenue grew 31.7 % . As [I]0-i mentioned earlier , [Public Sector]1675-public sector showed particular strength in this product set . Now , moving on to mass markets . Revenue declined 8.3 % year over year . [Our]1580-our mass markets fiber broadband revenue grew 11.5 % and represented approximately a third of mass markets broadband revenue . Also , note that [our]1580-our exposure to legacy voice and other services revenue continues to improve with an approximate 200 basis point reduction year over year . During the quarter , fiber broadband enabled location adds were 126,000 , bringing [our]1580-our total to approximately 3.7 million as of December 31st . As [Kate]1694-kate mentioned , [we]1580-our intend to maintain the same 500,000 build pace this year . And during the fourth quarter [we]1580-our added [20,000 Quantum Fiber customers]1695-20,000 quantum fiber customers and this brings [our]1580-our total to 916,000 . Fiber ARPU was flat sequentially and increased on a year - over - year basis to approximately $ 61 in the fourth quarter . At the end of the quarter , [our]1580-our penetration of legacy copper broadband was approximately 10 % and [our]1580-our Quantum Fiber penetration stood at approximately 25 % . [Our]1580-our 12 - month frozen penetration of [our]1580-our 2022 enablement cohort was 18 % at December 31st , while [our]1580-our 24 - month frozen penetration of [our]1580-our 2021 enablement cohort was 25 % . Turning to adjusted EBITDA . For the fourth quarter of 2023 , adjusted EBITDA was $ 1.099 billion compared to $ 1.393 billion in the year ago quarter . The fourth quarter of this year included a net headwind of $ 13 million related to the divested EMEA business , a net benefit of $ 3 million from divestiture - related post - closing commercial agreements , and a net headwind of $ 16 million from the sale of select CDN contracts . These items represent approximately 9 % of the year - over - year decline . Special items impacting adjusted EBITDA this quarter totaled $ 211 million . [Our]1580-our fourth quarter 2023 adjusted EBITDA margin was 31.2 % . Capital expenditures for the fourth quarter of 2023 were $ 821 million and [the company]1085-the company generated free cash flow of $ 50 million in the fourth quarter . Moving to [our]1580-our financial outlook . For the full year 2024 , [we]1580-our expect adjusted EBITDA to be in the range of $ 4.1 billion to $ 4.3 billion . [Our]1580-our EBITDA guidance includes an expected 2 % to 5 % organic decline , a significant and roughly 600 basis point improvement from the organic decline included in [our]1580-our 2023 outlook as [our]1580-our transformation initiatives take hold . Moving to capital spending and [our]1580-our other outlook metrics . For the full year 2024 , [we]1580-our expect total capital expenditures in the range of $ 2.7 billion to $ 2.9 billion . [We]1580-our expect to generate free cash flow in the range of $ 100 million to $ 300 million for the full year of 2024 , and this includes an approximate $ 700 million tax refund received during the first quarter of this year . [We]1580-our expect free cash flow to be impacted by higher interest expense related to [our]1580-our new TSA agreement , and based on [our]1580-our initial analysis , [we]1580-our 've included an incremental $ 125 million to $ 225 million of cash interest in 2024 versus 2023 . [We]1580-our do not have any required or planned discretionary pension fund contributions in 2024 . In terms of special items for 2024 , [we]1580-our continue to expect dedicated third party costs to support transition services for the divestitures . The reimbursement for these services will be in other income with no material net impact to [our]1580-our cash flows . In addition , in the first quarter of 2024 , [we]1580-our expect to recognize meaningful charges related to the negotiation and execution of [our]1580-our TSA agreement . This growth trajectory underscores the escalating threat posed by BEC attacks and the pressing need for robust cybersecurity measures to combat them effectively . [Cisco]761-cisco is introducing an industry - first approach that brings together identity , networking and security to better protect organizations ' complex identity stack against increasingly sophisticated attacker techniques . Today there is blind trust between authentication and access solutions , and [threat actors]1747-threat actors have successfully compromised [some of the largest organizations in [the world]1147-the world]1766-some of the largest organizations in the world in 2023 by targeting these weaknesses . In fact , more than 26 % of all Cisco Talos Incident Response engagements in 2023 involved [adversaries]1768-adversaries using compromised credentials on valid accounts . [A user]1744-a user is often mapped to many digital identities and accounts - drastically increasing entry points for [attackers]1770-attackers and the possibility of lateral movement " across "[1091-customers] identities . Too often legacy permissions have not been removed , and [security teams]1771-security teams are missing crucial context about historical identity behavior , actions across systems and current risk levels that are needed to make trusted access decisions . Cisco Identity Intelligence runs on top of [[customers]1091-customers ' existing identity stores]1773-customers ' existing identity stores and provides unified visibility , as well as AI - driven analytics . [Customers]1091-customers can discover [their]1091-customers whole identity population , clean up vulnerable accounts , eliminate unused and risky privileges , detect behavior anomalies and block high - risk access attempts â without ripping and replacing [their]1091-customers current solutions . While multifactor authentication ( MFA ) remains a critical first line of defense against identity - based attacks , [malicious actors]1775-malicious actors are using new and creative ways to steal credentials . According to the 2024 Duo Trusted Access Report , [Cisco Duo]761-cisco processed 16 billion authentications in 2023 , up 41 % annually , and saw weaker forms of MFA like SMS and phone calls dip to an all - time low of 5 % , yet the volume of identity attacks is higher than ever . " Identity is the fabric that connects [humans]4791-humans , devices and applications in the workplace , and has become an easy target for modern cybersecurity attacks . Learning From The Past The early 2000s tech bubble serves as a stark reminder of the risks of overestimating market potential . In March 2000 , companies like [Microsoft]768-microsoft , [Cisco Systems Inc. CSCO]189-cisco systems inc. csco , [General Electric Inc. GE]1862-general electric inc. ge , [Intel Corp. INTC]190-intel corp. intc and Exxon [Mobil Corp. XOM]191-mobil corp. xom were expected to see sales grow at a 16 % compound annual growth rate over the following two years . Instead , [their]1855-these tech giants growth capped at 8 % , leading to a 21 - percentage - point underperformance against the S&P 500 over the subsequent 24 months . While the Magnificent Sevenâs future growth prospects appear robust , driven by significant sales increases and market dominance , the cautionary tales of the past remind [investors]1102-investors of the importance of approaching consensus estimates with a critical eye . WebRTC solutions enable instant , high - quality video conferencing directly through web or mobile applications , without requiring additional downloads .
