The disputed technology involves logging , inspecting , and filtering data packets based on a set of rules to distinguish legitimate traffic from malicious access . âWe respectfully disagree with the juryâs decision , which [we]1928-we believe is contrary to both the law and the extensive evidence [we]1928-we presented at trial , â [a spokesperson for Palo Alto Networks]1929-a spokesperson for palo alto networks told the WSJ . Wall Street]134-wall street turned in a banner performance in 2023 . When the curtain closed , the Dow Jones Industrial Average had managed to hit multiple record highs , while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite shot higher by 24 % and 43 % , respectively . A fresh bull market has emerged , and growth stocks are to thank for it . Although [the " Magnificent Seven "]4824-the " magnificent seven "[848-michael hartnett] have collectively taken credit for the outperformance of the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite since the start of 2023 , no megacap growth stock has stood out more than [semiconductor company Nvidia]1932-semiconductor company nvidia ( NVDA -5.55 % ) . Shares have skyrocketed more than 327 % in less than 13 months , with [the company]1085-the company tacking on more than $ 1 trillion in market value . Headwinds are mounting for Nvidia Nvidia 's outperformance is a reflection of [the company]1085-the company becoming the infrastructure backbone of [the artificial - intelligence ( AI ) movement]1935-the artificial - intelligence ( ai ) movement . [[The company]1085-the company 's A100 and H100 graphics processing units]1937-the company 's a100 and h100 graphics processing units ( GPUs ) are expected to account for up to 90 % of the GPUs being put to work in [high - compute data centers]1938-high - compute data centers in 2024 . In particular , [Nvidia]16-nvidia 's pricing power with [its]16-nvidia AI - focused GPUs has been off the charts due to GPU scarcity . This phenomenal pricing power has been a big help to [Nvidia]16-nvidia 's gross margin , given that [its]16-nvidia cost of revenue has moved only modestly higher . But this top - performing megacap stock is set to face mounting headwinds in 2024 ( and beyond ) . Ironically , ramping up production of [its]16-nvidia A100 and H100 chips is likely to be a net negative for [its]16-nvidia gross margin . A substantial uptick in GPU production will reduce AI - GPU scarcity and diminish [the company]1085-the company 's pricing power . At the same time , competition in [AI - inspired GPUs]1940-ai - inspired gpus will progressively increase . Advanced Micro Devices and [Intel]864-intel know a thing or two about innovation and data center operations . [Both companies]1941-both companies are direct competitors to [[Nvidia]16-nvidia 's high - compute data center]1942-nvidia 's high - compute data center dominance . [I]0-i 'll also add that U.S. regulators are doing [Nvidia]16-nvidia no favors . On two separate occasions , regulators have imposed restrictions on what chips [the company]1085-the company can export to [China]5-china , [[the world]1147-the world 's No . 2 economy]1945-the world 's no . 2 economy by gross domestic product . Even GPUs that [Nvidia]16-nvidia designed specifically for [China]5-china have been restricted . These export limitations could cost [Nvidia]16-nvidia billions of dollars in potential sales each quarter . Lastly , every next - big - thing investment over the past three decades has eventually gone through an initial bubble period . [Wall Street]134-wall street and [investors]1102-investors historically overestimate the uptake of new technologies and innovations . AI is unlikely to be the exception to this rule , which means [Nvidia]16-nvidia could be in for a challenging year . These two high - octane growth stocks offer substantially more upside than Nvidia Although [Nvidia]16-nvidia has proved [me]0-i and [other skeptics]1947-other skeptics wrong through the first month of 2024 , there are enough red flags to suggest [investors]1102-investors should avoid Nvidia , or perhaps forget about it altogether , until its valuation makes more sense . But just because Nvidia is rife with warning signs , it does n't mean all high - growth stocks are worth avoiding . What follows are two supercharged growth stocks with far more tantalizing upside in 2024 than Nvidia . Fastly The first fast - paced stock that has the tools in place to outperform [Nvidia]16-nvidia in 2024 is edge computing company Fastly ( FSLY 3.33 % ) . [Fastly]866-fastly is best - known for [its]866-fastly content delivery network , which is tasked with moving data from the edge of the cloud to [end users]1949-end users as quickly and securely as possible . The clear catalyst for Fastly is the expectation that content consumption will continue to climb , thus requiring ever - increasing network capacity . Since Fastly is a usage - driven business , the accelerated shift [we]1950-we 've witnessed of data online and into the cloud following the COVID-19 pandemic is a good thing . While it 's not been a straight - line expansion for Fastly , many of [the company]1085-the company 's key performance indicators are moving in the right direction . From the end of 2021 to the close of business in September 2023 , enterprise customer count rose by 80 to 547 ; average enterprise customer spend increased from $ 704,000 to $ 832,000 ; and [the company]1085-the company 's dollar - based net expansion rate ( [DBNER]865-dbner ) stayed firm between 118 % and 123 % . [DBNER]865-dbner implies that [existing clients]1375-existing clients are consistently spending between 18 % and 23 % more on a year - over - year basis , which , once again , is great news for [Fastly]866-fastly 's usage - driven operating model . Another reason Fastly stock can fly is the strength of [[its]866-fastly management team]1954-its management team . In September 2022 , [Todd Nightingale]867-nightingale took over as [CEO]1372-ceo . [Nightingale]867-nightingale came over from [Cisco Systems]761-cisco , where [he]1372-ceo developed the strategy for [[the company]1085-the company 's Enterprise Networking and Cloud segment]1957-the company 's enterprise networking and cloud segment . Not only has [Nightingale]867-nightingale brought innovation to the table , but [he]1372-ceo keenly understands how to reduce costs , which is something Fastly sorely needed after larger - than - anticipated losses in 2021 and throughout most of 2022 . With [Nightingale]867-nightingale steering [the ship]1958-the ship , [Fastly]866-fastly has a real opportunity to turn the corner to recurring profits this year . [Considering Wall Street]134-wall street expects a 30 % annualized earnings growth rate from [Fastly]866-fastly over the next five years , it looks like a shoo - in to outpace [Nvidia]16-nvidia in 2024 ( and beyond ) . Fiverr International The second supercharged growth stock that offers significantly more upside in 2024 than [Nvidia]16-nvidia is [online - services marketplace Fiverr International]1959-online - services marketplace fiverr international ( FVRR 1.93 % ) . If there 's a knock against [Fiverr]868-fiverr , it 's that [the company]1085-the company is cyclical . Economic downturns and contractions are often associated with an increase in the unemployment rate . Since Fiverr 's operating model helps connect [freelancers]1395-freelancers with businesses that desire [their]1395-freelancers services , a strong labor market and economy are needed . But here 's the thing : Recessions are historically short - lived . Since World War II ended in September 1945 , there have been 12 official recessions , and none have surpassed 18 months in length . That compares to two expansions that hit the decade mark . Over longer periods , betting on the American economy to thrive has been a smart move . Another macro factor working in [Fiverr]868-fiverr 's favor is the changing dynamic of the labor market following the COVID-19 pandemic . Though [some people]1962-some people have returned to [the office]1495-the office , [more workers than ever]1964-more workers than ever are operating remotely . This permanent shift in the workforce plays right into [Fiverr]868-fiverr 's long - term growth plans . One of the key differentiating factors for [Fiverr]868-fiverr is how [[its]868-fiverr freelancers]1965-its freelancers price [their]1965-its freelancers services . Whereas [most competing online - service marketplaces]1966-most competing online - service marketplaces allow [freelancers]1395-freelancers to price [their]1395-freelancers work at an hourly rate , [[Fiverr]868-fiverr 's freelancers]1968-fiverr 's freelancers list [their]1968-fiverr 's freelancers tasks as an all - inclusive price . The price transparency with [Fiverr]868-fiverr is unparalleled , which is probably why spend per [buyer]1969-buyer has continually climbed . But the real driving force behind [Fiverr]868-fiverr 's growth is [its]868-fiverr take rate -- i.e. , the percentage of each deal negotiated on [its]868-fiverr platform , including fees , that [it]868-fiverr gets to keep . While [key competitors]1970-key competitors are enjoying take rates in the mid - teens , [Fiverr]868-fiverr 's expanded to 31.3 % in the September - ended quarter . [Fiverr]868-fiverr is taking a progressively bigger cut , yet [its]868-fiverr freelancer base and spend per [buyer]1969-buyer have steadily grown . This ideal recipe is expected to result in triple - digit annualized earnings growth over the next five years .

[The technology sector]2008-the technology sector is driving the stock market to new highs with the S&P 500 ( ^GSPC -0.65 % ) and Dow Jones Industrial Average both closing at record levels on Jan. 23 . The focus remains on the " Magnificent Seven "[2016-sector] companies , a term coined by Bank of America analyst [Michael Hartnett]848-michael hartnett to describe [the seven largest tech - focused companies]2009-the seven largest tech - focused companies in the S&P 500 -- Microsoft , Apple , [Nvidia]16-nvidia , [Amazon]767-amazon , Alphabet , [Meta Platforms]186-meta platforms , and [Tesla]847-tesla . Combined , [they]2009-the seven largest tech - focused companies make up 28.8 % of the index . [The Magnificent Seven]854-the magnificent seven dominate the U.S. stock market , but expand [your]2010-you view to [the top 20 tech - focused companies]2011-the top 20 tech - focused companies , and [they]2011-the top 20 tech - focused companies make up 35.8 % of the S&P 500 . [They]2011-the top 20 tech - focused companies include the Magnificent Seven plus Broadcom , Adobe , Salesforce , Advanced Micro Devices , Netflix , [Cisco]761-cisco , Intel , Oracle , Intuit , Qualcomm , ServiceNow , [IBM]765-ibm , and [Texas Instruments]53-texas instruments . Whether [you]2010-you 're invested in [these specific companies]2012-these specific companies or not , these changing market dynamics affect [us]2007-us all . Here are the pros and cons of a top - heavy market and why tech makes up an even larger share of the S&P 500 than [folks]1915-folks realize . [Tech]871-tech is bigger than [you]2010-you think [The SPDR S&P 500 ETF]2014-the spdr s&p 500 etf ( SPY -0.60 % ) is built to mirror the performance of the S&P 500 , so [we]2007-us 'll use [its]2014-the spdr s&p 500 etf composition to get a better reading on the market . If [you]2010-you look into the fund , [you]2010-you 'll find the weights by [company]1298-company and [sector]2016-sector . Information technology makes up 28.9 % of the fund . How is that possible when [the 20 previously mentioned tech - focused companies]2017-the 20 previously mentioned tech - focused companies make up 35.8 % ? The answer comes down to how the market defines a " tech "[872-peter lynch] stock . [Amazon]767-amazon and [Tesla]847-tesla are considered [consumer discretionary companies]2018-consumer discretionary companies , not tech . Alphabet , Meta Platforms , and Netflix are [the three largest companies in [the communications sector]2020-the communications sector]2019-the three largest companies in the communications sector . The weight of [those five companies]2021-those five companies alone is 11.5 % of the S&P 500 . So really , the tech sector plus [these five companies]2022-these five companies is a staggering 40.4 % of the market . Throw in some of the largest non - tech stocks like [Berkshire Hathaway]876-berkshire hathaway , [Eli Lilly]222-eli lilly , [JPMorgan Chase]187-jpmorgan chase , [UnitedHealth Group]137-unitedhealth group , Visa , [Johnson & Johnson]2023-johnson & johnson , ExxonMobil , [Home Depot , Mastercard , and Procter & Gamble]2024-home depot , mastercard , and procter & gamble , and that 's over 51 % of the S&P 500 . The ripple effects of a concentrated market The market cap of the S&P 500 is over $ 40 trillion . The sheer value of [the tech sector and other largest companies]2025-the tech sector and other largest companies is hard to comprehend . For context , the entire value of the [Shanghai]184-shanghai stock market is about $ 6 trillion . In addition to the dollar value of [these large companies]2026-these large companies , it 's important to understand this heavy concentration means [a relatively small number of companies]2027-a relatively small number of companies are driving the stock market and potentially [your]2028-you portfolio . If [you]2028-you do n't own [these companies]1338-these companies or [you]2028-you have small positions in [them]1338-these companies , then the performance of [your]2028-you portfolio is going to vary widely from that of the S&P 500 , and even more so from that of the Nasdaq Composite . And if [you]2028-you have large positions in [those companies]2030-those companies , in addition to exchange - traded funds based on the major indexes , [you]2028-you 're likely even more concentrated in those stocks than [you]2028-you may realize . Individual investing is all about making wise decisions to achieve [your]2028-you financial goals . [An individual]2031-an individual is n't like [a professional money manager]2032-a professional money manager or [fund manager whose performance is constantly compared to the market]2033-fund manager whose performance is constantly compared to the market . But still , a lot of financial planning is based on estimated market returns over time . A good rule of thumb is that the S&P 500 averages around a 9 % to 10 % annual return . But just because [you]2028-you 're invested in the stock market does n't mean [you]2028-you should expect to achieve a similar return to the S&P 500 unless [you]2028-you own the stocks that are steering the index . 2022 and 2023 were perfect examples of these market dynamics . In 2022 , the S&P 500 fell 19.4 % , and [the Nasdaq Composite]223-the nasdaq composite lost a third of its value . Unsurprisingly , [the tech , communications , and consumer discretionary sectors]2034-the tech , communications , and consumer discretionary sectors led that decline . If [you]2028-you were underweight in [these sectors]2035-these sectors , [you]2028-you probably outperformed the market in 2022 . The same thing happened last year , only the market went up with these three sectors contributing the bulk of the market 's gains . If [you]2028-you were underweight [these sectors]2035-these sectors , [you]2028-you probably underperformed the market last year . [The stock market]2037-the stock market has n't always been this way . There used to be less concentration in [a single sector]2038-a single sector , let alone [a small number of companies]2039-a small number of companies . Back in 2014 , [the 10 largest companies by market cap]2040-the 10 largest companies by market cap were ( in order ): [Apple]780-apple , ExxonMobil , Alphabet , Microsoft , [Berkshire Hathaway]876-berkshire hathaway , [Johnson & Johnson]2041-johnson & johnson , [Walmart]229-walmart , [Chevron]225-chevron , [Wells Fargo]226-wells fargo , and [Procter & Gamble]227-procter & gamble . That 's much more diversification across sectors . If [we]2042-we go back 20 years , the 10 largest companies were [Microsoft]768-microsoft , [ExxonMobil , Pfizer , Citigroup]2043-exxonmobil , pfizer , citigroup , [General Electric]228-general electric , [Walmart]229-walmart , [Intel]864-intel , [Cisco Systems]761-cisco , [Johnson & Johnson]2044-johnson & johnson , and [IBM]765-ibm . Be aware of the disconnect between [your]2045-you portfolio and [the market]1123-the market At the end of the day , investing in the stock market is about making money . As [Peter Lynch]872-peter lynch famously said , " The stock does n't know [you]2045-you own [it]4825-it . "[869-dev stahlkopf] It matters little where the gains come from as long as there are gains over time . Just realize that if the S&P 500 is up , it 's probably thanks to [large tech - focused companies]2047-large tech - focused companies , and same thing if it 's down . If the trend continues , the market could become even more concentrated . [You]2045-you might not be invested in the S&P 500 , or [you]2045-you view many of those 20 large tech stocks as overvalued . As a result , [you]2045-you 'll have to look for other opportunities in the market . There 's nothing wrong with that -- [you]2045-you should always invest in a way that suits [your]2045-you risk tolerance . The key is to fully understand what 's driving the returns in [your]2045-you portfolio . Now more than ever , there 's a dichotomy between [large tech - focused companies]2047-large tech - focused companies and [the rest of the market]2049-the rest of the market . Given the cyclicality of the tech sector , [I]0-i would expect the S&P 500 to be more volatile going forward too .

Cloud - based solutions enable flexible and scalable infrastructure , while video conferencing tools facilitate remote learning . Mobile apps and adaptive learning tech enhance engagement , and VR / AR tools provide immersive learning environments . AI - powered systems and educational ERP streamline administrative tasks . Cybersecurity and IoT ensure a secure and connected learning environment , while 3D printing and blockchain drive innovation . Digital accessibility tools and open - source resources foster inclusive education , shaping the future of learning . Options are a riskier asset compared to just trading the stock , but [they]2086-they have higher profit potential . Serious options [traders]1975-traders manage this risk by educating [themselves]1975-traders daily , scaling in and out of trades , following more than one indicator , and following the markets closely . If [you]2088-you want to stay updated on the latest options trades for [Cisco Systems]761-cisco , Benzinga Pro gives [you]2088-you real - time options trades alerts .

News Summary The Cisco 2024 Data Privacy Benchmark Study reveals that [most organizations]2089-most organizations are limiting the use of Generative AI ( GenAI ) over data privacy and security issues . 27 % had banned its use , at least temporarily . 48 % admit entering [non - public company]2090-non - public company information into GenAI tools . [91 % of [businesses]1180-businesses]2091-91 % of businesses recognize [they]2091-91 % of businesses need to do more to reassure [customers]1091-customers that [their]2091-91 % of businesses data is used for intended and legitimate purposes in AI . 98 % said that external privacy certifications are an important factor in [their]2091-91 % of businesses buying decisions , the highest level in years . [SAN JOSE]239-san jose , [Calif.]126-calif. , Jan. 25 , 2024 /CNW/ -- Cisco ( NASDAQ : CSCO ) today released [its]761-cisco 2024 Data Privacy Benchmark Study , an annual review of key privacy issues and their impact on business . Ahead of International Data Privacy Day , the findings highlight the growing Privacy concerns with [GenAI]825-genai , trust challenges facing [organizations]1089-organizations over [their]1089-organizations use of AI , and the attractive returns from privacy investment . Drawing on responses from [2,600 privacy and security professionals]2095-2,600 privacy and security professionals across 12 geographies , the seventh edition of the Benchmark shows that privacy is much more than a regulatory compliance matter . Cisco 2024 Privacy Benchmark Cisco 2024 Privacy Benchmark Infographic Growing Privacy Concerns with Generative AI " Organizations see [GenAI]825-genai as a fundamentally different technology with novel challenges to consider , "[869-dev stahlkopf] said [Dev Stahlkopf]869-dev stahlkopf , [Cisco Chief Legal Officer]2096-cisco chief legal officer . " More than 90 % of respondents believe [GenAI]825-genai requires new techniques to manage data and risk . This is where thoughtful governance comes into play . Preserving customer trust depends on it . "[870-harvey jang] Among the top concerns , [businesses]1180-businesses cited the threats to [an organization]4795-an organization 's legal and Intellectual Property rights ( 69 % ) , and the risk of disclosure of information to [the public]1993-the public or [competitors]1129-competitors ( 68 % ) . [Most organizations]2089-most organizations are aware of these risks and are putting in place controls to limit exposure : 63 % have established limitations on what data can be entered , 61 % have limits on which GenAI tools can be used by [employees]1458-employees , and 27 % said [[their]2103-their organization]2104-their organization had banned GenAI applications altogether for the time being . Nonetheless , [many individuals]1998-many individuals have entered information that could be problematic , including [employee]1999-employee information ( 45 % ) or non - public information about [the company]1085-the company ( 48 % ) . Slow Progress on AI and [Transparency Consumers]2108-transparency consumers are concerned about AI use involving [their]2108-transparency consumers data today , and yet [91 % of [organizations]1089-organizations]2109-91 % of organizations recognize [they]2109-91 % of organizations need to do more to reassure [[their]2109-91 % of organizations customers]2003-their customers that [their]2109-91 % of organizations data is being used only for intended and legitimate purposes in AI . This is similar to last year 's levels , suggesting that not much progress has been achieved . Organizations ' priorities to build consumer trust differ from those of [individuals]2112-individuals . [Consumers]1181-consumers identified [their]1181-consumers top priorities as getting clear information on exactly how [their]1181-consumers data is being used , and not having [their]1181-consumers data sold for marketing purposes . When asked the same question , [businesses]1180-businesses identified [their]1180-businesses top priorities as complying with privacy laws ( 25 % ) and avoiding data breaches ( 23 % ) . It suggests additional attention on transparency would be helpful â especially with AI applications where it may be difficult to understand how the algorithms make [their]1180-businesses decisions . Privacy and Trust : the Role of External Certifications and Laws Organizations recognize the need to reassure [[their]1089-organizations customers]2003-their customers about how [their]2003-their customers data is being used , and 98 % said that external privacy certifications are an important factor in [their]2003-their customers buying decisions . This is the highest [we]2116-we 've seen over the years . " 94 % of [respondents]1990-respondents said [[their]2109-91 % of organizations customers]2003-their customers would not buy from [them]2109-91 % of organizations if [they]2109-91 % of organizations did not adequately protect data , "[870-harvey jang] explains [Harvey Jang]870-harvey jang , [Cisco Vice President]2117-cisco vice president and [Chief Privacy Officer]2118-chief privacy officer . " [They]2109-91 % of organizations are looking for hard evidence [the organization]4828-the organization can be trusted . Privacy has become inextricably tied to customer trust and loyalty . This is even more true in the era of AI , where investing in privacy better positions [organizations]1089-organizations to leverage AI ethically and responsibly . "[2133-the most privacy - mature organizations] Despite the costs and requirements privacy laws may impose on [organizations]1089-organizations , 80 % of respondents said privacy laws have had a positive impact on [them]1089-organizations , and [only 6 %]2120-only 6 % said the impact has been negative . Strong privacy regulation boosts consumer confidence and trust in [the organizations [they]2003-their customers choose to share [their]2003-their customers data with]2121-the organizations they choose to share their data with . Further , [many governments]2122-many governments and [organizations]1089-organizations are putting in place data localization requirements to keep certain data within [country or region]2124-country or region . Whilst [most businesses]2125-most businesses ( 91 % ) believe that [their]2125-most businesses data would be inherently safer if stored within [[their]2125-most businesses country or [region]1399-region]2126-their country or region , 86 % also said that [a global provider , operating at scale]2128-a global provider , operating at scale , can better protect [their]2128-a global provider , operating at scale data compared to [a local provider]2129-a local provider . Privacy : a Valuable Investment Over the past five years , privacy spending has more than doubled , benefits have trended up , and returns have remained strong . This year , 95 % indicated that privacy 's benefits exceed [its]2130-its costs , and [the average organization]2131-the average organization reports getting privacy benefits of 1.6 times [their]2131-the average organization spending . Further , 80 % indicated getting significant " Loyalty and Trust "[875-warren buffett] benefits from [their]2132-their privacy investments , and this is even higher ( 92 % ) for [the most privacy - mature organizations]2133-the most privacy - mature organizations . In 2023 , largest organizations ( [10,000 + employees]2134-10,000 + employees ) increased [their]2134-10,000 + employees privacy spending by seven to eight percent since last year . However , [smaller organizations]2135-smaller organizations saw lower investment , for example , businesses with [50 - 249 employees]2136-50 - 249 employees decreased [their]2134-10,000 + employees privacy investment by a fourth on average . These services are critical for ensuring that flights run smoothly and that [passengers]2178-passengers have a positive overall experience . Rising investment in brownfield and [greenfield airside services]2181-greenfield airside services , rising global passenger traffic , and acceptance of new technologies allowing automation and self - services drive airside service market share . [Most airports]2182-most airports focus on lowering operational expenses , improving operational efficiency , and reducing [their]2182-most airports carbon footprint . [The sector]2183-the sector struggles to meet international service quality standards while conforming to environmental regulations . Price decreases result from increased competition , reducing [service providers]2184-service providers ' profit margins . Increasing pricing competitiveness and airline negotiation strength is expected to emerge as some of the difficulties confronting the airside services market throughout the projection period . "[2310-persistence market research] Middle - class growth and cheaper air travel have increased passenger numbers , especially in [Asia - Pacific]50-asia pacific and [the Middle East]2185-the middle east . [Asia - Pacific]50-asia pacific grew quicker , at 4.5 % , highlighting this trend . Integration of Advanced Technologies Creates Tremendous Opportunities Airside services can benefit greatly from enhanced technology integration to boost productivity and customer experience . Such technology includes autonomous ground vehicles for luggage handling , airplane towing , and runway inspections . [These autonomous vehicles]2195-these autonomous vehicles reduce human error and boost efficiency . A.I. and data analytics are another airside service . A.I. algorithms can predict aircraft arrival times and optimize gate assignments , speeding turnarounds and reducing delays . New [York]269-york , Jan. 23 , 2024 ( GLOBE NEWSWIRE ) -- The global Hybrid Fiber Coaxial market has witnessed a significant surge in recent years , propelled by the increasing demand for high - speed internet and advanced communication services . The global Hybrid Fiber Coaxial market is presently valued at US$ 11.2 billion . With a compound annual growth rate ( CAGR ) of 7 % , the market is projected to reach US$ 12.2 billion by 2023â2033 . The increasing demand for bandwidth - intensive applications , such as streaming services and online gaming , is a key driver of market expansion . In the ever - evolving landscape of telecommunications , [the Hybrid Fiber Coaxial ( HFC ) market]2243-the hybrid fiber coaxial ( hfc ) market has emerged as a pivotal player , shaping the way [we]2232-we connect , communicate , and consume data . Hybrid Fiber Coaxial ( HFC ) refers to [a telecommunications network that combines [fiber - optic cables and coaxial cables to deliver high - speed internet , cable television , and other communication services]2245-fiber - optic cables and coaxial cables to deliver high - speed internet , cable television , and other communication services to [end - users]2246-end - users]2244-a telecommunications network that combines fiber - optic cables and coaxial cables to deliver high - speed internet , cable television , and other communication services to end - users . Seeking Deeper Insights into Competitor Analysis ? Request a Sample of the Report Now ! https://www.persistencemarketresearch.com/samples/27778 Hybrid Fiber Coaxial Market Report Scope : Report Coverage Details Market Revenue 2023 US$ 11.2 billion Estimated Revenue 2033 US$ 12.2 billion Growth Rate â CAGR 7 % Forecast Period 2023 - 2033 No . of Pages 297 Pages Key Market Segments Covered Component Application Region Regions Covered North America Latin America Europe South Asia & Pacific East Asia The Middle East & Africa Key Companies Profiled Huawei Technologies Co Ltd Nokia Networks Cisco Systems Inc. Technicolor SA Coming Incorporated Ciena Corporation ZTE Corporation Infinera Corp Finisar Corporation Skyworks Solutions Inc. Top 10 Emerging Trends and Innovations : The Hybrid Fiber Coaxial ( HFC ) market is experiencing significant transformations driven by technological advancements and evolving consumer demands . Here are the top 10 emerging trends and innovations shaping the future of the HFC market : DOCSIS 4.0 Standard : The latest Data Over Cable Service Interface Specification ( DOCSIS ) 4.0 standard is revolutionizing HFC networks by enabling higher data transfer rates , lower latency , and improved network efficiency . This standard is a key driver for the evolution of gigabit and multi - gigabit broadband services . Extended Spectrum Usage : HFC networks are exploring the potential of extended spectrum usage , allowing for increased bandwidth and higher data rates . This innovation is crucial for meeting the growing demand for high - speed internet , especially in [densely populated urban areas]2247-densely populated urban areas . Remote PHY and MACPHY Architectures : Remote PHY and [MACPHY]888-macphy ( Media Access Control PHY ) architectures are gaining prominence , decentralizing network functions and enhancing flexibility . This shift improves network scalability , simplifies maintenance , and enables the deployment of new services more efficiently . Full Duplex DOCSIS ( FDX ): FDX is emerging as a game - changer in the HFC market , enabling symmetrical gigabit speeds over [existing infrastructure]2248-existing infrastructure . This innovation enhances upstream and downstream capacities simultaneously , addressing the demand for reliable and high - speed internet connections . Fiber Deep Deployments : To enhance network capacity and reduce signal degradation , [HFC operators]2249-hfc operators are investing in fiber deep deployments . This involves extending the fiber closer to [end - users]2246-end - users , improving signal quality and enabling the delivery of higher bandwidth services . AI - driven Network Management : Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) is being integrated into HFC networks for predictive maintenance , real - time monitoring , and proactive issue resolution . This ensures optimal network performance , minimizes downtime , and enhances the overall quality of service . Remote Network Diagnostics : Remote diagnostic tools are becoming more sophisticated , allowing [operators]2251-operators to troubleshoot and resolve issues without physical intervention . This trend is crucial for minimizing service disruptions and reducing operational costs . Edge Computing Integration : Integrating edge computing into HFC networks brings computing resources closer to [end - users]2246-end - users . This reduces latency , enhances the performance of latency - sensitive applications , and supports emerging technologies like augmented reality and virtual reality . Energy Efficiency Solutions : [HFC operators]2249-hfc operators are increasingly adopting energy - efficient technologies to reduce the environmental impact of [[their]2249-hfc operators networks]2254-their networks . Innovations in power amplifiers , cooling systems , and network components contribute to a more sustainable HFC infrastructure . This includes encryption technologies , secure access controls , and continuous monitoring to ensure the integrity and confidentiality of data . Market Restraints : Infrastructure Upgrade Costs : Upgrading existing HFC infrastructure to meet the growing demand for higher data speeds and increased bandwidth requires significant investments . The cost of upgrading and maintaining HFC networks can be a restraint , particularly for [smaller service providers]2266-smaller service providers . Competition from Fiber Optic Networks : The competition from fiber optic networks , offering even higher data speeds and lower latency , poses a challenge to the HFC market . [Some regions]2267-some regions may prioritize the deployment of fiber optics over HFC for future - proof connectivity . Regulatory Challenges : Regulatory challenges related to spectrum allocation , licensing , and compliance can impact the expansion of HFC networks . Navigating complex regulatory landscapes may pose hurdles for [market players]1142-market players . Navigating the HFC Landscape : Challenges and Opportunities Despite its promising outlook , [the HFC market]2269-the hfc market also faces some challenges : Competition from pure fiber - optic deployments : While HFC is cost - effective , pure fiber - optic networks offer even higher speeds and are seen as the ultimate future - proof solution . Infrastructure limitations : Upgrading existing coaxial infrastructure can be expensive and time - consuming , particularly in [older neighborhoods]2270-older neighborhoods . Security concerns : As with any internet - connected device , HFC networks require robust security measures to protect against cyberattacks and data breaches . However , these challenges are outweighed by the vast opportunities HFC presents : Expanding market reach : HFC 's ability to leverage existing infrastructure makes it ideal for reaching [underserved areas]2271-underserved areas and bridging the digital divide . Innovation in services : HFC networks can be the backbone for innovative services like augmented reality and [smart homes]2272-smart homes , opening up new avenues for growth . Partnerships and collaboration : Collaboration between [service providers]2184-service providers , [technology vendors]2274-technology vendors , and [governments]2275-governments can accelerate HFC adoption and unlock its full potential . The Surging Demand for High - Speed Broadband : [The Hybrid Fiber Coaxial ( HFC ) market]2243-the hybrid fiber coaxial ( hfc ) market is experiencing a formidable surge in demand , primarily fueled by the ever - increasing need for high - speed broadband services . As [consumers]1181-consumers and [businesses]1180-businesses alike rely on data - intensive applications , such as streaming , gaming , and remote work , the demand for robust and fast internet connectivity has reached unprecedented levels . HFC technology , combining fiber optic and coaxial cables , proves to be a pivotal solution , offering the scalability and bandwidth required to meet these escalating demands . The HFC market is witnessing substantial growth as [telecom providers]2279-telecom providers and [cable operators]2280-cable operators invest in upgrading [[their]2281-their networks]2254-their networks to deliver gigabit - speed internet . This evolution in broadband infrastructure reflects the crucial role HFC plays in meeting the challenges of the digital age , ensuring reliable and high - performance connectivity for a wide range of applications . Evolution of HFC Technology : The inception of HFC technology can be traced back to the late 20th century when the demand for high - speed internet and digital television began to surge . [Traditional cable systems]2283-traditional cable systems were facing limitations in meeting these growing demands , prompting the need for a more robust and efficient solution . The integration of fiber - optic cables into the existing coaxial infrastructure marked a revolutionary shift in the telecommunications landscape . This hybrid approach offered higher bandwidth , reduced signal degradation , and improved reliability , setting the stage for the widespread adoption of HFC technology . Hybrid Fiber Coaxial Market Outlook by Category : [The Hybrid Fiber Coaxial ( HFC ) market]2243-the hybrid fiber coaxial ( hfc ) market exhibits a diverse landscape , characterized by various key segments that play pivotal roles in shaping its outlook . These segments , encompassing components , applications , and regions , provide a comprehensive understanding of the market dynamics and opportunities . In terms of components , the HFC market is segmented into crucial elements that collectively contribute to [its]2243-the hybrid fiber coaxial ( hfc ) market functionality . The categories include CMTS / CCAP , Fiber Optic Cable , Amplifier , Optical Node , Optical Transceiver , and Others . Each component has a specific role in enhancing the performance and efficiency of [the HFC infrastructure]2285-the hfc infrastructure . CMTS / CCAP forms the backbone of the system , ensuring efficient data transmission , while [Fiber Optic Cable]270-fiber optic cable serves as the physical medium for high - speed data transfer . Amplifiers , [Optical Nodes]271-optical nodes , and Transceivers work synergistically to amplify and transmit signals , maintaining the integrity of data throughout the network . The market segmentation by application further delineates the diverse utility of HFC technology . Analog TV and Telephone Network applications cater to traditional communication and broadcasting needs . DAA decentralizes network functions , bringing [them]2307-them closer to [the end - user]2308-the end - user , resulting in improved efficiency , reduced latency , and enhanced network performance . The stock market has cooled a bit since the calendar turned over to 2024 , but last year ended with a bang . Thanks to a year - end rally , the S&P 500 ended the year up 24 % , and the Nasdaq gained 43 % . These results made [investors]1102-investors feel good but also drove up some great companies ' valuations . The price [you]2346-you pay does matter , and some companies look richly valued . There will be a stock market sell - off at some point , although [nobody]2347-nobody knows when . [Some investors]2348-some investors like to have a watch list of stocks to buy once prices dip . Here are three growth stocks [I]0-i am keeping an eye on to add to , once the market cools . 1 . Fortinet Fortinet ( FTNT -2.35 % ) , [a long - established cybersecurity company with a track record of impressive growth]2349-a long - established cybersecurity company with a track record of impressive growth , is at the top of [my]0-i buy list . It might not get as many headlines as [[its]132-digital alpha more - flashy peers]2350-its more - flashy peers , but [Fortinet]891-fortinet has a long track record of success in [its]891-fortinet field . Since [its]891-fortinet initial public offering ( IPO ) in 2009 , [Fortinet]891-fortinet has been profitable and free - cash - flow positive every year . Slowdowns in revenue and billings growth affected [Fortinet]891-fortinet 's stock in 2023 , with double - digit drops following the last two quarters ' earnings releases . [Management]1174-management cited a slowdown in a part of the business called Secure Networking . [Fortinet]891-fortinet believes this is a near - term challenge and expects this market opportunity to continue to grow for several years . Despite slowing growth , third - quarter revenue increased by 16 % , and billings grew by 6 % year over year . Bottom - line results were more impressive with earnings per share increasing by 41 % . Even at a slowing growth rate , Fortinet is still [a formidable growth company that 's a leader in the cybersecurity space]2352-a formidable growth company that 's a leader in the cybersecurity space . Even after two large drawdowns in 2023 , [Fortinet]891-fortinet 's stock is up 28 % over the last year , slightly outpacing the S&P 500 . This places [its]891-fortinet price - to - earnings ( P / E ) multiple at 43 . While this is below [the company]1085-the company 's historical average , it certainly is n't cheap . For comparison , competitor [Cisco Systems]761-cisco trades for only 15 times earnings . [Fortinet]891-fortinet is a quality business , but there could be better price points in the future . 2 . Nvidia For [investors who follow [the semiconductor and artificial intelligence ( AI]2355-the semiconductor and artificial intelligence ( ai ) spaces]2354-investors who follow the semiconductor and artificial intelligence ( ai ) spaces , news about [Nvidia]16-nvidia ( NVDA -5.55 % ) has been unavoidable over the past year . The past two quarters ( [Nvidia]16-nvidia 's second and third of fiscal 2024 ) have featured triple - digit revenue growth . This has been led by [[its]891-fortinet data center segment]2356-its data center segment , which saw revenue growth of 279 % in the third quarter . At some point , this growth will slow , but it 's impossible to know when . Based on recent reports of [companies]1187-companies continuing to buy Nvidia 's most advanced chips , these impressive increases could be here for the foreseeable future . In the current quarter , [the company]1085-the company is projecting total revenue growth of more than 200 % . [Nvidia]16-nvidia currently trades for 75 times earnings and 81 times free cash flow . These multiples are above [the company]1085-the company 's 10 - year historical average . Buying shares at these prices could work out if the growth projections hold , but considering the cyclical nature of the semiconductor space , it 's reasonable to assume there will be better buying opportunities ahead . 3 . [Broadcom Semiconductor device and software developer Broadcom]2360-broadcom semiconductor device and software developer broadcom ( AVGO -6.99 % ) has also seen tailwinds related to AI . Over the past year , Broadcom stock is up nearly 100 % and is currently near its all - time high . [Shares]892-shares now trade for around 35 times earnings and 28 times free cash flow . When [Broadcom]659-broadcom reported [its]659-broadcom fourth - quarter and fiscal - year 2023 results in December , the market reaction was likely due to guidance rather than reported results . Year - over - year revenue growth slowed to 4 % and earnings - per - share growth slipped to 5 % . Both of these growth rates have been significantly higher over the last few years . On the flip side , [the company]1085-the company 's guidance suggests that 2024 will be a much better year . Fiscal 2024 revenue is expected to be $ 50 billion , which represents a 39 % increase over the fiscal 2023 revenue of $ 36 billion . The current price and valuation are based on growth reaccelerating in 2024 , due in part to AI - related spending by [[its]891-fortinet customers]1173-its customers . Today 's price is not cheap , but also not incredibly expensive by [Broadcom]659-broadcom 's historical valuation . [This company]4786-this company should remain at the forefront of the semiconductor and AI space for years to come and should be at the top of [investors]1102-investors ' watch lists for any market sell - off .

New [York]269-york , Jan. 18 , 2024 ( GLOBE NEWSWIRE ) -- Market Overview : The market for broadcasting equipment was valued at US$ 4,833.4 million in 2023 , and by the end of 2033 , it is expected to have grown to US$ 9,780.7 million . The market for broadcasting equipment is predicted to grow at a CAGR of 7.3 % from 2023 to 2033 . [The global Broadcasting Equipment Market]2458-the global broadcasting equipment market is witnessing robust growth , driven by the dynamic evolution of the media and entertainment industry . Broadcasting equipment market encompasses a wide array of tools and technologies essential for the production , transmission , and reception of audio - visual content . With the ongoing digital transformation and the surge in demand for high - quality content , the market for broadcasting equipment has become increasingly pivotal . The market is characterized by a diverse range of products , including cameras , microphones , video switchers , audio mixers , and transmitters . These components collectively play a crucial role in delivering seamless and immersive broadcasting experiences . As traditional broadcasting methods intertwine with the digital landscape , [the industry]1133-the industry is experiencing a paradigm shift , fostering innovation and creating new opportunities for [market players]1142-market players . Market Growth Factors : Digital Transformation and Technological Advancements : The ongoing digital transformation in the broadcasting industry is a major driver for market growth . The shift from traditional analog to digital broadcasting has led to an increased need for sophisticated and technologically advanced equipment . High - definition ( HD ) and ultra - high - definition ( UHD ) broadcasting , along with the adoption of digital signal processing technologies , have become industry standards . As [broadcasters]2461-broadcasters strive to enhance the quality of content delivery and meet consumer expectations , there is a growing demand for state - of - the - art broadcasting equipment , including cameras , transmitters , encoders , and signal processing devices . Rising Demand for Over - the - Top ( OTT ) and Streaming Services : The surge in popularity of over - the - top ( OTT ) platforms and streaming services is a significant growth factor for the broadcasting equipment market . [Consumers]1181-consumers ' changing preferences , especially the shift towards on - demand content consumption , have prompted [broadcasters]2461-broadcasters to invest in equipment that supports efficient content creation , management , and delivery . This includes the adoption of cloud - based broadcasting solutions , advanced video encoding technologies , and streaming servers . The demand for live streaming and real - time content delivery has also driven the need for robust and scalable broadcasting infrastructure . Market Challenges : [The Broadcasting Equipment Market]2508-the broadcasting equipment market has been [a dynamic and evolving sector , shaped by technological advancements , changing consumer behaviors , and the continuous evolution of media consumption patterns]2520-a dynamic and evolving sector , shaped by technological advancements , changing consumer behaviors , and the continuous evolution of media consumption patterns . However , amidst the opportunities , [the industry]1133-the industry is not without [its]1133-the industry challenges , which significantly impact market dynamics . One of the foremost challenges faced by the Broadcasting Equipment Market is the rapid pace of technological obsolescence . As technology continues to advance at an unprecedented rate , [equipment manufacturers]2475-equipment manufacturers and [service providers]2184-service providers grapple with the need to keep up with the latest innovations . This challenge is particularly pronounced as [broadcasters]2461-broadcasters seek to adopt high - definition ( HD ) , ultra - high - definition ( UHD ) , and even more advanced broadcasting technologies , requiring substantial investments in research and development to stay competitive . Another notable challenge lies in the increasing complexity of content delivery networks . With the proliferation of Over - the - Top ( OTT ) platforms and streaming services , [broadcasters]2461-broadcasters face the task of ensuring seamless and high - quality content delivery across diverse devices and networks . Achieving this level of sophistication poses challenges in terms of infrastructure , compatibility , and scalability , demanding substantial investments to meet the escalating expectations of [consumers]1181-consumers . The landscape of sports broadcasting and live events , while presenting opportunities , also introduces challenges for [equipment manufacturers]2475-equipment manufacturers . The demand for [specialized equipment capable of capturing fast - paced action and delivering immersive experiences]2528-specialized equipment capable of capturing fast - paced action and delivering immersive experiences requires constant innovation . Meeting these specialized needs within a competitive market becomes a challenge , as [companies]1187-companies strive to stay ahead in terms of technological capabilities and feature offerings . Additionally , the globalization of broadcasting networks presents challenges related to standardization and interoperability . With [broadcasters aiming to reach international audiences]2530-broadcasters aiming to reach international audiences , [the industry]1133-the industry faces the complexities of diverse broadcasting standards and protocols . Achieving seamless content distribution across these varied standards requires a concerted effort to develop equipment that is adaptable and compatible globally , posing a challenge for [market players]1142-market players . Latest Developments : The Broadcasting Equipment Market has witnessed significant advancements and developments in recent times , reflecting the industry 's dynamic nature . One noteworthy trend in the market pertains to the increasing adoption of 5 G technology . The integration of 5 G into broadcasting infrastructure enhances data transfer speeds and connectivity , allowing for smoother live streaming and higher - quality content delivery . This development not only addresses the growing demand for seamless broadcasting but also positions [the market]1123-the market to explore new possibilities in real - time and immersive experiences . Another noteworthy development involves the rising prominence of IP - based ( Internet Protocol ) broadcasting solutions . The shift towards IP - based workflows offers [broadcasters]2461-broadcasters greater flexibility , scalability , and efficiency in content creation and distribution . With the adoption of IP technologies , [broadcasters]2461-broadcasters can streamline operations , reduce costs , and deliver content across multiple platforms seamlessly . This marks a pivotal shift in [the industry]1133-the industry 's approach to content production and distribution . Furthermore , Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) and machine learning applications are gaining traction within the Broadcasting Equipment Market . AI is being employed to enhance various aspects of broadcasting , including content recommendation , automated metadata generation , and even real - time video analysis . These AI - driven solutions contribute to improved audience engagement , personalized content delivery , and operational efficiency for [broadcasters]2461-broadcasters . The market has also seen advancements in remote production technologies . With the increasing need for cost - effective and flexible production workflows , remote production solutions have become integral . These technologies enable [broadcasters]2461-broadcasters to produce content from off - site locations efficiently , reducing the need for extensive on - site infrastructure . The trend towards remote production aligns with the broader industry goal of optimizing resource utilization and adapting to changing content creation dynamics . New]322-technavio new [York]269-york , Jan. 18 , 2024 ( GLOBE NEWSWIRE ) -- The Optical Transceivers Market : Shining a Light on Explosive Growth Optical transceivers are crucial components in optical communication systems , serving as both transmitters and receivers of optical signals . They play a vital role in the efficient and high - speed transmission of data in telecommunications networks , [data centers]1169-data centers , and various other applications . The global Optical Transceivers market is presently valued at USD 8.73 billion . With a projected compound annual growth rate ( CAGR ) of 14.6 % , the market is anticipated to reach USD 34.1 billion by 2022â2032 . The escalating demand for faster data transmission , the advent of 5 G networks , and the ongoing transition to higher data rates are major factors contributing to market expansion . Optical transceivers are compact devices that integrate both a transmitter and [a receiver]2623-a receiver for optical signals . [They]298-technavio technavio convert electrical signals into optical signals for transmission and vice versa , enabling seamless communication in fiber - optic networks . These devices find widespread application in data centers , [telecommunications networks]2624-telecommunications networks , and [enterprise networks]2625-enterprise networks , facilitating high - bandwidth data transfer with minimal signal loss . The Optical Transceivers Market has witnessed robust expansion , driven by the escalating need for high - speed data transmission across various industries . As the demand for bandwidth - intensive applications and cloud services continues to surge , the market size is expected to reach unprecedented levels . Technological advancements , such as the development of faster transceiver modules , are poised to propel market growth further , establishing optical transceivers as a cornerstone in the evolving landscape of communication technologies . NEC Corporation ZTE Corporation Sumitomo Electric Industries]2627-ltd. nec corporation zte corporation sumitomo electric industries Emerging Trends and Innovations in Optical Transceivers Market The optical transceiver market , a crucial component of fiber optic communication , is undergoing a transformation driven by rising bandwidth demands , cloud computing , and 5 G deployment . Here are some key trends and innovations to watch : 1 . Higher Speeds and Densities : 400 G and 800 G transceivers are gaining traction , offering significant bandwidth upgrades for [data centers]1169-data centers and long - haul networks . Advancements in materials and packaging enable smaller footprints and reduced power consumption . 2 . Silicon Photonics : Integration of optical components onto silicon chips promises cost - effective and scalable solutions for short - reach applications within [data centers]1169-data centers . This miniaturization paves the way for dense integration and increased port counts . 3 . PAM4 Modulation : Employing four voltage levels per symbol , PAM4 doubles data capacity compared to traditional NRZ modulation , enabling higher speeds without sacrificing bandwidth . PAM4 technology is becoming mainstream in high - end transceivers . 4 . Openness and Interoperability : [The industry]1133-the industry is moving towards open standards and interoperable components , promoting vendor neutrality and driving down costs . This fosters a more flexible and competitive market . 5 . Artificial Intelligence ( AI ): AI - powered monitoring and diagnostics are being incorporated into transceivers , enabling predictive maintenance and reducing network downtime . Additionally , AI optimizes signal processing and transmission efficiency . These innovations are shaping the future of the optical transceiver market , fostering faster , more efficient , and cost - effective data transmission to meet the ever - growing connectivity demands . These devices enable faster and more reliable data transfer , supporting the evolving landscape of [telecommunication infrastructure]2638-telecommunication infrastructure . Rising Demand for Data Centers : The proliferation of data centers globally , driven by the surge in digitalization and remote working trends , is a key driver for the Optical Transceivers Market . Optical transceivers provide the high bandwidth and low latency necessary for seamless data center operations , making [them]298-technavio technavio indispensable in this dynamic environment . Growing Adoption of Fiber - Optic Networks : With an increasing shift towards fiber - optic networks for enhanced connectivity and improved data transmission capabilities , the demand for optical transceivers is on the rise . Market Restraints : High Initial Costs : [The Optical Transceivers Market]2639-the optical transceivers market faces a challenge due to the high initial costs associated with the development and implementation of optical transceiver technologies . This can act as a restraint , particularly for [small and medium - sized enterprises]2640-small and medium - sized enterprises ( SMEs ) looking to invest in [advanced communication infrastructure]2641-advanced communication infrastructure . Complex Integration Processes : Integrating optical transceivers into existing communication networks can be a complex process , requiring specialized knowledge and expertise . This complexity can act as a restraint for organizations looking to upgrade [their]298-technavio technavio infrastructure , as it may lead to increased deployment times and potential operational disruptions . Limited Fiber - Optic Infrastructure in [Emerging Markets]2263-emerging markets : The lack of well - established fiber - optic infrastructure in [certain emerging markets]2643-certain emerging markets poses a restraint for the Optical Transceivers Market . Market Opportunities : Rapid Expansion of 5 G Networks : The ongoing rollout and expansion of 5 G networks present a significant opportunity for [the Optical Transceivers Market]2639-the optical transceivers market . As 5 G networks require high - speed and reliable communication , [optical transceivers]2650-optical transceivers are well - positioned to capitalize on this opportunity . Emergence of [Edge Computing]908-edge computing : The growing adoption of edge computing , driven by the need for low - latency data processing , creates opportunities for optical transceivers . These devices play a crucial role in facilitating high - speed data transfer between edge devices and [central data centers]2651-central data centers . Increasing Demand for High - Bandwidth Applications : The rising demand for high - bandwidth applications , such as augmented reality ( AR ) , virtual reality ( VR ) , and 8 K video streaming , presents lucrative opportunities for the Optical Transceivers Market . Optical transceivers are essential in enabling the seamless transmission of large volumes of data associated with these applications . Category - wise Insights The Optical Transceivers industry is meticulously segmented based on key factors , providing a comprehensive overview of the market dynamics . Form Factor : The market showcases a variety of form factors catering to different needs . These include SFF & SFP ( Small Form Factor & Small Form Pluggable ) , CFP ( C Form - factor Pluggable ) , QSFP ( Quad Small Form - factor Pluggable ) , XFP , CXP , and other specialized form factors . This segmentation reflects [the industry]1133-the industry 's commitment to offering diverse options to accommodate various network architectures . Fiber Type : Optical Transceivers are designed to operate with specific fiber types . [The market]1123-the market is divided into Single Mode Fiber and Multimode Fiber segments , recognizing the distinct characteristics of each fiber type and [their]2663-fujitsu optical components limited : fujitsu optical components limited suitability for different applications . Data Rate : Data rate is a crucial criterion for Optical Transceivers , and [the market]1123-the market is segmented into different speed categories . These include Less than 10 Gbps , 10 Gbps to 40 Gbps , 41 Gbps to 100 Gbps , and More than 100 Gbps . This categorization addresses the increasing demand for higher data transfer speeds in various networking environments . Application : The diverse applications of Optical Transceivers are captured through segmentation based on [their]2663-fujitsu optical components limited : fujitsu optical components limited usage . The market serves Telecommunications , [Data Centers]1169-data centers , and Enterprises , reflecting the pivotal role these transceivers play in facilitating efficient data communication across [different sectors]2673-different sectors . This intricate segmentation not only provides a comprehensive understanding of the Optical Transceivers market but also aids [industry stakeholders]2674-industry stakeholders in making informed decisions . It enables [businesses]1180-businesses to align [their]1180-businesses product offerings with specific form factors , fiber types , data rates , and applications , ensuring a targeted approach to meet the evolving demands of diverse sectors within the telecommunications and data networking landscape . Future Trends : 5 G Proliferation : The global rollout of 5 G networks is a significant catalyst for the optical transceivers market . As 5 G deployment continues , the demand for high - speed transceivers that can support the increased data traffic and low - latency requirements will see sustained growth . Evolving Data Center Architectures : The evolution of data center architectures towards disaggregation and optical interconnects is a trend that will shape the future of the optical transceivers market . [Disaggregated data centers]2686-disaggregated data centers rely on high - speed optical connections for efficient communication between compute , storage , and networking elements . Sustainability and Energy Efficiency : With a growing emphasis on sustainability , there is a concerted effort within [the industry]1133-the industry to develop energy - efficient optical transceivers . Innovations in materials , manufacturing processes , and power management are aimed at reducing the environmental footprint of optical communication systems . Zoom]857-technavio Video Communications ( ZM 0.19 % ) has taken [investors]1102-investors on a wild ride since [its]857-technavio initial public offering ( IPO ) . [The video conferencing company]2718-the video conferencing company went public at $ 36 on April 18 , 2019 , and [its]857-technavio stock soared to [its]857-technavio all - time high of $ 568.34 on Oct. 19 , 2020 . But today , [Zoom]857-technavio 's stock trades at $ 70 -- so a $ 1,000 investment would have grown to nearly $ 15,800 before shrinking back to just over $ 1,900 . The bulls initially rushed to [Zoom]857-technavio as [its]857-technavio growth accelerated throughout the pandemic , but [they]2719-they hastily retreated as it lost momentum in a post - pandemic market and rising rates popped [its]857-technavio bubbly valuations . Nevertheless , [Zoom]857-technavio 's stock has still nearly doubled in just under five years . [It]857-technavio 's also expanding [its]857-technavio platform with new products and services to evolve into [a more diversified cloud - based communications company]2720-a more diversified cloud - based communications company . So , could [Zoom]857-technavio keep growing over the next few decades and become [the tech sector 's next Microsoft]2721-the tech sector 's next microsoft ? How fast is [Zoom]857-technavio growing ? [Zoom]857-technavio 's revenue surged 326 % in fiscal 2021 ( which ended in January 2021 ) as [more people]2722-more people used [its]857-technavio video conferencing platform for online classes , remote work , and staying in touch with [friends]2723-friends and [family]2724-family throughout the pandemic . [Its]857-technavio revenue rose another 55 % in fiscal 2022 , even as the lockdowns ended and [more people]2722-more people returned to [[their]2722-more people schools and [offices]2727-offices]2726-their schools and offices . However , [Zoom]857-technavio 's revenue grew just 7 % in fiscal 2023 as rising rates and other macro headwinds drove [companies]1187-companies to rein in [their]1187-companies software spending . [It]857-technavio expects [its]857-technavio revenue to rise a mere 3 % to $ 4.5 billion in fiscal 2024 as its slower growth in [Europe]44-europe and [Asia]73-asia offsets [its]857-technavio stronger growth in [North America]43-north america . From fiscal 2023 to 2026 , [analysts]1113-analysts expect [its]857-technavio revenue to increase at a compound annual growth rate ( CAGR ) of only 3.5 % as [it]857-technavio continues to face macro headwinds and intense competition from similar cloud - based video conferencing and collaboration platforms , like [Cisco Systems]761-cisco ' Webex , [[Microsoft]768-microsoft 's Teams]2730-microsoft 's teams , and [Alphabet]910-alphabet 's Google Meet . [Zoom]857-technavio does n't look like the next Microsoft yet Based on [its]857-technavio current growth trajectory , [Zoom]857-technavio does n't look like it will become the " next Microsoft "[913-romina boarini] anytime soon . When [Microsoft]768-microsoft generated $ 4.65 billion in revenue back in fiscal 1994 ( which ended in June 1994 ) , [it]768-microsoft grew 24 % from the previous year . [It]768-microsoft subsequently grew [its]768-microsoft revenue at a CAGR of 14 % over the following 29 years . To match that impressive growth rate , [Zoom]857-technavio will need to make a few major acquisitions to remain a leader in the global video conferencing market , which [Fortune Business Insights]911-fortune business insights estimates could still grow at a CAGR of 12 % from 2023 to 2030 . [Zoom]857-technavio tried to buy the cloud - based [contact center company Five9]2731-contact center company five9 for $ 14.7 billion back in 2021 , but that deal eventually fell apart . [Five9]912-five9 reportedly rejected a second buyout offer from [Zoom]857-technavio in late 2023 . Those bids suggest [Zoom]857-technavio is desperate to inorganically expand [its]857-technavio ecosystem to lock in [[its]857-technavio customers]1173-its customers and widen [its]857-technavio moat . The global cloud contact center market could grow at a CAGR of 26 % from 2024 to 2029 , according to Mordor Intelligence . So , acquiring [Five9]912-five9 could have given [Zoom]857-technavio a foothold in a higher - growth market and expanded [its]857-technavio reach among [enterprise customers]1179-enterprise customers . Even if [Zoom]857-technavio never buys [Five9]912-five9 , [it]857-technavio could still acquire [smaller players]2734-smaller players or expand [its]857-technavio own Zoom Contact Center -- which is currently used to handle [intra - office and customer]2735-intra - office and customer calls . [Zoom]857-technavio 's ecosystem is still evolving On [its]857-technavio own , [Zoom]857-technavio continues to expand [its]857-technavio ecosystem with new AI - powered features , like Zoom Scheduler , which schedules meetings with [people outside of [an organization]4795-an organization]2736-people outside of an organization ; Intelligent Director , which uses AI - powered cameras to capture the clearest angles during a video call ; and [its]857-technavio Zoom Virtual Agent chatbot for customer support services . [It]857-technavio 's also targeting [enterprise customers]1179-enterprise customers with [its]857-technavio Zoom Phone for audio calls and text messages ; Zoom Rooms , which mixes on - site and [remote attendees]2739-remote attendees ; and Zoom IQ platform for video - based sales team calls . [Zoom]857-technavio has also been gradually testing ads to monetize [[its]857-technavio free users]2741-its free users . Too early to say if [Zoom]857-technavio can grow into a tech giant With an enterprise value of $ 15 billion , [Zoom]857-technavio is still a tiny company compared to [Microsoft]768-microsoft , which is worth $ 2.8 trillion . For [Zoom]857-technavio to join [Microsoft]768-microsoft 's weight class in the distant future , [it]857-technavio will need to buy [more companies]2743-more companies , expand with more cloud - based communications tools , and add more enterprise services to [its]857-technavio ecosystem . [Cisco]761-cisco to co - develop with [the OECD WISE Centre]2745-the oecd wise centre [an interactive knowledge hub to help understand technology 's role in fostering inclusion and improving well - being]2746-an interactive knowledge hub to help understand technology 's role in fostering inclusion and improving well - being News Summary : The rapid pace of digital transformation and advancements in AI merit a global discussion on how [people]1331-people experience technological change . Technology can be a force for good , but it can also pose risks to well - being through unintended consequences on mental health and social connectedness , digital divides , threats to cybersecurity and disinformation . [Cisco]761-cisco and [the OECD WISE Centre]338-the oecd wise centre will build [a global knowledge hub]2748-a global knowledge hub for data and evidence on the influence of digital transformation on different aspects of [people]1331-people 's lives and well - being . The initiative helps to continue [Cisco]761-cisco 's work to positively impact the lives of [billions of people]2750-billions of people worldwide and promote inclusion and equal opportunity for all to prosper in a global digital economy . [DAVOS]339-davos , [Switzerland]62-switzerland , Jan. 16 , 2024 /CNW/ -- Technology is transforming [our]2751-our lives , changing the way [we]2751-our learn , work , interact with [others]4849-others and get access to all types of services . Depending on [our]2751-our ability to access technology and use it in the right way , technology can improve [our]2751-our sense of well - being and be a real driver of progress . [Cisco]761-cisco ( NASDAQ : CSCO ) , [a global technology leader committed to fostering an inclusive future for all]2753-a global technology leader committed to fostering an inclusive future for all , continues [its]761-cisco efforts to address the digital divide through a new research collaboration with [the Organisation for Economic Co - operation and Development]2754-the organisation for economic co - operation and development ( OECD ) . All rights reserved to Sandra Cifo This collaboration aims to help promote a responsible use of technology as well as fairness , inclusion and equitable access in a global digital economy . Igniting a Global Conversation As digital transformation continues to reshape every aspect of [our]2751-our lives at an intensifying pace , [Cisco]761-cisco and [the OECD Centre on Well - being]2755-the oecd centre on well - being , Inclusion , Sustainability and Equal Opportunity ( WISE ) are joining forces to examine the complex nature of digital transformation and its role as both a catalyst for progress and a source of potential risks to well - being . " [The OECD]340-the oecd has a long tradition of work supporting [policy makers]4852-policy makers better understand the digital transformation and develop appropriate policies to help shape a positive digital future . [Our]2751-our initial report , ' How 's Life in the Digital Age ' , highlighted the benefits and challenges of digital transformation , from enhanced access and productivity to issues like the digital divide and personal security threats in [people]1331-people 's everyday life and workplace . [Our]2751-our partnership with [Cisco]761-cisco helps [us]2751-our take the next step in broadening what [we]2751-our know about the interplay between technology and life to enrich [our]2751-our understanding of well - being in the digital realm , "[916-fran katsoudas] said [Romina Boarini]913-romina boarini , [OECD WISE Centre Director]2756-oecd wise centre director . This collaboration aims to create an interactive , dynamic and engaging digital platform for sharing experiences to help develop a detailed picture of how digital technologies influence different aspects of [our]2751-our lives . Grounded in the OECD Well - being Framework , the platform will gather new statistics and [people]1331-people 's insights on digital well - being as a whole , including the impact of the digital divide and inequalities in the uptake and use of digital technologies . Strategic Momentum from [Cisco]761-cisco 's Country Digital Acceleration Programs [Cisco]761-cisco 's involvement in the OECD WISE Centre initiative is an extension of [its]761-cisco Country Digital Acceleration ( CDA ) program , which has a long history of collaborating with [governments]2275-governments , industry and [academia]2759-academia to foster sustainable , secure and inclusive communities through over 1500 projects in [50 countries]1905-50 countries . " [We]2751-our can not close the digital divide on [our]2751-our own . Governments , industry , [educational institutions]2059-educational institutions , [non - profits]4855-non - profits and [community leaders]4856-community leaders must work together in new ways to prioritize [our]2751-our collective well - being for a healthy , prosperous and safe digital life . It 's no coincidence that the priorities and the OECD 's Well - being Framework resonate so profoundly . This partnership taps into [Cisco]761-cisco and OECD 's collective expertise in understanding the risks and unlocking the value of digitization across verticals and industries to ultimately power [safe and inclusive communities]4857-safe and inclusive communities , and resilient economies , "[1272-end user] said [Guy Diedrich]914-guy diedrich , [Senior Vice President]1697-senior vice president & [Global Innovation Officer of [Cisco]761-cisco]2762-global innovation officer of cisco . Digital Access is No Longer a Privilege for [Some]915-some but a Necessity for All The partnership between [Cisco]761-cisco and [the OECD]2763-the oecd builds on existing research into digital well - being . [It]2764-it acknowledges that while digital technologies offer benefits like improved access to education and health information , they also pose risks . Notably , the digital divide , where [those lacking digital literacyâa blend of technical , emotional , and social skillsâfall behind]2765-those lacking digital literacyâa blend of technical , emotional , and social skillsâfall behind , becoming vulnerable to mental health risks and safety concerns . Recognizing that broad internet access is n't enough to participate in digital life , the new partnership seeks to rally [citizens]2766-citizens , [businesses]1180-businesses , [policymakers]2768-policymakers and [workers]2769-workers to develop a balanced approach that ensures technology improves well - being and mitigates potential risks . [A New Industry Study and Knowledge Hub [Cisco]761-cisco and [the OECD]340-the oecd]2770-a new industry study and knowledge hub cisco and the oecd will conduct research and create [a global knowledge hub]2748-a global knowledge hub , capturing data and expanding knowledge on the influence of digital transformation on different aspects of [people]1331-people 's lives . This initiative marks a crucial step in understanding technology 's role across a broader definition of well - being that covers 11 key dimensions : education and skills , healthcare , jobs and earnings , income and wealth , subjective well - being , smart communitiesâwork - life balance and social connectionsâenvironmental sustainability , critical infrastructure , cybersecurity , governance and civic engagement , and housing . The research aims to help [users]1529-users make informed decisions , empower [individuals]2112-individuals to navigate the digital landscape responsibly , and to promote a healthy relationship with emerging technology . " While [we]4858-our continue to strive for full digital inclusion around [the world]1147-the world , [we]4858-our can not do so at any cost . At the same time , regulations are becoming more stringent requiring higher precision and quality in manufacturing . This has led to an increased need for automation technologies across the pharma value chain from drug discovery to packaging . Robots , AI , IoT , and other smart technologies are being adopted by [pharma companies]4864-pharma companies to automate repetitive and hazardous tasks , improving quality , yields and meeting compliance standards . The driver for automation is expected to further propel the growth of pharma 4.0 market in the coming years . Advances in digital technologies are allowing the development of innovative digital therapeutics and connected healthcare solutions . Digital technologies such as smartphones , wearable devices , AI and big data analytics are being utilized to develop novelapps , software , and devices integrated with traditional healthcare delivery . These digital solutions can help improve patient outcomes , reduce healthcare costs , and enable remote patient monitoring . The growing focus on digital therapeutics and connected care is one of the major growth drivers as these technologies will stimulate further investments and innovations in pharma 4.0 .
