Investing in global megatrends can be a great way to deliver strong returns over the long term . A variety of hard - to - predict factors make it impossible to know where the market will go in the short term , or how individual stocks will perform over the long term . However , [you]2791-you can set [yourself]2791-you apart from [other investors]2792-other investors by recognizing the major trends that will shape the global economy over the next decades . If [you]2791-you have an extra $ 1,000 to invest , consider holding some of the stocks that should benefit from the big economic shifts on the horizon . 1 . Artificial intelligence [You]2791-you might be tired of hearing about artificial intelligence ( AI ) if [you]2791-you 've been following financial and technology news over the past year , but there 's a reason that the topic is getting so much attention . AI is a disruptive force that 's going to have major economic ramifications moving forward , and [investors]1102-investors should at least consider investing in some of [the businesses that will benefit from the proliferation of this technology]2794-the businesses that will benefit from the proliferation of this technology . AI software will have a wide range of ramifications , but one of the primary impacts will be to improve efficiency for businesses across [most industries]2795-most industries . Automation reduces costs associated with repetitive or time - consuming tasks , and machine learning can unlock insights by assisting data analysis . That should translate to improved profit margins or more competitive prices for companies that successfully implement AI resources . It can also allow high - growth businesses to scale more quickly by reducing the hiring burden during expansion phases . There are a number of different ways to invest in the AI growth trend . [Developed economies]2806-developed economies will continue to be enormously influential on global economics and corporate results . However , markets like [China]5-china , [India]47-india , and [Indonesia]360-indonesia are rapidly closing the gap . That could result in meaningful returns if [you]2803-you invest $ 1,000 in some of [the businesses that are enabling [a digitally connected world]2813-a digitally connected world]2812-the businesses that are enabling a digitally connected world . Connectivity is a broad concept that encompasses [a few different industries]2814-a few different industries . The Internet of Things ( IoT ) refers to physical devices that use software and data to enhance the user experience . That includes wearable electronics , [cars]2815-cars , medical devices , thermostats , doorbells , [home appliances]2816-home appliances , and a wide variety of industrial equipment . [New York]71-new york , Jan. 12 , 2024 ( GLOBE NEWSWIRE ) -- Market Overview : [The Automotive Cyber Security Market]2903-the automotive cyber security market has witnessed remarkable growth in recent years as the automotive industry increasingly relies on advanced technology and connectivity . This market primarily focuses on protecting [vehicles]2904-vehicles from cyber threats and ensuring the safety and security of onboard electronic systems . As [vehicles]2904-vehicles become more connected through IoT ( Internet of Things ) technologies and autonomous driving features , the need for robust cyber security measures has become paramount . The Automotive Cyber Security Market has experienced substantial expansion , driven by the escalating number of [connected cars]1232-connected cars and the rising awareness of cyber threats in the [automotive sector]2907-automotive sector . The market for automotive cyber security was valued at US$ 2,143.1 million in 2022 , and by the end of 2033 , it is expected to have grown to US$ 26,492.6 million . The market for automotive cyber security is estimated to valuate to US$ 2,661.7 million in 2023 and is predicted to grow at a CAGR of 25.8 % from 2023 to 2033 . The market size was estimated to be in the billions of dollars , and it was poised to grow even further as [automotive manufacturers]2908-automotive manufacturers increasingly integrated advanced technologies into [[their]2908-automotive manufacturers vehicles]2909-their vehicles . The growth in this market is driven by several factors , including the increasing adoption of connected and [autonomous vehicles]2910-autonomous vehicles , the need for compliance with regulatory standards , and the rising concern for passenger safety . With each passing year , more vehicles are equipped with internet connectivity , which opens up new avenues for potential cyber - attacks . As a result , the automotive cyber security market has become a crucial component of the broader automotive industry . Elevate [your]2911-your business strategy with comprehensive market data . STMicroelectronics Infineon Technologies AG NXP Semiconductors Bosch Mobility Solutions Microchip Technology Aptiv Irdeto Technology Trends : [Intrusion Detection Systems ( IDS ): Automotive cyber security]2913-intrusion detection systems ( ids ): automotive cyber security is evolving with the incorporation of more advanced Intrusion Detection Systems . These systems employ machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms to identify and respond to anomalies in real - time . By continuously monitoring network traffic and the behavior of electronic control units ( ECUs ) , IDS can quickly detect and mitigate potential cyber threats . Blockchain Technology : Blockchain is gaining prominence in automotive cyber security due to its inherent security features . It can be used to secure connected car communications , protect data integrity , and establish a transparent and immutable ledger of all interactions within the automotive ecosystem . This technology ensures that critical information remains tamper - proof and authentic . Zero Trust Architecture : As cyber threats become more sophisticated , [the automotive industry]2914-the automotive industry is adopting a zero - trust security approach . This means that [no entity , whether inside or outside the network]2915-no entity , whether inside or outside the network , is trusted by default . All access requests and activities are continually verified and authenticated . This approach helps prevent unauthorized access and lateral movement by [cyber attackers]2916-cyber attackers . Over - the - Air ( OTA ) Updates : OTA updates have become a standard practice in [the automotive industry]2914-the automotive industry , allowing [manufacturers]2470-manufacturers to deploy security patches and software updates remotely . This technology ensures that [vehicles]2904-vehicles can receive timely security updates to address vulnerabilities and protect against emerging threats , enhancing overall cyber security . Collaboration and Information Sharing : [Automotive manufacturers]2908-automotive manufacturers , industry organizations , and [governments]2275-governments are increasingly collaborating to share information about cyber threats and vulnerabilities . This collaborative effort helps establish best practices , standards , and guidelines to bolster the cyber security of vehicles across [the industry]1133-the industry . Market Segmentation : The Automotive Cyber Security Market can be segmented into several key categories based on various factors such as type , application , security level , and vehicle type . These segments help to understand the diverse nature of the market and cater to the specific needs of different stakeholders within [the automotive industry]2914-the automotive industry . Type of Solution : Hardware Solutions : These include hardware components such as secure hardware modules ( HSMs ) , intrusion detection systems ( IDS ) , and secure communication gateways designed to protect in - vehicle networks from cyber threats . Software Solutions : Software - based solutions encompass firewalls , encryption software , and secure operating systems that fortify [the vehicle]2938-the vehicle 's software and data against cyber attacks . Application : Infotainment Systems : Cyber security solutions for infotainment systems protect entertainment and connectivity features from unauthorized access and malicious attacks , ensuring the safety and privacy of [user]2996-user data . Powertrain Systems : This category focuses on securing critical powertrain components and [engine control units]2997-engine control units ( ECUs ) to prevent unauthorized access or manipulation that could compromise vehicle performance and safety . Telematics Systems : Telematics solutions , including navigation and communication systems , require protection to safeguard sensitive data and maintain connectivity without vulnerabilities . Safety Systems : Advanced driver assistance systems ( ADAS ) and autonomous driving features demand robust cyber security to ensure the safety of [passengers]2178-passengers and [pedestrians]2999-pedestrians . Security Level : Endpoint Security : Endpoint security solutions protect individual components within [the vehicle]2938-the vehicle 's network , ensuring that each electronic control unit ( ECU ) is secure from cyber threats . Network Security : Network security focuses on safeguarding [the entire in - vehicle network]3001-the entire in - vehicle network , including communication between ECUs , from external intrusions and unauthorized access . Vehicle Type : Passenger Vehicles : [Consumer automobiles]3002-consumer automobiles , including [sedans , SUVs , and hatchbacks]3003-sedans , suvs , and hatchbacks , require cyber security measures to protect both [the vehicle]2938-the vehicle 's systems and the personal data of [passengers]2178-passengers . [FORT WORTH]385-fort worth , [Texas]386-texas , Jan. 10 , 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- RS , [a trading brand of RS Group plc]3074-a trading brand of rs group plc ( [LSE : RS1]387-lse : rs1 ) , [a global provider of product and service solutions]3075-a global provider of product and service solutions for [industrial customers]3076-industrial customers , has received a score of 95 out of 100 on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation 's 2023â2024 Corporate Equality Index ( CEI ) . [The Human Rights Campaign ( HRC )]3077-the human rights campaign ( hrc ) is [[the nation]3078-the nation 's largest lesbian , gay , bisexual , [transgender , and queer ( LGBTQ+ ) civil rights advocacy organization]3080-transgender , and queer ( lgbtq+ ) civil rights advocacy organization]3079-the nation 's largest lesbian , gay , bisexual , transgender , and queer ( lgbtq+ ) civil rights advocacy organization , and the CEI is [the nation]3078-the nation 's foremost benchmarking survey and report measuring corporate policies and practices related to LGBTQ+ workplace equality . The first CEI , in 2002 , featured [319 participating businesses]3082-319 participating businesses . The 2023â2024 CEI features 1,384 major U.S. businesses â a 334 % increase â and showcases how U.S.-based companies are successfully promoting LGBTQ+ friendly workplace policies in [the U.S.]141-the u.s. and abroad . Further demonstrating the tremendous trajectory of the CEI , this year 's data revealed that a record - breaking 1,340 businesses have non - discrimination protections specific to gender identity , up from just 17 in 2002 . These critical non - discrimination protections now cover [21 million employees in [the U.S.]3084-the u.s.]3083-21 million employees in the u.s. and around [the globe]1355-the globe . Predictions indicate that the global market for electronic access control systems market will reach an impressive US$ 110,965.1 Mn by 2033 , exhibiting a robust Compound Annual Growth Rate ( CAGR ) of approximately 10.7 % from 2023 to 2033 . The widespread adoption of electronic access control systems is a global phenomenon , driven by increasing concerns about theft , break - ins , and white - collar crime , prompting both commercial and [residential sectors]3135-residential sectors to invest in advanced security solutions . The ease of use associated with these systems further contributes to [their]3136-their growing popularity on a global scale . Challenges and Opportunities : Challenges : High Initial Costs : The upfront costs associated with implementing electronic access control systems , including hardware , software , and installation , can be a significant barrier for [some organizations]3191-some organizations , especially [smaller ones]3192-smaller ones . Integration Complexity : Integrating [electronic access control systems]3179-electronic access control systems with [existing infrastructure]2248-existing infrastructure , especially in [older buildings]3195-older buildings , can be complex and costly . Compatibility issues with legacy systems may pose challenges during the integration process . Cybersecurity Risks : The increasing connectivity of electronic access control systems to networks and the internet exposes [them]3179-electronic access control systems to cybersecurity threats . Unauthorized access , data breaches , and cyber - attacks are potential risks that require robust security measures . User Resistance : Resistance from [users]1529-users , especially in [organizations undergoing a transition to electronic access control]3197-organizations undergoing a transition to electronic access control , can hinder successful implementation . Maintenance and Upkeep : [Electronic access control systems]3179-electronic access control systems require regular maintenance and updates to ensure optimal functionality . Failure to keep up with maintenance schedules can lead to system malfunctions or vulnerabilities . Opportunities : Technological Advancements : Ongoing advancements in technology , such as biometrics , artificial intelligence , and cloud - based solutions , present opportunities for improving the efficiency and capabilities of electronic access control systems . Increasing Adoption of IoT : The growing adoption of the Internet of Things ( IoT ) provides opportunities for enhanced connectivity and integration of electronic access control systems with other smart devices , offering a more comprehensive security ecosystem . Demand for Contactless Solutions : The global shift towards contactless solutions , driven by health and hygiene considerations , creates opportunities for electronic access control systems with touchless features , such as mobile - based access and facial recognition . Customization and Scalability : Offering customizable solutions that can be tailored to the specific needs of [different industries]3199-different industries and scalable to accommodate growth provides opportunities for market expansion and diversification . Future Prospects and Innovations : The future prospects of [the electronic access control systems]3202-the electronic access control systems market are promising , marked by ongoing innovations that address evolving security needs and technological advancements . As the industry continues to grow , innovations in biometrics , artificial intelligence , and IoT are expected to reshape the landscape . The integration of advanced biometric technologies , such as facial recognition and fingerprint scanning , enhances the accuracy and reliability of access control systems . Artificial intelligence plays a pivotal role in predictive analytics , enabling proactive threat detection and risk mitigation . The expanding use of IoT facilitates seamless connectivity and interoperability , allowing [electronic access control systems]3179-electronic access control systems to integrate with other smart devices for a holistic security ecosystem . Moreover , the development of touchless solutions , driven by health considerations , is likely to gain prominence , with mobile - based access and gesture recognition emerging as key innovations . The future holds opportunities for customization and scalability , allowing tailored solutions for various industries . As smart city initiatives gain momentum , electronic access control systems are expected to play a vital role in urban security and management frameworks . The emphasis on data analytics for actionable insights and compliance with stringent security standards further propels [the industry]1133-the industry forward . The future of [electronic access control systems]3179-electronic access control systems is not only about fortifying physical security but also about creating intelligent , adaptive , and user - friendly solutions that meet the diverse needs of a rapidly evolving world . [The tech sector]3261-the tech sector is n't known for [its]3261-the tech sector dividends . [The sector]2183-the sector is famous for [dynamic , growth - oriented companies that are big on promise]3263-dynamic , growth - oriented companies that are big on promise , but often lack the consistent profits and free cash flow necessary to fund big dividends . However , there are many tech stocks that pay dividends . Let 's look at three that [income - oriented investors]3264-income - oriented investors should consider . 1 . International Business Machines First up is [International Business Machines]3265-international business machines ( IBM -0.30 % ) . To start , let 's acknowledge that [IBM]765-ibm has long been a laggard within [the tech industry]3266-the tech industry . Indeed , over the last 10 years , [IBM]765-ibm 's revenue declined by 38 % , and [its]765-ibm share price fell by 13 % over the same period . Yet [IBM]765-ibm 's massive dividend -- the stock currently boasts a dividend yield of 4.2 % -- has ridden to the rescue over the past decade . The stock 's total return ( which includes dividend payments ) is a far more respectable 36 % , with almost all of that gain coming over the last 12 months . What 's more , [the company]1085-the company 's long - promised strategic shift finally appears to be paying off . Revenue increased 20 % over the last three years , as [the company]1085-the company welcomed numerous partnerships in the lucrative cloud services sector . Granted , [IBM]765-ibm stock does have one weakness that could turn off [some investors]2348-some investors : [its]1085-the company valuation . Shares trade at a price - to - earnings ( P / E ) multiple of 21x , placing it on the upper end of the range for [the value - oriented investor]3270-the value - oriented investor . That said , other valuation measures are more favorable . [The company]1085-the company 's price - to - sales ( P / S ) ratio , for example , is 2.4x -- far more reasonable , and , in fact , cheaper than some other legacy tech stocks . At any rate , [dividend - seeking investors]3272-dividend - seeking investors should keep [IBM]765-ibm in mind due to [its]765-ibm fat dividend and revitalized revenue growth . 2 . [AT&T Next]430-at&t next is AT&T ( T 0.88 % ) . Like [IBM]765-ibm , [AT&T]431-at&t has also relied on a massive dividend to compensate for [its]431-at&t sinking stock price . Shares of [AT&T]431-at&t currently trade for less than $ 18 / share , down more than 34 % from where [they]3273-they traded in 2014 . However , AT&T 's fat dividend has more than made up the difference . The stock 's total return over the last 10 years is a gain of 40 % . Currently , [AT&T]431-at&t pays a dividend of $ 1.11 / share , which equates to a dividend yield of 6.4 % . That 's one of the biggest dividend yields within [the tech sector]3261-the tech sector . True , [AT&T]431-at&t did slash [its]431-at&t dividend in 2022 for the first time in 35 years . However , that move -- while painful -- has paid off . [The company]1085-the company has paid down more than $ 30 billion in long - term debt since the dividend cut , bringing [its]1085-the company total long - term debt to $ 133 billion . While that 's still a ton of debt , [AT&T]431-at&t is now in a far better position to service that debt with [its]1085-the company almost $ 20 billion in annual free cash flow . In short , [the company]1085-the company 's big dividend looks safe . As for valuation , AT&T shares boast a tiny price - to - earnings ( P / E ) multiple of only 7 , making the stock quite attractive to [value - oriented investors]3277-value - oriented investors . 3 . [Cisco Systems]761-cisco Last is [Cisco Systems]761-cisco ( [CSCO]761-cisco 1.23 % ) . [This Web 1.0 giant]3278-this web 1.0 giant is more than just alive and kicking -- [it]3278-this web 1.0 giant 's thriving . [The company , which designs and makes networking products]3279-the company , which designs and makes networking products , generated $ 13.6 billion in net income on $ 58 billion in revenue over the last 12 months . Moreover , [the company]1085-the company 's free cash flow -- the lifeblood that makes hefty dividends possible -- increased to $ 16.3 billion . Speaking of [its]1085-the company dividend , [Cisco]761-cisco pays $ 1.56 / share , good for a 3.1 % dividend yield -- not at all shabby , and more than double the S&P 500 average of 1.4 % . What 's more , [Cisco]761-cisco is n't just a cash cow ; [the company]1085-the company is still growing at an impressive rate . [Cisco]761-cisco grew revenue by 21 % over the last 10 years , and free cash flow has surged by 53 % over the same period . Better still , [value - oriented investors]3277-value - oriented investors need not fret . [Cisco]761-cisco 's P / E multiple of 13x makes it far cheaper than the S&P 500 average ( 24.6x ) . In short , [investors]1102-investors can get good value , and an attractive dividend from a company that is growing handsomely . Hybrid cloud infrastructure market , computing systems are gaining popularity as [organizations]1089-organizations seek to leverage both public and private clouds , providing a balance between control , security , and agility . This approach facilitates seamless workload mobility and data portability across different environments . The surge in cloud adoption across various industries is driven by the recognition of benefits such as scalability , flexibility , and cost savings . This shift is prompted by the imperative of digital transformation and the escalating demands for data storage and processing . The increasing emphasis on edge computing and distributed cloud infrastructure is expected to fuel demand in the coming decades . The proliferation of Internet of Things ( IoT ) devices and the necessity for real - time data processing are driving [organizations]1089-organizations towards decentralized computing architectures . The adoption of serverless technology is on the rise , allowing [developers]2377-developers to write and run code without managing the underlying infrastructure . Additionally , edge computing is gaining significance for its role in enabling low - latency processing and real - time decision - making . The transformative impact of containerization and Kubernetes on application deployment and management is poised to boost demand . Cloud systems hosting [Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) and Machine Learning ( ML ) workloads]3289-artificial intelligence ( ai ) and machine learning ( ml ) workloads are gaining popularity , while the integration of AI and ML in cloud systems is expected to contribute to growth . Recent Innovations in Cloud Infrastructure Market : Serverless Computing : Serverless computing has gained traction , allowing [developers]2377-developers to focus on writing code without managing the underlying infrastructure . This model offers improved scalability and cost efficiency . Edge Computing : With the proliferation of IoT devices , edge computing has become increasingly important . This innovation involves processing data closer to the source , reducing latency and improving real - time decision - making capabilities . AI and Machine Learning Integration : [Cloud providers]3295-cloud providers are integrating AI and machine learning capabilities into [[their]3295-cloud providers infrastructure]3317-their infrastructure , making it easier for [organizations]1089-organizations to leverage advanced analytics , automation , and intelligent services . Containers and Kubernetes Adoption : Containerization technologies , such as Docker , and orchestration tools like Kubernetes , have become integral in deploying and managing applications . [They]1089-organizations enhance portability and scalability across different cloud environments . Zero - Trust Security Models : Cloud security has seen innovations with the adoption of zero - trust security models . This approach assumes that threats may exist both inside and outside the network , requiring strict identity verification for anyone trying to access resources . Automated Cloud Management : Automation tools for cloud management have evolved , streamlining processes such as provisioning , scaling , and monitoring . This leads to improved efficiency and reduced operational overhead . Cloud Infrastructure Market Segmentation : By Type : Hardware : This category involves the physical components required for cloud computing , including servers , storage devices , networking equipment , and other infrastructure elements . Service : Encompassing a broad range of offerings , cloud services include various solutions provided over the internet . This can include infrastructure services , software applications , and platform services . Infrastructure as a Service ( IaaS ): [IaaS]442-iaas delivers virtualized computing resources over the internet . This includes virtual machines , storage , and networking , allowing [users]1529-users to scale resources as needed without investing in physical hardware . Platform as a Service ( PaaS ): PaaS provides a platform that allows [users]1529-users to develop , run , and manage applications without dealing with the complexities of [underlying infrastructure]3349-underlying infrastructure . [It]3350-it includes tools and services for application development . Relational Database as a Service ( DBaaS ): This service model offers a cloud - based , fully managed relational database . [Users]1529-users can deploy , manage , and scale databases without the need for extensive administrative tasks . Container as a Service ( CaaS ): CaaS provides a platform for deploying , managing , and orchestrating containers . [It]3350-it allows [developers]2377-developers to focus on building and running applications using containerized environments . Software as a Service ( SaaS ): SaaS delivers software applications over the internet on a subscription basis . [Users]1529-users access applications through a web browser , and the software is centrally hosted and maintained by [the provider]3354-the provider . Hybrid : Hybrid cloud infrastructure combines elements of both public and private clouds . [Pune]285-pune , Jan. 10 , 2024 ( GLOBE NEWSWIRE ) -- The global telemedicine market size was USD 70 billion in 2022 and is expected to register a robust revenue CAGR of 12.7 % over the forecast period . Key factors such as rapid advancements in digital and health technology , rising healthcare costs , and high focus on expanding rural healthcare access are expected to drive global market growth during the forecast period . Telemedicine refers to the practice of offering medical care remotely through telecommunication technology . [It]3387-it allows [healthcare professionals]3388-healthcare professionals to evaluate , diagnose , and treat [patients]3389-patients from a distance , overcoming geographical constraints , mobility issues , and other obstacles . Telemedicine uses various communication tools such as video conferencing , mobile apps , and other digital platforms to connect [patients]3389-patients with [healthcare providers]3391-healthcare providers without the need for in - person visits . Telemedicine services and tools are widely used in [healthcare centers]3392-healthcare centers for remote monitoring and consultations , specialist consultations , chronic disease management , follow - up visits , and emergency consultations . These services are also used to access easy health care in [rural and underserved areas]3393-rural and underserved areas . Request Free Sample Copy ( To Understand the Complete Structure of this Report [ Summary + TOC ] ) @ https://www.xcellentinsights.com/enquiry/sample/679337 Factors such as rising elderly population , favorable support from governments and regulatory bodies across [the globe]1355-the globe , and increasing investments in R&D activities to develop advanced software and services for telemedicine are expected to boost global market growth between 2023 and 2032 . However , technological barriers such as limited internet connectivity and lack of advanced devices in [remote areas]3395-remote areas , rising concerns about data privacy and cybersecurity threats , limited physical examination , and challenges with licensing and credentialing are expected to hamper overall market growth going ahead . Key Highlights in the Report : Based on [end users]1949-end users , the providers segment is expected to account for a significantly larger revenue share during the forecast period . This growth can be attributed to rising number of [hospitals]1239-hospitals , [clinics]3398-clinics , and [healthcare professionals]3388-healthcare professionals using telemedicine for virtual inspection and monitoring and growing digitalization among [healthcare providers]3391-healthcare providers to cater to rising prevalence of various diseases and chronic conditions . Asia Pacific market is expected to register robust revenue CAGR over the forecast period owing to presence of a large patient pool , rising geriatric population , improving healthcare infrastructure and services , favorable government support , and high adoption of telemedicine post - COVID-19 pandemic . [They]3469-they also come as [Sequoia]473-sequoia has faced significant paper markdowns from [[its]473-sequoia limited partners]3465-its limited partners , showing even [top tier venture funds]3471-top tier venture funds have not been immune to the tech bust . For instance , [Utimco]960-utimco , which manages the behemoth $ 70 billion endowments and operating funds of [the University of [Texas]386-texas and [Texas A&M systems]476-texas a&m systems]475-the university of texas and texas a&m systems , committed $ 200 million to the $ 13.6 billion 2022 Sequoia Capital Fund . It is single , open - ended fund that represents a significant departure from the traditional venture capital model , where [investors]1102-investors commit to separate funds that run for a set number of years . By the end of May , [Utimco]960-utimco had already deployed $ 100 million into the fund , drawing down half [its]473-sequoia commitment in just 13 months . Worse , the value plummeted to just $ 79 million . Four months later , [Utimco]960-utimco had deployed only $ 119,591 more , indicating [Sequoia]473-sequoia called very little capital during the traditionally slow summer months . The position was marked up slightly , to $ 82 million with $ 12 million returned . Meanwhile , [Utimco]960-utimco 's position in [[Sequoia]473-sequoia 's 2020 [US growth fund]3474-us growth fund]3473-sequoia 's 2020 us growth fund had an IRR , or internal rate of return , of -7.07 % at the end of August . That was down slightly from May , when the fund was marked at -6.24 % . [BI]961-bi obtained data for [Utimco]960-utimco through the end of August via a public - records request . Unlike [many other financial institutions]3475-many other financial institutions , VC funds are not required to show [their]3476-their returns on investments in startups . [Utimco]960-utimco did not respond to a request for comment . Venture marks can be subjective and [Sequoia]473-sequoia is known to be conservative . Dismal returns now do n't mean funds ca n't someday turn out to be major winners . Many of [Utimco]960-utimco 's holdings are young , and venture is a long game where it can take more than a decade for early startup bets to pay off ; [Sequoia]473-sequoia is named for the giant trees that can last three thousand years . [Sequoia]473-sequoia has also been making some big bets on AI of late , which could materialize in the next few years . Paper performance also matters far less than actual cash distributed , which [Sequoia]473-sequoia is still very good at doing . [The firm]1533-the firm has distributed more capital in the last decade than [it]1533-the firm has called , according to the source .

[Chicago]41-chicago , Jan. 08 , 2024 ( GLOBE NEWSWIRE ) -- Telehealth & Telemedicine market in terms of revenue was estimated to be worth $ 120.4 Billion in 2023 and is poised to reach $ 285.7 billion by 2028 , growing at a CAGR of 23.2 % from 2023 to 2028 according to a latest report published by MarketsandMarketsâ¢. Growth in the telehealth and telemedicine market is mainly driven by factors such as the rising population , the increasing need to expand healthcare access , the growing prevalence of chronic diseases and conditions , a shortage of [physicians]3630-physicians , advancements in telecommunications , the rising level of government support , and increasing awareness . However , regional variations in regulations , fraud , and the use of social media for care provision will affect market growth negatively during the forecast period . It is projected to grow at the highest CAGR of 28.6 % during the forecast period . This segment is projected to reach USD 243.3 billion by 2028 from 68.5 billion in 2023 . The on - demand nature of these services , their easy scalability , and the cost - benefits of cloud - based solutions are all driving the growth of this market . Based on the component segment , the telehealth and telemedicine market are segmented into software & services by type , Software and services by offering and hardware . The software & services segment is expected to account for the largest share of 71.3 % of [the global telehealth and telemedicine]3633-the global telehealth and telemedicine market in 2022 . The large share of this segment is mainly due because the enhancing digital presence and expanding online services contribute to the enhancement of healthcare services through the adoption of software and service tools . [Healthcare providers]3391-healthcare providers can optimize [patient solutions]3635-patient solutions by utilizing these tools , facilitating seamless connectivity among [service providers]2184-service providers . Thus , driving the growth of this segment . Based on Application , the teleradiology segment is expected to account for the largest share of 22.2 % of the global telehealth and telemedicine market in 2022 . Factors such as an increase in imaging practices , an increase in teleradiology workflow adoption by [healthcare providers]3391-healthcare providers , and the streamlining and regulation of teleradiology practices are driving the market growth . When [many people]3680-many people think of [tech companies]3681-tech companies , [they]3680-many people think of growth stocks . It makes sense , considering many of the top growth stocks over the past couple of decades have been [tech companies]3681-tech companies . However , plenty of [tech companies]3681-tech companies can also provide reliable income via dividends . [Many larger tech companies]3684-many larger tech companies are cash cows , allowing [them]3684-many larger tech companies to reward [shareholders]3685-shareholders aside from just stock price appreciation ( which is n't guaranteed ) . If [you]3686-you 're looking for dividend - paying tech stocks , the following three are good options with above - average yields . 1 . International Business Machines International Business Machines ( IBM -0.30 % ) , better known as [IBM]765-ibm , does n't get the attention the " Magnificent Seven "[857-technavio] stocks do , but [it]3687-it has been a tech titan in [its]3687-it own right for a while . Artificial intelligence ( AI ) made its way to the mainstream in 2023 , but [IBM]765-ibm is one of [the pioneers of the technology]3688-the pioneers of the technology , dating back to the 1950s . [IBM]765-ibm 's quarterly dividend is $ 1.66 , with a trailing-12 - month yield of around 4.4 % -- around 3 times higher than the S&P 500 over that span . [IBM]765-ibm has increased [its]765-ibm annual dividend for 28 consecutive years , and there 's no reason to believe this will change anytime soon . [Its]765-ibm free cash flow is more than enough to cover [its]765-ibm dividend obligations . Although [IBM]765-ibm 's stock finished 2023 up 14 % , it underperformed the S&P 500 by 9 % . Some of [its]765-ibm recent stock price underperformance over the years can be attributed to [its]765-ibm transition away from [legacy businesses like on - premise products]3689-legacy businesses like on - premise products to more high - growth industries like the cloud and cybersecurity . This transformation has n't been the quickest , and [those high - growth areas]3690-those high - growth areas are highly competitive , but [IBM]765-ibm is making significant investments to make it happen . In the meantime , [its]765-ibm lucrative dividend should help [investors]1102-investors practice a bit more patience while the transformation takes place . 2 . [Cisco Systems]761-cisco [Cisco Systems]761-cisco ( [CSCO]761-cisco 1.23 % ) became [the $ 200 billion company [it]761-cisco is today through [its]761-cisco networking hardware]3692-the $ 200 billion company it is today through its networking hardware , including routers and modems , security products , and switches . [It]761-cisco has since expanded [its]761-cisco business to include services in the cloud , [Internet of Things]3693-internet of things ( IoT ) , and cybersecurity industries . [Cisco]761-cisco 's year - over - year revenue growth has slowed from previous quarters , but some of that can be attributed to [[its]761-cisco enterprise customers]2742-its enterprise customers deploying [their]2742-its enterprise customers hardware slower than usual . When this happens , [Cisco]761-cisco may not recognize the revenue ( meaning record it on [its]761-cisco financial statements ) until later quarters . During [Cisco]761-cisco 's latest earnings call , [CEO Chuck Robbins]843-chuck robbins noted this lag could affect [the company]1085-the company 's revenue for the " next couple of quarters . "[0-i] Unlike many other big tech stocks , [Cisco]761-cisco 's stock did n't see explosive growth in 2023 , only increasing by just over 5 % . Thankfully , [it]1085-the company has an above - average dividend to pick up some of the slack . [Cisco]761-cisco 's quarterly dividend is $ 0.39 , with a trailing-12 - month yield of just over 3 % . [Cisco]761-cisco is facing near - term problems , but its attractive dividend and low valuation ( forward price - to - earnings ratio of 13 ) give it much more upside than downside in the long term . 3 . Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing ( TSM -1.90 % ) ( or TSMC ) is [the global leader in semiconductor ( chip ) production]3696-the global leader in semiconductor ( chip ) production . [Its]3696-the global leader in semiconductor ( chip ) production foundry model -- which involves making chips for [[its]3696-the global leader in semiconductor ( chip ) production [clients]1280-clients]3697-its clients ' specific needs instead of general sales -- has driven [the company]1085-the company to become [one of the most important tech companies in [the world]1147-the world]3700-one of the most important tech companies in the world . [[Its]3696-the global leader in semiconductor ( chip ) production clients]3697-its clients include [Apple]780-apple ( iPhone ) , [Nvidia]16-nvidia ( GPUs ) , [Tesla ( electric vehicle components )]3703-tesla ( electric vehicle components ) , and many [other world - class companies]3704-other world - class companies . [TSMC]975-tsmc 's quarterly dividend is $ 0.48 ( accounting for the currency conversion rate ) , with a yield of just over 1.9 % . It 's an above - average dividend yield that acts as a true two - for - one benefit , given [TSMC]975-tsmc 's stock price growth potential . Over the past decade , it has outpaced the S&P 500 considerably , and an AI - fueled boost should keep the momentum going . [TSMC]975-tsmc does n't deal directly with AI , but [its]975-tsmc chips are vital to [many of the companies that do]3705-many of the companies that do . Without [TSMC]975-tsmc 's chips , there are no advanced computing powers ; without advanced computing powers , there 's no efficient data processing ; without efficient data processing , there 's no AI as it exists today . Although there are [other semiconductor companies]3706-other semiconductor companies , [TSMC]975-tsmc 's chips lead the way in performance . AI has n't had a tangible effect on [TSMC]975-tsmc 's financials yet , and there 's no way to say for certain the impact it 'll have . But it 's likely to be a nice addition to a company that is integrated into [many different industries]3707-many different industries .

Server and storage system [manufacturer Super Micro Computer ( SMCI -1.70 %]3800-manufacturer super micro computer ( smci -1.70 % ) has gone from an under - followed value stock to a top pick among [investors looking to bet on artificial intelligence ( AI )]3801-investors looking to bet on artificial intelligence ( ai ) . 2023 was an excellent year : The stock soared nearly 250 % higher . By all indications , [Super Micro]570-super micro could still be a great value right now . But [I]0-i 'm passing once again on [this data center and [enterprise compute manufacturer]3803-enterprise compute manufacturer]3802-this data center and enterprise compute manufacturer . Here are three reasons why . 1 . [Super Micro]570-super micro is sitting on a massive opportunity , but so is [everyone else]3804-everyone else [Super Micro]570-super micro 's head of steam has been building thanks to generative AI . [Chip companies like [Nvidia]16-nvidia]3805-chip companies like nvidia ( [NVDA -5.55 % )]760-nvda , AMD ( AMD -1.89 % ) , and Intel ( INTC -4.66 % ) have been tapping [the manufacturer]3806-the manufacturer to assemble servers ( a powerful computer that gets installed in [a data center or business office]3807-a data center or business office ) that power AI applications . [It]3808-it 's also getting in on [the Arm Holdings data center]3809-the arm holdings data center server game and has a new lineup of servers using chip design start - up Ampere Computing Arm - based chips . [Super Micro]570-super micro just upgraded [its]570-super micro revenue guidance for 2024 , with expectations for it to be in a range between $ 10 billion and $ 11 billion -- versus $ 9.5 billion to $ 10.5 billion before . The dramatic rise thanks to AI is especially clear when viewing sales over the last five years . Super Micro was hauling in only a few billion dollars in revenue just three years ago . However , [Super Micro]570-super micro competes against [many other companies that design and assemble servers and storage devices on behalf of [its]570-super micro semiconductor design and manufacturing partners]3810-many other companies that design and assemble servers and storage devices on behalf of its semiconductor design and manufacturing partners . Competitors include [Cisco Systems]761-cisco , [Dell Technologies]572-dell technologies , [Hewlett Packard Enterprise]479-hewlett packard enterprise , and a growing presence in the server market from equipment and design manufacturers in [Asia]73-asia like Foxconn and [Inspur]573-inspur . [All these peers]3811-all these peers are also sitting on a massive generative AI opportunity . [Super Micro]570-super micro is clearly a standout as [it]570-super micro has gone from [a small and relatively unknown company]3812-a small and relatively unknown company to a hot stock riding the AI wave . But [I]0-i ca n't ignore the hotly competitive field that [Super Micro]570-super micro battles in . 2 . [It]3813-it 's all about forward earnings growth , but not [Super Micro]570-super micro 's own growth At this point , given the sustained growth [Super Micro]570-super micro is expecting , [many investors]3814-many investors are drawn to the cheap valuation -- especially when comparing it to the premium price chip stocks like [Nvidia]16-nvidia and AMD are fetching these days . Indeed , [Super Micro]570-super micro could be a great long - term value right now . Shares trade for 26 times trailing 12 - month earnings per share ( EPS ) , but only 16 times expected EPS for fiscal 2024 . That compares to the respective 24 and 27 times expected EPS for [Nvidia]16-nvidia and AMD for next year . However , [Super Micro]570-super micro 's growth is not coming from [its]570-super micro own efforts . Rather , it 's riding the coattails of others , primarily leaders in semiconductor design , as it makes hay from the AI movement . No matter how [you]3815-you slice it , [Super Micro]570-super micro is dependent on ultimate sales of AI servers powered by partners like [Nvidia]16-nvidia and AMD , making it a type of derivative bet on [those businesses]3816-those businesses ' performance . That 's a big reason for the relative discount on Super Micro stock . 3 . Super Micro admits it has some key disadvantages Nevertheless , [Super Micro]570-super micro is raking in the chips thanks to AI , and its stock is a relative value . So why not just buy ? For [me]0-i , it 's all about the business model . [Super Micro]570-super micro is not in full control of [its]570-super micro own destiny . It could be very cheap if growth continues , but that growth and resulting profitability will be dependent on chip design partners Nvidia , AMD , and the like -- and less on [Super Micro]570-super micro 's own execution . Again , by [Super Micro]570-super micro 's own admission in [its]570-super micro financial filings , [it]570-super micro has limited ability to stave off [competitors]1129-competitors over the long term . In the last annual filing , [Super Micro]570-super micro said the following ( italics inserted by [me]0-i ): [We]3818-our seek to protect [our]3818-our intellectual property rights with a combination of patents , trademarks , copyrights , trade secret laws , and disclosure restrictions . [We]3818-our rely primarily on trade secrets , technical know - how , and other unpatented proprietary information relating to [our]3818-our design and product development activities . In other words , the majority of [Super Micro]570-super micro 's work has no patent protection , which is a key item [I]0-i look for when investing in [hardware - based businesses]3819-hardware - based businesses ( like semiconductor stocks ) . Although Super Micro certainly has [its]570-super micro own proprietary way of designing and assembling enterprise computing and storage systems , few of those processes are granted patent and intellectual property ( IP ) protection . Again , by Super Micro 's own admission in [its]570-super micro last annual filing : [Our]3818-our industry is marked by a large number of patents , copyrights , trade secrets and trademarks and by frequent litigation based on allegations of infringement or other violation of intellectual property rights . [[Our]3818-our primary competitors]3820-our primary competitors have substantially greater numbers of issued patents than [we]3818-our have which may position [us]3818-our less favorably in the event of any claims or litigation with [them]3820-our primary competitors . [Other third parties]3821-other third parties have in the past sent [us]3818-our correspondence regarding [their]3821-other third parties intellectual property or filed claims that [our]3818-our products infringe or violate [third parties]1151-third parties ' intellectual property rights . In addition , [increasingly non - operating companies]3823-increasingly non - operating companies are purchasing patents and bringing claims against [technology companies]3824-technology companies . [We]3818-our have been subject to several such claims and may be subject to such claims in the future . When looking for a long - term investment in AI , and in whatever other mega trends lie ahead for the greater IT sector , [I]0-i ca n't say " yes "[1011-hightower] to owning every stock . This kind of risk and lack of competitive differentiation inherent in [Super Micro]570-super micro 's business model just does n't cut it for [me]0-i . Besides , [I]0-i already own ample shares of Nvidia , AMD , and [data center design leader [Arista Networks]575-arista networks]3825-data center design leader arista networks , so buying [Super Micro]570-super micro would offer little in the form of portfolio diversification for [me]0-i . [I]0-i understand the draw to Super Micro stock as 2024 gets underway , and [the swarm of investors betting on [the company]1085-the company]3826-the swarm of investors betting on the company could be right in assuming it will be [a big beneficiary from the AI movement]3828-a big beneficiary from the ai movement . But as for [me]0-i , [I]0-i 'm passing on Super Micro stock again in 2024 .

Many high - yielding tech stocks lost [their]3860-their luster over the past two years , as rising interest rates drove [investors]1102-investors toward the safety of certificates of deposit and T - bills . But with [many investors]3814-many investors expecting interest rates to stabilize or decline in 2024 , it makes sense to consider adding a few of these unloved blue chip dividend plays back to [your]3863-your portfolio . That 's because over the long run , many stable blue chip tech stocks with high yields tend to outperform fixed - income investments with set maturity dates . So as the new year starts , [I]0-i think it would be smart to buy three dividend plays : [Cisco]761-cisco ( CSCO 1.23 % ) , Texas Instruments ( TXN -1.70 % ) , and [Corning]987-corning ( GLW 0.34 % ) . 1 . [Cisco Systems Cisco]587-cisco systems cisco is [the world]1147-the world ['s largest networking hardware and software company]3865-'s largest networking hardware and software company . [The company]1085-the company struggled with supply chain constraints in fiscal 2022 ( which ended in July 2022 ) , but [it]1085-the company overcame those challenges in fiscal 2023 , and revenue growth accelerated again . Unfortunately , that recovery ended in the first quarter of fiscal 2024 as [Cisco]761-cisco 's revenue declined sequentially again . Macro headwinds caused the slowdown , driving [many of [[its]761-cisco large [enterprise , service provider]3869-enterprise , service provider]3868-its large enterprise , service provider , and [cloud customers]3870-cloud customers]3867-many of its large enterprise , service provider , and cloud customers to deploy [their]3867-many of its large enterprise , service provider , and cloud customers purchased hardware at a slower - than - expected rate . [[Cisco]761-cisco CEO [Chuck Robbins]843-chuck robbins]3871-cisco ceo chuck robbins admitted that [customers]1091-customers were still waiting to deploy " one quarter to two quarters ' worth of shipped orders "[1011-hightower] -- and that [the company]1085-the company 's revenue would drop 4 % to 6 % for the full year as [its]761-cisco adjusted EPS stays roughly flat . That outlook weighed down the stock , but [it]1085-the company now trades at just 13 times forward earnings and pays a high forward dividend yield of 3.1 % . That low valuation and high yield should limit [its]761-cisco downside potential until [the company]1085-the company overcomes near - term challenges . [Cisco]761-cisco is also in the process of acquiring [Splunk]988-splunk to expand [its]761-cisco networking observability and cybersecurity platforms . That $ 28 billion deal , which is expected to close in the third quarter of calendar 2024 , should reduce [Cisco]761-cisco 's dependence on traditional networking hardware and increase the stickiness of [its]761-cisco software and services ecosystem . 2 . Texas Instruments Texas Instruments manufactures analog and embedded chips for [a broad range of [customers]1091-customers]3875-a broad range of customers . These chips are n't as powerful as CPUs or GPUs , but they handle essential tasks such as wireless communications and power management features . Over the past year , the softness of [[TI]989-ti 's industrial and communications markets]3877-ti 's industrial and communications markets -- which were both heavily exposed to the macro headwinds -- offset the stronger growth in [its]989-ti automotive , personal electronics , and enterprise systems markets . That 's why [analysts]1113-analysts expect [its]989-ti revenue and earnings to decline 12 % and 25 % , respectively , in 2023 . That cyclical slowdown , along with [the company]1085-the company 's commitment to ramp up [its]1085-the company spending on [its]1085-the company long - term transition from 200 mm to 300 mm wafers , which will reduce the costs of [its]1085-the company unpackaged parts by roughly 40 % over the long term , spooked the bulls . For 2024 , analysts expect [its]989-ti revenue to rise just 1 % as [its]989-ti earnings decline another 6 % . That near - term outlook seems grim , but [TI]989-ti has weathered downturns before . [It]989-ti 's also committed to returning most of [its]989-ti free cash flow ( FCF ) to [[its]989-ti investors]3466-its investors through buybacks and dividends . [The company]1085-the company bought back nearly half [its]1085-the company shares since 2004 and raised [its]1085-the company dividend annually for the past 20 years . [Its]1085-the company attractive forward yield of 3.1 % , along with a reasonable forward multiple of 25 , should limit the downside potential as the macro environment improves and [TI]989-ti upgrades [[its]989-ti plants]3882-its plants . 3 . [Corning Corning]588-corning corning is the creator of Gorilla Glass , the chemically hardened glass that shields LCD and OLED screens on smartphones and other devices . [It]588-corning corning also sells glass substrates for display panels , optical equipment , lab equipment for [life science companies]3883-life science companies , and particulate filters for [automakers]2434-automakers . [Corning]987-corning 's sales surged 25 % in 2021 as the pandemic ended , [its]987-corning core markets stabilized , and [it]987-corning received fresh orders from [Apple]780-apple . But in 2022 , [Corning]987-corning 's revenue rose only 1 % -- and [analysts]1113-analysts anticipate a 9 % decline in 2023 . That deceleration was largely driven by the softness of [its]987-corning optical and display panel markets , [Apple]780-apple 's slower iPhone sales , and tough currency headwinds . [Analysts]1113-analysts expect earnings to decline 19 % . But just like [Cisco]761-cisco and [TI]989-ti , [Corning]987-corning has survived cyclical downturns before . [Corning]987-corning reduced [its]987-corning share count by nearly 40 % over the past decade , and it still looks cheap at 15 times forward earnings . [It]987-corning also pays a high forward yield of 3.7 % . [Corning]987-corning 's growth should remain weak throughout the first half of 2024 , but sales should bounce back in the second half as the telecom display , semiconductor , smartphone , tablet , and notebook markets recover . Analysts expect [the company]1085-the company 's revenue and EPS to rise 2 % and 17 % , respectively , in 2024 -- so it might be a good time to load up on [this blue chip stalwart]3888-this blue chip stalwart .

What a difference a year can make on [Wall Street]134-wall street . After enduring two bear markets in less than three years , all three major indexes soared in 2023 . The iconic Dow Jones Industrial Average climbed to a record high , while the broad - based S&P 500 and growth - focused Nasdaq Composite rallied by 24 % and 43 % , respectively . It was a phenomenal year for [optimists]3889-optimists . However , putting [your]3890-your money to work on [Wall Street]134-wall street is n't about where stocks have been , so much as where [they]3891-they 're headed next . Based on a handful of predictive tools and money - based metrics , 2024 looks as if it 'll be a more challenging year for equities . In other words , a bit of [a stock picker]3892-a stock picker 's market . The good news is that , regardless of what 's thrown [investors]1102-investors ' way in the new year , bargains can still be found . For [investors willing to swing for the fences]3894-investors willing to swing for the fences , the following seven magnificent stocks are fully capable of doubling [your]3890-your money in 2024 . 1 . Fastly The first superb stock that has all the tools needed to deliver triple - digit returns for [investors]1102-investors in 2024 is edge cloud company Fastly ( FSLY 3.33 % ) . Though Fastly offers [businesses]1180-businesses a number of solutions , [it]987-corning 's best - known for [its]987-corning content delivery network ( CDN ) , which moves content from the edge of the cloud to [end users]1949-end users as quickly and securely as possible . The big knock against [Fastly]866-fastly has long been [its]866-fastly operating losses . While [the company]1085-the company 's sales have been growing by a healthy double - digit rate , [its]866-fastly losses compounded throughout 2021 and most of 2022 . However , the hiring of [Todd Nightingale]867-nightingale as [CEO]1372-ceo appears to have rectified this problem . Before joining [Fastly]866-fastly as CEO in September 2022 , [Nightingale]867-nightingale was [the executive vice president and general manager of [Cisco Systems]761-cisco ' Enterprise Networking and Cloud segment]3900-the executive vice president and general manager of cisco systems ' enterprise networking and cloud segment . [He]3900-the executive vice president and general manager of cisco systems ' enterprise networking and cloud segment has keen knowledge of the opportunities that lie ahead for [Fastly]866-fastly , but more importantly understands how to reduce expenses , generate positive cash flow , and move [the company]1085-the company to recurring profitability . If [Fastly]866-fastly can reach recurring profits ahead of [Wall Street]134-wall street 's expectations , shares could easily soar in the new year . It also does n't hurt that [businesses]1180-businesses are shifting [their]1180-businesses data online and into the cloud at an accelerated pace . The COVID-19 pandemic solidified [Fastly]866-fastly 's role as [an important CDN]3903-an important cdn , and the burgeoning data - center economy , which is also being fueled by the rise of artificial intelligence ( AI ) , bodes well for [the company]1085-the company 's future growth prospects . As long as [the company]1085-the company 's key performance indicators continue to expand -- e.g. , average enterprise customer spend , [total customers]3906-total customers , and dollar - based net expansion rate -- Fastly is a candidate to deliver triple - digit returns in 2024 . 2 . [Novavax]990-novavax Over the past four years , biotech stock [Novavax]990-novavax ( NVAX -2.85 % ) has completed a wild round trip . [Its]990-novavax involvement in coronavirus vaccine development sent shares from $ 4 to north of $ 300 by early 2021 . As of the end of 2023 , [Novavax]990-novavax shares were back below $ 5 . Although COVID-19 vaccine demand has declined considerably , there are a couple of catalysts that can send [Novavax]990-novavax 's stock higher by 100 % , or more , in 2024 . The first wildcard is [its]990-novavax development of a combination COVID-19 / influenza vaccine . Even though [the company]1085-the company does n't anticipate bringing a combination vaccine to market prior to 2026 ( assuming accelerated approval ) , the simple fact that [Novavax]990-novavax is getting [its]990-novavax late - stage study under way in the second - half of 2024 should fuel excitement among [investors]1102-investors . Secondly , [Novavax]990-novavax 's aggressive cost - cutting campaign has the potential to meaningfully reduce [its]990-novavax operating losses . [The company]1085-the company 's 2023 operating expenses were nearly halved through September , compared to the prior - year period . [Management]991-management anticipates shaving another $ 300 million off of [its]990-novavax annual expenditures in 2024 . But the biggest catalyst of all would be a favorable ruling in [its]990-novavax arbitration case with [Gavi]992-gavi , [a nongovernmental vaccine alliance]3910-a nongovernmental vaccine alliance . [Gavi]992-gavi is seeking $ 700 million tied to [Novavax]990-novavax 's cancellation of [their]990-novavax original agreement to purchase 350 million doses of [the company]1085-the company 's COVID-19 vaccine . If [Novavax]990-novavax avoids having to pay [Gavi]992-gavi $ 700 million , a monumental weight will be lifted off of [the company]1085-the company 's proverbial shoulders . 3 . Fiverr International A third magnificent stock that has the necessary catalysts and competitive advantages to double [your]3913-your money in 2024 is online - services provider [Fiverr International]590-fiverr international ( FVRR 1.93 % ) . Fiverr 's online marketplace connects [freelancers]1395-freelancers with businesses that need [their]1395-freelancers services . The one thing that could derail Fiverr in the new year is a U.S. recession . It 's not uncommon for the unemployment rate to move higher when U.S. economic growth shifts into reverse . Then again , the U.S. economy grew by 5.2 % during the third quarter , which is a blistering pace that favors a continued strong labor market . [Fiverr]868-fiverr looks poised to benefit from a seemingly permanent shift in the labor force following the pandemic . While [some folks]3915-some folks have returned to [the office]1495-the office , [more people than ever]3917-more people than ever are working remotely . That 's great news for a freelancer - driven platform . Fiverr 's marketplace also appears to be resonating with [businesses]1180-businesses . Having [freelancers]1395-freelancers price [their]1395-freelancers services at an all - inclusive cost , as opposed to an hourly rate like [many of [[Fiverr]868-fiverr 's competitors]3921-fiverr 's competitors]3920-many of fiverr 's competitors , leads to superior cost transparency for [buyers]3922-buyers . Not surprisingly , spend per [buyer]1969-buyer has been climbing at a steady pace . However , the best thing about [Fiverr]868-fiverr just might be [its]868-fiverr take rate -- [i.e.]3924-i.e. , the percentage of each deal negotiated on [its]868-fiverr platform , including fees , that [it]868-fiverr gets to keep . [Fiverr]868-fiverr 's take rate hit 31.3 % in the September - ended quarter , which is practically double [its]868-fiverr peers . As [Fiverr]868-fiverr continues to scale in 2024 , [its]868-fiverr take rate will power [its]868-fiverr adjusted earnings higher . 4 . [StoneCo]993-stoneco Another phenomenal stock that can deliver 100 % or greater returns to [[its]993-stoneco shareholders]1452-its shareholders in 2024 is [fintech company StoneCo]3926-fintech company stoneco ( STNE 0.48 % ) . [StoneCo]993-stoneco provides an assortment of payment , banking , and credit solutions to [businesses in [Brazil]104-brazil]3927-businesses in brazil . Putting aside that the 2022 bear market clobbered most high - growth stocks , one of the top reasons [the company]1085-the company 's shares shed 90 % of [their]3929-their value in less than two years is inflation . [[Brazil]104-brazil 's central bank]3930-brazil 's central bank raised interest rates from 2 % to 13.75 % in a little over a year to stamp out sky - high inflation . Since [StoneCo]993-stoneco 's loan division is backed by debt , and [the company]1085-the company was initially unwilling to raise prices on [smaller businesses]3932-smaller businesses , [its]1085-the company profitability took a temporary hit . Thankfully , this is no a longer an issue . What makes [StoneCo]993-stoneco so attractive is [its]993-stoneco evolution as [a business]2546-a business . Whereas [the company]1085-the company had primarily been focusing on [small businesses]1892-small businesses and [micro - merchants]3936-micro - merchants , [it]1085-the company 's expanded [its]1085-the company solutions to also target [medium - sized businesses , which are more likely to move [its]1085-the company profit needle]3937-medium - sized businesses , which are more likely to move its profit needle . Furthermore , through a combination of acquisitions ( e.g. , Linx in 2020 ) and organic innovation , [it]1085-the company 's no longer just [a payments company]3938-a payments company . [StoneCo]993-stoneco now offers banking , software , and credit solutions to [micro- , small- , and medium - sized businesses]3939-micro- , small- , and medium - sized businesses . What 's particularly noteworthy is that [StoneCo]993-stoneco has seen an uptick in the percentage of [[its]993-stoneco clients]3697-its clients that are using multiple services . PubMatic If the U.S. economy cooperates , adtech stock PubMatic ( PUBM 0.85 % ) can also make a strong case for delivering triple - digit returns in the new year . [PubMatic]994-pubmatic operates a cloud - based , programmatic ad platform for [publishers]3944-publishers . In simpler terms , it 's a sell - side platform ( SSP ) that helps [publishing companies]3945-publishing companies sell [[their]3945-publishing companies digital display space]3946-their digital display space . Since the ad industry is highly cyclical , a healthy economy is often required to lift year - over - year ad spending . But it 's worth noting that 2024 is an election year . Based on projections from paid advertising agency GroupM , political ad revenue will near $ 16 billion in the U.S. this year , which would represent a 31 % increase in spending when compared to the 2020 election cycle . PubMatic just happens to be at the center of the fastest - growing aspect of digital advertising : mobile , video , and connected TV . This suggests it 's primed for a strong year . PubMatic is also benefiting from a wave of consolidation among [SSPs]995-ssps . With less in the way of viable competition , [it]994-pubmatic 's grown [its]994-pubmatic share of the SSP space to between 4 % and 4.5 % . Perhaps the biggest advantage [PubMatic]994-pubmatic brings to the table is that [it]994-pubmatic designed and developed [its]994-pubmatic cloud - based infrastructure . [It]3955-it 's a drug that 's capable of more than $ 500 million in annual sales by 2028 . Something else noteworthy about [Lexicon]996-lexicon 's first approved therapy is that it 's the only SGLT1 / SGLT2 inhibitor on the market . While there are other SGLT2 inhibitors on pharmacy shelves ( SGLT2 inhibitors block glucose absorption in the kidneys ) , Inpefa doubles up with SGLT1 inhibition , which blocks glucose absorption in the intestines . This competitive advantage should lead to strong pricing power and potentially better - than - anticipated long - term demand for Inpefa . Here 's why investing in the Dow Jones Industrial Average could work out well in 2024 . The Dow 's known flaw is overplayed The long - standing criticism of the Dow is that it is price - weighted . This means that the rather arbitrary price of a stock dictates its weight in the index , rather than the case with a market - cap - weighted index like the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite , where [Apple]780-apple and [Microsoft]768-microsoft hold the highest weightings since [they]3977-they are [the most valuable companies]3978-the most valuable companies . The price - weighted system is n't perfect . But it works [itself]3979-itself out , as [the Dow]815-the dow is much more balanced than [it]815-the dow is often given credit for . [The stocks that do well over time ( assuming no stock split]3980-the stocks that do well over time ( assuming no stock split ) hold a larger share of the index , while the ones that languish hold a smaller share . The big exception is [Apple]780-apple , which would have been the largest stock in [the Dow]815-the dow if [it]780-apple had n't issued a stock split in 2020 . But overall , the system works well . About half the stocks in [the Dow]815-the dow have between a 2 % and 5 % weighting . [Six stocks]3981-six stocks have over a 5 % weighting , and six stocks have below a 1 % weighting . The stocks that are heavier weighted are probably the ones that [most investors]3982-most investors would rather have more of . [The six stocks with a weighting over 5 %]3983-the six stocks with a weighting over 5 % are [UnitedHealth]816-unitedhealth , [Goldman Sachs Group]599-goldman sachs group , [Microsoft]768-microsoft , [Home Depot]143-home depot , [McDonald]613-mcdonald 's 's , and Caterpillar -- all quality , [dividend - paying companies with low to medium growth prospects]3984-dividend - paying companies with low to medium growth prospects . [The Dow]815-the dow has a unique blend of different industries , whereas the S&P 500 , and especially the Nasdaq , are dominated by [tech , consumer discretionary , and communications]3985-tech , consumer discretionary , and communications . But [it]815-the dow is still packed with plenty of growth , with over 30 % of the index allocated to tech and consumer discretionary stocks . The Dow 's concentration is an advantage The big difference between [the Dow]815-the dow and the S&P 500 or Nasdaq 100 is that [the Dow]815-the dow has only 30 stocks . So there are just a handful of companies representing a sector . [You]3987-you can think of [the Dow]815-the dow like a representative democracy , where there is [an elected official that represents a much larger sector]3988-an elected official that represents a much larger sector , whereas [the S&P 500]3989-the s&p 500 is going to include several stocks from [a sector]3990-a sector , and a total market fund will include hundreds . In this vein , the Dow is basically a concentrated portfolio with only [the industry - leading companies]3991-the industry - leading companies . And with a few exceptions , [I]0-i think [the Dow]815-the dow stocks are great choices . The Dow stocks [I]0-i 'm not particularly a fan of are [IBM]765-ibm , [Cisco Systems]761-cisco , [Verizon Communications]3992-verizon communications , [Merck]399-merck , and [Walgreens Boots Alliance]3993-walgreens boots alliance . But these stocks make up just 6.7 % of [the Dow]815-the dow . All of [them]3994-them have underperformed the market in recent years . And because of that , [they]3994-them are gradually making up a smaller share of the Dow . Here 's where the beauty of the Dow really starts to shine . [An outperforming stock]3995-an outperforming stock , no matter the sector , has the potential to contribute to big gains for the index . It happened with UnitedHealth , which has outperformed the S&P 500 over the last five years and is now the highest - weighted stock in [the Dow]815-the dow . [Microsoft]768-microsoft had a big year in 2023 , and it could one day surpass [UnitedHealth]816-unitedhealth as the most important stock in the index . In sum , the composition of [the Dow]3996-the dow lets [winners]3997-winners run by giving [them]3997-winners a larger share of the index . [It]3998-it achieves sector diversification . And [it]3996-the dow has plenty of industry - leading growth stocks , value stocks , and income stocks . The Dow is a perfect fit for [conservative investors]3999-conservative investors Before buying a [Dow ETF]1009-dow etf , [I]0-i think it 's important to first and foremost generally agree with [the Dow]815-the dow 's picks . The biggest downside of the index is that it leaves very little room for explosive growth . [Massive industry - leading companies]4001-massive industry - leading companies can only move so much compared to [smaller companies]4002-smaller companies . Rather , [the Dow]815-the dow is more about low risk and moderate potential reward , which could benefit investors who are risk - averse , focused on capital preservation , or simply looking to take [their]4003-their foot off the gas and deploy new capital toward less risky avenues in 2024 . Index 2023 Year - to - Date 2022 2021 2020 2019 2018 2017 2016 2015 2014 Nasdaq Composite 43.3 % ( 33.1 % ) 21.4 % 43.6 % 35.2 % ( 3.9 % ) 28.2 % 7.5 % 5.7 % 13.4 % Dow Jones Industrial Average 12.8 % ( 8.8 % ) 18.7 % 7.3 % 22.3 % ( 5.6 % ) 25.1 % 13.4 % ( 2.2 % ) 7.5 % In general , [the Dow]1004-the dow has underperformed during strong years in the stock market because [the Dow]1004-the dow has a higher focus on value and income , whereas [the Nasdaq Composite]4095-the nasdaq composite focuses less on value and income . If the market is doing well , that probably means [investors]1102-investors are willing to take on more risk , pay a higher price for growth , and gravitate toward Nasdaq stocks . [One of the largest Dow exchange - traded funds]4099-one of the largest dow exchange - traded funds ( ETFs ) , the SPDR [Dow Jones Industrial Average Trust]620-dow jones industrial average trust ( DIA -0.12 % ) , has an average component price - to - earnings ratio of 22.1 . The stark contrast in valuation shows that [premium investors]4100-premium investors are willing to pay for growth right now . And it also shows that , despite a strong year - to - date return for the Dow , the index is still a fairly good price . The Invesco QQQ Trust 's expensive multiple shows that [investors]1102-investors are banking on future earnings , not present earnings . And because of that , Nasdaq stock prices have grown at a faster rate than earnings . By comparison , [many companies in [the Dow]815-the dow]4102-many companies in the dow already make money . So , [they]4102-many companies in the dow are more valued for [their]4102-many companies in the dow present earnings rather than what [they]4102-many companies in the dow could make in the distant future .
