Comparing [Cisco Systems]761-cisco P / E Against [Its]4139-its Peers The P / E ratio is used by [long - term shareholders]4137-long - term shareholders to assess [the company]1085-the company 's market performance against aggregate market data , historical earnings , and [the industry at large]4142-the industry at large . A lower P / E could indicate that [shareholders]3685-shareholders do not expect the stock to perform better in the future or it could mean that [the company]1085-the company is undervalued . Compared to the aggregate P / E ratio of the 104.65 in the Communications Equipment industry , [Cisco Systems Inc.]165-cisco systems inc. has a lower P / E ratio of 15.02 . [Shareholders]3685-shareholders might be inclined to think that the stock might perform worse than [it]4139-its 's industry peers . It 's also possible that the stock is undervalued . In conclusion , the price - to - earnings ratio is a useful metric for analyzing [a company]1131-a company 's market performance , but it has its limitations . While a lower P / E can indicate that [a company]1131-a company is undervalued , it can also suggest that [shareholders]3685-shareholders do not expect future growth . Additionally , the P / E ratio should not be used in isolation , as other factors such as industry trends and business cycles can also impact [a company]1131-a company 's stock price . Therefore , [investors]1102-investors should use the P / E ratio in conjunction with other financial metrics and qualitative analysis to make informed investment decisions .

When examined over extended periods , [Wall Street]134-wall street is a veritable money machine . Even accounting for inevitable down years , the stock market has handily outpaced bonds , gold , oil , and housing in the return department on an annualized basis . The not - so - subtle secret to this outperformance is time . Patience is an incredible ally for [investors]1102-investors that can compound [their]1102-investors gains . The biggest challenge is simply finding game - changing businesses that have the ability to create life - altering wealth . The good news is that [these game changers]4152-these game changers do exist . What follows are four magnificent growth stocks that can build generational wealth by 2040 . Etsy The first amazing growth stock that can be the gift that keeps on giving to [patient investors]4153-patient investors ' portfolios is e - commerce platform Etsy ( ETSY 5.72 % ) . Even though e - commerce is a highly competitive space , [Etsy]1019-etsy has well - defined operating advantages that should afford [it]1019-etsy a sustained double - digit growth rate throughout the remainder of this decade , if not well beyond . When [most people]1551-most people think of online retail sales , [Amazon]767-amazon comes to mind . While it 's true that [Amazon]767-amazon is the dominant force in e - commerce , [it]767-amazon 's entire focus is on volume and retaining [customers]1091-customers within [its]767-amazon ecosystem of ancillary products and services . By comparison , [[Etsy]1019-etsy 's online marketplace]4156-etsy 's online marketplace is built atop the success of [self - proprietors]4157-self - proprietors and [small businesses]1892-small businesses that are focused on personalizing products and services for [consumers]1181-consumers . There simply is n't a company at scale that can deliver the level of personalization that [[Etsy]1019-etsy 's merchants]4160-etsy 's merchants can bring to the table . In addition to standing out in a highly competitive industry , [Etsy]1019-etsy has been incredibly successful at empowering [[its]1019-etsy merchants]4161-its merchants and encouraging [consumers]1181-consumers to open [their]1181-consumers wallets more frequently . With regard to the former , [Etsy]1019-etsy has n't been shy about reinvesting in [its]1019-etsy platform . [It]1019-etsy 's constantly looking for ways to enhance data - tracking tools for [the merchants that support [its]1019-etsy marketplace]4163-the merchants that support its marketplace , and is utilizing artificial intelligence ( AI ) to improve search functionality for [motivated shoppers]4164-motivated shoppers . These investments are clearly paying off . Over the trailing four years , ended Sept. 30 , 2023 , the number of [habitual buyers]4165-habitual buyers has surged exactly 200 % ! [Habitual buyers]4165-habitual buyers are defined as [shoppers who make six ( or more ) purchases]4167-shoppers who make six ( or more ) purchases over the trailing-12 - month period , with the aggregate of these buys totaling at least $ 200 . [Habitual buyers]4165-habitual buyers are what help fuel [Etsy]1019-etsy 's pricing power with [merchants]4169-merchants . [Etsy]1019-etsy is expected to deliver a 16 % annualized earnings growth rate over the next five years , and may see this growth rate accelerate further if [its]1019-etsy investments in AI - driven search pay off . Lovesac A second magnificent growth stock that can help [you]4170-you generate life - altering wealth by 2040 is furniture retailer Lovesac ( LOVE 2.44 % ) . Though [furniture companies]4171-furniture companies are traditionally slow - growing and highly dependent on foot traffic into [physical stores]4172-physical stores , [Lovesac]1020-lovesac is completely changing the perception of this stodgy industry . The biggest differentiating factor for [Lovesac]1020-lovesac is [its]1020-lovesac furniture . While [it]1020-lovesac was originally known for [its]1020-lovesac beanbag - styled chairs called " sacs , "[1020-lovesac] nearly 90 % of [the company]1085-the company 's net sales now come from " sactionals "[836-jeetu patel] -- modular couches that can be rearranged a variety of ways to fit most living spaces . On top of superior functionality , sactionals have over 200 different cover choices , come with an assortment of upgrade options ( e.g. , built - in wireless charging stations and/or surround sound ) , and the yarn used in [their]1019-etsy production is made from recycled plastic water bottles . It 's a unique product that has no comparison . As [you]4170-you may have guessed , uniqueness comes with a price . Sactionals are typically going to be pricier than a traditional sectional couch . But this is perfectly fine with [[Lovesac]1020-lovesac 's management team]4174-lovesac 's management team . In fact , [Lovesac]1020-lovesac is specifically targeting [a middle - to - upper - income consumer]4175-a middle - to - upper - income consumer with [its]1020-lovesac products . [Well - to - do consumers]4176-well - to - do consumers are less likely to change [their]4176-well - to - do consumers buying habits if the inflation rate picks up or the U.S. economy " hiccups . "[836-jeetu patel] This should help [the company]1085-the company navigate economic downturns far better than [[its]1020-lovesac peers]1308-its peers . Another key difference for [Lovesac]1020-lovesac is [its]1020-lovesac omnichannel sales platform . During the height of the COVID-19 pandemic , [Lovesac]1020-lovesac was able to shift a significant percentage of [its]1020-lovesac sales to online channels . When coupled with [[its]1020-lovesac popup showrooms]4179-its popup showrooms and handful of brand - name partnerships , [Lovesac]1020-lovesac has the means to go beyond [brick - and - mortar stores]4180-brick - and - mortar stores to generate sales and increase brand awareness . [It]1020-lovesac also sports less in the way of overhead expenses than [[its]1020-lovesac peers]1308-its peers . [Lovesac]1020-lovesac is [a small - cap company with big - cap aspirations]4182-a small - cap company with big - cap aspirations by 2040 . PubMatic The third unparalleled growth stock capable of producing game - changing wealth for [patient investors]4153-patient investors by 2040 is adtech company PubMatic ( PUBM 0.85 % ) . Advertising companies are cyclical , and PubMatic is no exception . When economic downturns occur , the expectation is for ad spending to slow . The thing is , recessions are short - lived . Three - quarters of U.S. recessions following World War II have n't lasted 12 months . By comparison , most economic expansions have endured multiple years , with two lasting a decade . [PubMatic]994-pubmatic finds [itself]994-pubmatic in [an industry that disproportionately benefits from long - winded expansions]4184-an industry that disproportionately benefits from long - winded expansions . Additionally , [PubMatic]994-pubmatic is at the center of the fastest - growing niche of the ad industry : digital advertising . [It]994-pubmatic 's a sell - side platform ( SSP ) that helps [publishers]3944-publishers sell [their]3944-publishers digital display space to advertisers . With a core focus on mobile , video , and connected TV , [PubMatic]994-pubmatic has multiple channels capable of double - digit annualized sales growth for a long time to come . Something else worth adding is that there 's been quite a bit of consolidation in the SSP arena in recent years . With few reputable SSPs still around , [PubMatic]994-pubmatic has been able to roughly double [its]994-pubmatic market share to a range of 4 % to 4.5 % . [[The company]1085-the company 's management team]4187-the company 's management team believes PubMatic has a path to an eventual 20 % share of the sell - side market . Another advantage for [PubMatic]994-pubmatic is [its]994-pubmatic prescient choice to design and develop [its]994-pubmatic own cloud - based infrastructure . Not having to rely on a third - party platform will come in especially handy as [the company]1085-the company 's sales ramp up . Specifically , [it]994-pubmatic 'll be keeping more of [its]994-pubmatic revenue , which should result in a superior operating margin , relative to [[its]994-pubmatic peers]1308-its peers . The icing on the cake for [PubMatic]994-pubmatic is [its]994-pubmatic pristine balance sheet . [The company]1085-the company closed out September with $ 171.4 million in cash , cash equivalents , and marketable securities , with no debt . This gives [PubMatic]994-pubmatic exceptional financial flexibility to grow [its]994-pubmatic platform . Fastly A fourth magnificent growth stock that can build generational wealth by 2040 is none other than edge computing company Fastly ( FSLY 3.33 % ) . Fastly is best - known for [its]1085-the company content delivery network ( CDN ) , which moves data from the edge of the cloud to [end users]1949-end users as quickly and securely as possible . The single biggest catalyst for Fastly is the steady shift of data online and into the cloud by [businesses]1180-businesses . The rise of the data - center economy and AI in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic suggests that CDNs are only getting busier as time passes . That 's excellent news for Fastly , whose platform is usage driven ( i.e. , more data consumed by [end users]1949-end users should equate to higher gross profit for [the company]1085-the company ) . Though Fastly 's stock came under pressure in 2022 due to widening losses , many of [the company]1085-the company 's key performance indicators are steadily improving . Since the end of 2021 , [Fastly]866-fastly has added [172 customers]4196-172 customers ( 80 of which are [enterprise clients]4197-enterprise clients ) , expanded the capacity of [[its]866-fastly global network]4198-its global network by 58 % , and seen average spend per [enterprise customer]4199-enterprise customer jump from $ 704,000 to $ 832,000 . Most importantly , [the company]1085-the company 's dollar - based net expansion rate ( DBNER ) has been steady between 118 % and 123 % for eight consecutive quarters , with an annual revenue retention rate of 99.2 % . What [DBNER]865-dbner tells [investors]1102-investors is that [existing clients]1375-existing clients are spending between 18 % and 23 % more on a year - over - year basis . Meanwhile , [enterprise customers]1179-enterprise customers are broadly sticking with the platform . [Long - term investors]4204-long - term investors should also be excited about the hiring of [Todd Nightingale]867-nightingale as [CEO]1372-ceo ( effective as of September 2022 ) . [Nightingale]867-nightingale came over from [Cisco Systems]761-cisco , where [he]1372-ceo was [the executive vice president and general manager of]4206-the executive vice president and general manager of [Enterprise Networking and Cloud]4207-enterprise networking and cloud . Though [he]1372-ceo has keen knowledge of opportunities that lie ahead for [Fastly]866-fastly , it 's [his]1372-ceo cost - cutting ability that 's proved invaluable , thus far . [Fastly]866-fastly looks to be nearing recurring profitability , and [Wall Street analysts]4208-wall street analysts have pegged [the company]1085-the company for an annualized earnings growth rate of 30 % over the next five years . [It]866-fastly has all the tools necessary to be a portfolio game - changer by 2040 .

News Summary : [Cisco]761-cisco intends to acquire privately held Isovalent , Inc. , [a leader in open source cloud native networking and security]4216-a leader in open source cloud native networking and security . Together , [Cisco]761-cisco and Isovalent will build leading edge protection for every workload on every cloud . [SAN JOSE]239-san jose , [Calif.]126-calif. , Dec. 21 , 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- [Cisco]761-cisco ( NASDAQ : [CSCO]761-cisco ) today announced the intent to acquire [Isovalent]898-isovalent , a leader in open source cloud native networking and security , to bolster [its]898-isovalent secure networking capabilities across public clouds . [Cisco]761-cisco announces intent to acquire [Isovalent]898-isovalent , [Inc.]306-inc. The acquisition of [Isovalent]898-isovalent will build on the Cisco Security Cloud vision , [an AI - driven , cloud delivered , integrated security platform for organizations of any shape and size]2405-an ai - driven , cloud delivered , integrated security platform for organizations of any shape and size . [The Cisco Security Cloud]4219-the cisco security cloud enables [customers]1091-customers to abstract security controls from multicloud infrastructure to provide advanced protection against emerging threats across any cloud , application or workload . " Together with Isovalent , [Cisco]761-cisco will build on the open source power of Cilium to create a truly unique multicloud security and networking capability to help [customers]1091-customers simplify and accelerate [their]1091-customers digital transformation journeys , "[1021-stephen augustus] said [Jeetu Patel]836-jeetu patel , [executive vice president and general manager of Security and Collaboration at]4221-executive vice president and general manager of security and collaboration at [Cisco]761-cisco . " Imagine in today 's distributed environment - of applications , virtual machines , containers and cloud assets - having security controls with total visibility , without hindering networking and application performance . The combination of [Cisco]761-cisco and [Isovalent]898-isovalent will make this a reality . "[1021-stephen augustus] [[Isovalent]898-isovalent 's team]4213-isovalent 's team is a major contributor to the open source technology eBPF , and has led the development of Cilium , the leading cloud native solution for networking and security . eBPF provides unmatched visibility into the inner workings of the operating system - an ideal interface for building security systems that can protect a workload while it runs . Cilium provides [IT and platform engineering teams]4223-it and platform engineering teams with powerful networking capabilities and unparalleled visibility into the behavior and communication of cloud native applications , enabling seamless policy definition of [software - defined networks]4224-software - defined networks . [Isovalent]898-isovalent has also recently introduced : Cilium Mesh : allows for the easy connection of Kubernetes clusters with existing infrastructure across hybrid clouds , allows for the easy connection of [Kubernetes]646-kubernetes clusters with existing infrastructure across hybrid clouds , Tetragon : an eBPF - based open source security solution that provides visibility to and enforces runtime behavior within an application and on [the network]4225-the network . an [eBPF - based open source security]4226-ebpf - based open source security solution that provides visibility to and enforces runtime behavior within an application and on [the network]4225-the network . Isovalent Enterprise : an enterprise distribution of Cilium and [Tetragon]643-tetragon [Cisco]761-cisco intends to continue offering and building on [Isovalent]898-isovalent 's slate of innovations for [customers]1091-customers , including [Isovalent Enterprise]647-isovalent enterprise . " [Cisco]761-cisco is committed to nurturing , investing in , and contributing to the eBPF and [Cilium]640-cilium open source communities , "[1031-mr. replogle] said [Stephen Augustus]1021-stephen augustus , [Head of Open Source at [Cisco]761-cisco]4229-head of open source at cisco . " [[Isovalent]898-isovalent 's team]4213-isovalent 's team will join [Cisco]761-cisco 's deep bench of open source governance and technical leadership to solve complex cloud native , security , and networking challenges . [Their]4213-isovalent 's team knowledge will accelerate innovation across the business and help further strengthen the Cisco Security Cloud platform to meet the growing demands of [[our]4987-our customers]1599-our customers . "[1031-mr. replogle] [Isovalent]898-isovalent holds leadership positions in the [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]648-cloud native computing foundation and eBPF Foundation , in addition to upstream software contributions , and this acquisition strengthens [Cisco]761-cisco 's role in supporting the open source ecosystem . [Together]4230-together as [leaders in networking and security]4231-leaders in networking and security , [Cisco]761-cisco and [Isovalent]898-isovalent will build solutions powered by eBPF technology that aim to solve the challenge of protecting workloads no matter where [they]4232-they reside . [Cisco]761-cisco is committed to Cilium and [Tetragon]643-tetragon as open source projects and intends to create [an independent advisory board to help steer [Cisco]761-cisco 's contributions to these important efforts in a way that is aligned with the needs of [the open source community]4234-the open source community]4233-an independent advisory board to help steer cisco 's contributions to these important efforts in a way that is aligned with the needs of the open source community . [The Isovalent team]4215-the isovalent team will join [the Cisco Security Business Group]4236-the cisco security business group once the acquisition closes , which is expected in the third quarter of fiscal year 2024 . [Technavio Research experts]4266-technavio research experts have provided more insights on the market share of segments - View the Free Sample Report How Can Content Protection Safeguard [Your]4252-your Digital Assets ? Exploring Key Strategies and Technologies In an age where digital assets reign supreme , the need to shield content from unauthorized access and misuse has become paramount . The Content Protection Market stands as a bastion , leveraging a multifaceted approach to fortify digital content against an array of threats . Digital Rights Management ( DRM ) forms the cornerstone of this ecosystem , enabling [creators]4253-creators and [distributors]4268-distributors to manage and control access to [their]4253-creators intellectual property ( IP ) through encryption , access controls , and usage policies . This ensures that copyrighted material remains safeguarded from illicit duplication or distribution . Copyright Protection mechanisms act as [guardians of original works]4269-guardians of original works , empowering [creators]4253-creators with legal tools to safeguard [their]4253-creators artistic endeavors from unauthorized reproduction or distribution , preserving [their]4253-creators economic value and creative integrity . As the digital landscape expands , Anti - Piracy Solutions emerge as a bulwark against piracy , employing innovative technologies to detect , prevent , and combat unauthorized copying and distribution of digital content . Content Monitoring tools play a pivotal role in the proactive surveillance of online platforms , swiftly identifying and addressing instances of infringement to protect intellectual property . The battle against counterfeit products is waged through Anti - Counterfeiting measures , employing sophisticated technologies like digital watermarks and blockchain to authenticate and validate the genuineness of products , curbing illicit replication . Content Encryption , a fundamental aspect of content protection , shields sensitive information by encoding it , rendering it unreadable to [unauthorized users]4271-unauthorized users . Digital Forensics techniques are harnessed to investigate and identify digital breaches , aiding in understanding security incidents and implementing preventive measures . Efficient Media Asset Management ( MAM ) systems streamline content workflows , ensuring the secure storage , retrieval , and distribution of valuable digital assets while maintaining [their]4253-creators integrity . Content Authentication protocols validate the legitimacy and origin of digital content , offering assurances of its authenticity and preventing the spread of falsified material . In the realm of cybersecurity , Anti - Phishing strategies combat fraudulent attempts to acquire sensitive information by mimicking [trusted entities]4272-trusted entities , safeguarding [users]1529-users against deceptive tactics . Digital Signatures play a pivotal role in verifying the authenticity and integrity of digital documents , ensuring [their]4253-creators legitimacy and protecting against tampering . Compliance Management frameworks ensure adherence to legal and industry standards , mitigating risks and fostering a culture of responsible content handling . Enforcement of Copyright regulations is bolstered by robust mechanisms , deterring and penalizing unauthorized use or distribution of copyrighted material . The incorporation of Safety Lanyards complements digital protection efforts by securing physical access to equipment and preventing unauthorized use or tampering . Threat Intelligence systems actively scout for potential threats , providing timely insights to anticipate and thwart malicious activities before [they]4253-creators materialize . Blockchain for Content Protection offers immutable and transparent records , elevating content protection by enabling secure and traceable transactions while combating tampering and unauthorized alterations . Content Auditing practices provide comprehensive assessments , evaluating content security measures to identify vulnerabilities and ensure robust protection strategies . In conclusion , the Content Protection Market stands as a multifaceted ecosystem , leveraging an arsenal of technological innovations and strategic frameworks to safeguard digital content from an array of threats . The amalgamation of these sophisticated measures ensures the integrity , authenticity , and security of digital assets in an increasingly dynamic digital landscape . The market size is forecast to increase by USD 3,023.11 million . [Cisco Systems]761-cisco 's CSCO short percent of float has fallen 13.82 % since [its]761-cisco last report . [The company]1085-the company recently reported that [it]1085-the company has 43.24 million shares sold short , which is 1.06 % of all regular shares that are available for trading . Based on [its]1085-the company trading volume , it would take [traders]1975-traders 1.6 days to cover [their]1975-traders short positions on average . Why Short Interest Matters Short interest is the number of shares that have been sold short but have not yet been covered or closed out . Short selling is when [a trader]4285-a trader sells shares of [a company [they]4285-a trader do not own]4286-a company they do not own , with the hope that the price will fall . [Traders]1975-traders make money from short selling if the price of the stock falls and [they]1975-traders lose if it rises . Short interest is important to track because it can act as an indicator of market sentiment towards a particular stock . An increase in short interest can signal that [investors]1102-investors have become more bearish , while a decrease in short interest can signal [they]1102-investors have become more bullish . See Also : List of the most shorted stocks [Cisco Systems]761-cisco Short Interest Graph ( 3 Months ) As [you]4289-you can see from the chart above the percentage of shares that are sold short for [Cisco Systems]761-cisco has declined since [its]761-cisco last report . This does not mean that the stock is going to rise in the near - term but [traders]1975-traders should be aware that less shares are being shorted . Comparing [Cisco Systems]761-cisco 's Short Interest Against [Its]1085-the company Peers Peer comparison is a popular technique amongst [analysts]1113-analysts and [investors]1102-investors for gauging how well [a company]1131-a company is performing . [[A company]1131-a company 's peer]4295-a company 's peer is another company that has similar characteristics to [it]1131-a company , such as industry , size , age , and financial structure . The Hosted PBX Market is estimated at USD 11.5 billion in 2023 to USD 24.9 billion by 2028 , at a Compound Annual Growth Rate ( CAGR ) of 16.8 % , according to a new report by MarketsandMarketsâ¢. This trend of modernization is underscored by the acknowledgment that hosted PBX not only provides a practical solution to financial constraints but also empowers [government agencies]2975-government agencies to streamline communication workflows , foster collaboration , and ultimately elevate the delivery of public services to [citizens]2766-citizens across [the diverse landscape of [the Asia Pacific region]3377-the asia pacific region]4416-the diverse landscape of the asia pacific region . As [governmental bodies]4418-governmental bodies increasingly prioritize digital transformation , hosted PBX solutions emerge as foundational elements , enabling effective navigation of the evolving terrain of administrative communication . Hosted PBX Market Advantages : No Capital Expenditure : Hosted PBX spares [companies]1187-companies from having to buy pricey phone systems . This lowers upfront costs because [the service provider]4434-the service provider also maintains and provides the service . Predictable Monthly Costs : Hosted PBX services are usually paid for by [businesses]1180-businesses on a fixed monthly basis , which makes it simpler to plan and budget for communication costs . Simple Expansion : Systems with hosted PBX are very scalable . It is simple for [businesses]1180-businesses to add or remove phone lines or extensions as needed , making it adaptable to changing needs and suitable for [businesses of all sizes]4437-businesses of all sizes . Work from Anywhere : [Employees using hosted PBX]4438-employees using hosted pbx can place and receive calls from any location as long as [they]4438-employees using hosted pbx have an internet connection . This is especially advantageous for [companies that use mobile or remote workers]4439-companies that use mobile or remote workers . Unified Communications : Cooperation and productivity are increased by integration with additional communication methods including email , instant messaging , and video conferencing . High Uptime : Reputable hosted PBX providers frequently give high uptime and dependability , making sure that there is little downtime for [enterprises]1637-enterprises . Built - in Redundancy : A lot of hosted PBX services come with disaster recovery and redundancy built right in , shielding [companies against lost or interrupted communication]4441-companies against lost or interrupted communication . Rich Feature Set : Auto - attendants , voicemail - to - email , call forwarding , call recording , and other capabilities are just a few of the features that hosted PBX services frequently offer . Frequent Updates : [Providers]4442-providers do n't have to charge [businesses]1180-businesses for new software or gear in order to upgrade and add new features . Analysts might differ on whether [we]4451-our are in a bull market , but the recent increases in stock prices reduced the pool of cheap tech stocks . This probably means the low - hanging fruit found at the height of the 2022 bear market has largely disappeared . Nonetheless , [investors]1102-investors can find bargains , particularly with [established tech giants that appear poised for a comeback]4462-established tech giants that appear poised for a comeback . With the S&P 500 close to all - time highs , [investors]1102-investors might want to consider [IBM]765-ibm ( IBM -0.30 % ) , [Intel]864-intel ( INTC -4.66 % ) , and Qualcomm ( QCOM -2.93 % ) . Here 's why these three " cheap "[1046-cfo jim kavanaugh] tech stocks are potential buys right now . 1 . IBM For much of the previous decade , [IBM]765-ibm stock fell into decline as most of [its]765-ibm business segments became stagnant amid slowing or negative growth . But this has appeared to shift under [current CEO Arvind Krishna]766-its ceo arvind krishna -- who took the helm in 2020 , who led the historic $ 34 billion takeover of Red Hat , helping to transform [IBM]765-ibm into a cloud giant . That move made [the company]1085-the company a leader in the hybrid cloud , the infrastructure that facilitates more - seamless integration between private and public clouds . [It]1085-the company continued this transformation by spinning off [[its]1085-the company managed infrastructure business]4465-its managed infrastructure business into [Kyndryl]12-kyndryl and acquiring numerous [cloud companies]4466-cloud companies to increase [its]1085-the company capabilities . For 2023 , [IBM]765-ibm forecasts $ 10.5 billion in free cash flow , an increase of $ 1 billion for the year . That will help fund [its]765-ibm more than $ 6 billion in annual dividend payments . The payout , which amounts to $ 6.64 per share annually , has risen for 28 straight years , and [its]765-ibm dividend yield is just above 4 % . Thanks to the growth in [its]765-ibm cloud business , the payout hikes should continue . Admittedly , the stock has not risen significantly over the last year . Nonetheless , it sells near multiyear highs , and at a price - to - earnings ( P / E ) ratio of 22 , [investors]1102-investors can still buy into a tech recovery and income stream at an affordable price . 2 . Intel As with [IBM]765-ibm , the loss of a technical lead wreaked havoc on Intel stock over the last few years . Consequently , [rival Advanced Micro Devices]4468-rival advanced micro devices took a technical lead in the CPU space , and [it]1085-the company faces pressure from [Nvidia]16-nvidia and [others in the data center business]4469-others in the data center business . Still , [CEO Pat [Gelsinger]1041-gelsinger]4470-ceo pat gelsinger envisions [Intel]864-intel retaking [its]864-intel technical lead . To that end , [he]4470-ceo pat gelsinger has begun building foundries to support a new business , [Intel Foundry Services ( IFS )]4471-intel foundry services ( ifs ) . [It]4471-intel foundry services ( ifs ) has attracted clients such as [Amazon]767-amazon and [Cisco Systems]761-cisco , and [chip design companies such as [Nvidia]16-nvidia]4472-chip design companies such as nvidia have expressed an interest . On the performance end , [it]864-intel has just released [its]864-intel Emerald Rapids CPUs . While Emerald Rapids might not outperform [AMD]1042-amd 's latest chips , it represents a considerable improvement that could help [Intel]864-intel meet [its]864-intel goal of technical parity in 2024 . The push to build [foundries]4473-foundries left [Intel]864-intel with a negative free cash flow of over $ 12 billion in the first nine months of the year . Still , the third quarter 's adjusted free cash flow was $ 943 million , indicating [its]864-intel finances might finally be improving . That could partly explain why [its]864-intel stock has risen nearly 60 % over the last year . While [its]864-intel forward P / E of 48 might not look cheap , a price - to - sales ( P / S ) ratio of 4 is well below AMD 's sales multiple of 10 , indicating that [more investors]4474-more investors might perceive it as inexpensive as [the company]1085-the company recovers . 3 . Qualcomm Qualcomm is [another established tech giant looking to recover]4476-another established tech giant looking to recover . Unlike [IBM]765-ibm and [Intel]864-intel , [it]4476-another established tech giant looking to recover never lost [its]4476-another established tech giant looking to recover technical lead , but sales of [[its]4476-another established tech giant looking to recover market - leading 5 G smartphone chipsets]4477-its market - leading 5 g smartphone chipsets fell as [consumers]1181-consumers became more uncertain about the economy . Moreover , [Qualcomm]1043-qualcomm is in a transition amid a likely decline in importance for the smartphone . To that end , it has also pivoted into the Internet of Things and automotive markets . But [the company]1085-the company faces significant competition in these segments , which may have led to doubts about [its]1085-the company future . And 63 % of [its]1085-the company revenue came from [China]5-china in fiscal 2023 ( ended Sept. 24 ) . As [U.S.-China]703-u.s.-china relations have become more tenuous , that dependence on [China]5-china could raise concerns about [Qualcomm]1043-qualcomm 's growth . Indeed , the aforementioned falling sales brought about a 19 % revenue decline in fiscal 2023 . Still , the free cash flow of almost $ 10 billion increased amid rising receivables and falling payables . Also , revenue forecasts in the fiscal 2024 first quarter point to a possible return in growth . As the slump seems to have ended , [investors]1102-investors have bid the stock to 52 - week highs . And even with the beginnings of a rising stock price , [investors]1102-investors can buy Qualcomm at 22 times earnings , a low multiple by historical standards . Assuming demand for [its]1043-qualcomm chipsets has finally begun to recover , [investors]1102-investors might want to buy this stock before it becomes more pricey .

Technology stocks are known for a handful of common characteristics . Paying dividends is not one of them . [These companies]1338-these companies typically reinvest the bulk of [their]1338-these companies profits into developing new and better tech and attempting to grow [their]1338-these companies sales . If [you]4484-you dig deep enough , though , [you]4484-you can find a handful of technology stocks that pay surprisingly solid dividends . Here are three [you]4484-you may want to consider stepping into before 2024 arrives . Buying now will help [you]4484-you take advantage of higher interest rates that not only work against [growth companies]4485-growth companies but favor dividend - paying value stocks -- no matter what business [they]1338-these companies 're in . 1 . HP There 's no denying that HP ( HPQ 0.59 % ) ( formerly known as [Hewlett - Packard]481-hewlett - packard ) is n't close to being the technology titan it once was . Neither [consumers]1181-consumers nor [corporations]4487-corporations buy computers as often as [they]4488-they used to . Further , in the early stages of the pandemic , there was a huge surge in computer purchases as [people]1331-people upgraded [their]1331-people machines so [they]1331-people could work and attend school remotely . That pulled a large volume of business forward , and the resulting ripples of lower demand are still being felt : [HP]962-hp 's personal computer revenue fell 19 % during the fiscal year that ended in October . Even the ultra - patient [Warren Buffett]875-warren buffett is giving up on [the company]1085-the company . [Berkshire Hathaway]876-berkshire hathaway has been selling off the stake in [HP]962-hp [it]876-berkshire hathaway began acquiring early last year , likely locking in modest losses . While [Berkshire]876-berkshire hathaway is backing off , [you]4484-you might want to use [this misunderstood outfit]4491-this misunderstood outfit 's recent weakness as an entry point . Yes , [HP]962-hp is in the computer business . [PCs]1044-pcs account for about two - thirds of [its]962-hp total sales . That segment is not a particularly great profit producer , though . [HP]962-hp 's much smaller ( by revenue ) printing business produces around 60 % of [its]962-hp profits , and [its]962-hp printing business is very , very reliable . That 's because [the paperless offices that computers were supposed to create when they started to become common back in the 1990s]4492-the paperless offices that computers were supposed to create when they started to become common back in the 1990s have given [us]4493-us the capacity to print more pages than ever . And [workers]2769-workers are using that option to the fullest . This , of course , is precisely what makes for a great dividend - paying stock -- an underlying business based on a product [the world]1147-the world is willing to pay for over and over again . [Newcomers]1045-newcomers will be plugging into the stock while [its]962-hp dividend yield is just a hair under 3.6 % . [Its]962-hp quarterly payout , by the way , has grown from $ 0.16 per share five years ago to a little over $ 0.27 per share now . That 's an annualized growth rate of a little over 9 % . 2 . IBM Like [HP]962-hp , [IBM]765-ibm ( IBM -0.30 % ) was once royalty among technology names . Not any longer . [The company]1085-the company mostly missed out on the rise of cloud computing and mobile connectivity . By the time [it]1085-the company started to pivot into those arenas in 2016 , it was too late . The stock had already begun a sell - off that would last for years , reflecting [the company]1085-the company 's lost ground . [Many investors]3814-many investors have forgotten about [IBM]765-ibm in the meantime , presuming [it]1085-the company would n't recover . Well , [those people]4499-those people may want to take a fresh look at the stock now . [It]4500-it just hit a six - year high . And , if [the company]1085-the company 's new business lines and business model are any indication , more new highs could be in the cards . Simply put , [IBM]765-ibm 's core focus these days is hybrid cloud computing and all of [[its]765-ibm ancillary businesses]4502-its ancillary businesses . These add - on businesses range from artificial intelligence to cloud management cybersecurity to automation , to name a few . The thing is , offering such turn - key cloud computing solutions means [IBM]765-ibm can generate a combination of software , hardware , and consulting revenue from [any given client]4503-any given client . " [Our]4504-we approach to hybrid cloud is platform - centric , "[843-chuck robbins] [CFO Jim Kavanaugh]1046-cfo jim kavanaugh explained during the Q4 2022 earnings call in January . " As [we]4504-we land a platform , [we]4504-we get a multiplier effect across software , consulting , and infrastructure . "[843-chuck robbins] [He]1046-cfo jim kavanaugh did n't divulge specific numbers at the time , but [Kavanaugh]1046-cfo jim kavanaugh has commented in the past that " for every dollar that [we]4504-we land on [ sales of ] the [ hybrid cloud ] platform , [we]4504-we get $ 3 to $ 5 of software and $ 6 to $ 8 of services revenue . "[1052-banks] It seems [we]4504-we 're finally seeing the measurable benefit of this dynamic . Last quarter 's software revenue was up 8 % year over year , while consulting revenue improved 6 % on much more modest infrastructure sales growth of only 2 % . And this is largely recurring revenue that helps support a dividend . [IBM]765-ibm not only maintained [its]765-ibm payouts during the rough patch [it]765-ibm was going through a few years ago , but [it]765-ibm has raised them for 28 consecutive years . At current prices , [new investors]4505-new investors would be buying the stock with a dividend yield of a little more than 4 % . 3 . Cisco Systems Last but not least , add [Cisco Systems]761-cisco ( CSCO 1.23 % ) to [your]4506-you list of dividend - paying technology stocks to buy . Currently , it 's yielding a respectable 3.1 % . Not unlike IBM and [HP]962-hp , [Cisco]761-cisco 's glory days came in the late 1990s and early 2000s . That 's when it was riding the then - rapid growth of the personal computer market . [Cisco]761-cisco 's role in that movement was supplying [the world]1147-the world with the modems , routers , and switches needed to connect [PCs]1044-pcs to the internet and to one another . [It]761-cisco still manufactures this hardware , although demand is n't quite as fevered now as it was then . New entrants into the ethernet switch and router market are also competitive against market - leading [Cisco]761-cisco . The networking hardware business has changed , however , in a way that helps keep [Cisco]761-cisco surprisingly competitive . See , in step with other kinds of related technologies , switches , and routers are now powered by adaptable and updatable software . [The company]1085-the company did $ 4.4 billion worth of software business during the fiscal quarter that ended Oct. 28 -- roughly one - third of [its]1085-the company total sales . [[Its]1085-the company subscription - based businesses]4509-its subscription - based businesses produced a total of $ 6.5 billion worth of sales for the quarter , accounting for nearly half of [the company]1085-the company 's top line . This is n't a coincidence . [It]4511-it 's by design . As CEO [Chuck Robbins]843-chuck robbins commented during the earnings call , " [We]857-technavio continue to transform [our]857-technavio business toward more software and recurring revenue streams fueled by accelerated innovation . "[1057-shih] The word " recurring "[1057-shih] is key here , as it translates into predictable , reliable cash flow that in turn funds continued dividend payments . To that point , [Cisco]761-cisco 's annualized rate of recurring revenue stands at $ 24.5 billion , which is just under half of last year 's total top line . [You]4506-you 'll probably never get great growth from [Cisco]761-cisco stock . [You]4506-you 'll certainly get good income , however , from a dividend that [management]1174-management has now raised for 13 consecutive years .

Consequently , rehabilitation becomes essential for [patients]3389-patients to regain these lost abilities . For [COPD patients]4516-copd patients , telerehabilitation entails supervised online exercise sessions that alleviate symptoms , enhance physical function , and elevate the quality of life . Therefore , the global upswing in population , escalating prevalence of chronic ailments , and augmented global disposable income collectively steer the adoption of advanced healthcare modalities such as telerehabilitation in the anticipated period . Debt To Equity Ratio The debt - to - equity ( D / E ) ratio gauges the extent to which [a company]1131-a company has financed [its]1131-a company operations through debt relative to equity . Considering the debt - to - equity ratio in industry comparisons allows for a concise evaluation of [a company]1131-a company 's financial health and risk profile , aiding in informed decision - making . Oracle 's ( ORCL -1.85 % ) stock sank 9 % during after - hours trading on Dec. 11 after [the tech giant]1105-the tech giant posted [its]1105-the tech giant latest earnings report . For the second quarter of fiscal 2024 , which ended on Nov. 30 , [its]1105-the tech giant revenue rose 5 % year over year to $ 12.9 billion but missed [analysts]1113-analysts ' estimates by $ 110 million . [Its]1105-the tech giant adjusted earnings per share ( EPS ) grew 11 % to $ 1.34 and exceeded expectations by a penny . Those headline numbers were n't terrible , but [investors]1102-investors had expected better results to justify the stock 's year - to - date rally of about 40 % prior to [its]1105-the tech giant earnings report . Let 's review the three reasons to buy [Oracle]1075-oracle 's stock -- as well as three reasons to sell [it]1105-the tech giant -- to see if it 's still a worthwhile investment after [its]1105-the tech giant recent post - earnings pullback . A recap of [Oracle]1075-oracle 's growth strategies Oracle is [the world 's largest database software company]4698-the world 's largest database software company . Over the past decade , [it]1075-oracle transformed a lot of [its]1075-oracle on - site software into cloud - based services to keep pace with the evolving market . To accelerate that transformation , [it]1075-oracle acquired a long list of companies -- including the cloud giant NetSuite in 2016 and [the healthcare IT leader Cerner]4699-the healthcare it leader cerner in 2022 . Most of [Oracle]1075-oracle 's recent growth was driven by the expansion of [its]1075-oracle cloud business and enterprise resource planning ( ERP ) services . [The company]1085-the company 's stable profitability and repatriation of [its]1075-oracle overseas cash also generated plenty of cash for [its]1075-oracle buybacks and dividends . That 's how [it]1085-the company bought back nearly 40 % of [its]1075-oracle outstanding shares over the past decade . The three reasons to buy [Oracle Oracle]1075-oracle 's growth is cooling off as the macro headwinds drive [companies]1187-companies to rein in [their]1187-companies spending , but it has three notable strengths : [Its]1075-oracle margins are expanding . [Its]1075-oracle free cash flow ( FCF ) is growing . [It]1075-oracle 's returning a lot of [its]1075-oracle cash to [[its]1075-oracle investors]3466-its investors . [Oracle]1075-oracle 's adjusted operating margin grew two percentage points year over year and sequentially to 43 % in the second quarter . For the first half of the year , [its]1075-oracle adjusted operating margin also improved two percentage points to 42 % . [It]1075-oracle attributes that expansion to the improved scale of [its]1075-oracle cloud business , [its]1075-oracle focus on growing [Cerner]1076-cerner 's profits , and other cost - cutting measures . As a result , [its]1075-oracle trailing 12 - month FCF grew 20 % year over year to $ 10.1 billion by the end of Q2 . That healthy FCF growth enabled [it]1075-oracle to buy back $ 600 million in shares in the first half of the year while paying out $ 2.2 billion in dividends . The three reasons to sell [Oracle]1075-oracle However , the bears will point out : [Oracle]1075-oracle 's cloud growth is decelerating ; [Its]1075-oracle dividend is too low . [Its]1075-oracle stock is n't a bargain relative to other blue - chip tech stocks . [Oracle]1075-oracle 's total cloud revenue ( including [Cerner]1076-cerner ) grew 24 % year over year to $ 4.8 billion , or 37 % of [its]1075-oracle top line , in Q2 . Within that total , [its]1075-oracle infrastructure - as - a - service ( IaaS ) revenue increased 50 % as [its]1075-oracle software - as - a - service ( SaaS ) revenue rose 14 % . But all three of those growth rates cooled from the first quarter when [its]1075-oracle total cloud revenue grew 29 % , [its]1075-oracle IaaS revenue jumped 64 % , and [its]1075-oracle SaaS revenue rose 17 % . That deceleration is worrisome when [we]4703-we consider that [Microsoft]768-microsoft 's cloud growth accelerated in [its]768-microsoft latest quarter , while [Amazon]767-amazon 's cloud growth held steady . [Oracle]1075-oracle 's recent decision to tether [its]1075-oracle own databases to [Microsoft]768-microsoft 's Azure instead of locking them into [[its]1075-oracle own Oracle Cloud Infrastructure]4704-its own oracle cloud infrastructure ( OCI ) platform also suggests [it]1075-oracle 's falling behind [Microsoft]768-microsoft , [Amazon]767-amazon , and other tech giants in the crowded cloud infrastructure market . [Oracle]1075-oracle has spent a lot more cash on [its]1075-oracle dividends than on [its]1075-oracle buybacks this year , but [its]1075-oracle paltry forward yield of 1.4 % wo n't attract [any serious income investors]4705-any serious income investors as long as CDs and Treasury bonds are paying yields of over 5 % . Meanwhile , [its]1075-oracle decision to spend less cash on buybacks this year ( compared to [its]1075-oracle $ 16.2 billion in buybacks in fiscal 2022 and $ 1.3 billion in buybacks in fiscal 2023 ) suggests the company does n't think [its]1075-oracle shares are extremely undervalued . [Oracle]1075-oracle 's forward multiple of 21 might seem reasonable , but other blue chip tech stocks like [Cisco Systems]761-cisco and [HP]962-hp trade at 13 and 9 times forward earnings , respectively . [Cisco]761-cisco and [HP]962-hp also pay higher dividends . Which argument makes more sense ? [Oracle]1075-oracle is still a decent investment for [long - term investors]4204-long - term investors , but it 's easy to find higher - growth cloud stocks or cheaper dividend - paying tech stocks . Since it does n't fit neatly into either category , [I]0-i believe [its]1075-oracle stock will trade sideways and underperform the market until [its]1075-oracle cloud growth finally stabilizes or accelerates . So for now , [I]0-i believe the bearish bullet points for [Oracle]1075-oracle still make a lot more sense than the bullish ones .

Cisco Systems , Inc. [CSCO]761-cisco has reportedly emerged victorious in a legal battle as [a federal judge in [Virginia]207-virginia]1930-a federal judge in virginia dismissed patent infringement claims made by cybersecurity company [Centripetal Networks]205-centripetal networks in a multi - billion - dollar dispute centered on network security technology . In 2020 , U.S. District Judge [Henry Morgan]1078-morgan , presiding in [the same court]4746-the same court , had initially granted [Centripetal]862-centripetal a record $ 2.75 billion patent damages award against [Cisco]761-cisco , marking the largest such award in U.S. history , according to a news report by Reuters . However , this decision was later reversed by a federal appeals court on ethics grounds , citing the ownership of [Cisco]761-cisco stock by [[Morgan]1078-morgan 's wife]4747-morgan 's wife , the report read . Before announcing [his]1078-morgan decision , [Morgan]1078-morgan disclosed to [both parties]4748-both parties that [he]1078-morgan had recently discovered [[his]1078-morgan wife]4966-his wife 's ownership of 100 shares of Cisco stock valued at $ 4,688 , asserting that [he]1078-morgan was unaware of this holding during the trial and that it had not affected [his]1078-morgan judgment in the case , Reuters added . In 2020 , following a non - jury trial , [Judge Morgan]1078-morgan ruled in favor of Centripetal , awarding [the company]1085-the company $ 1.9 billion in damages . This amount , along with additional royalties , escalated the total sum to over $ 2.7 billion , as per the report . Also Read : Comparative Study : [Cisco Systems And Industry Competitors In Communications Equipment Industry]4751-cisco systems and industry competitors in communications equipment industry Following the passing of [Judge Henry Morgan]1078-morgan , the case was reassigned as per the directive of the appeals court , it added . U.S. District Judge [Elizabeth Hanes]1079-elizabeth hanes , who conducted new hearings , ruled on Monday that [Cisco]761-cisco did not infringe upon the patents initially claimed by [Centripetal Networks]205-centripetal networks , the Reuters report added . In 2018 , [Centripetal Networks]205-centripetal networks , based in [Reston]208-reston , [Virginia]207-virginia , filed a lawsuit against [Cisco]761-cisco , alleging that [Cisco]761-cisco 's routers , network - security software , and various other products infringed on patents pertaining to Centripetal 's technology designed to prevent security threats from penetrating computer networks , the report noted . Many tech stocks rebounded in 2023 from the prior year 's steep downturn , and [Silicon Valley veteran Cisco Systems]756-silicon valley veteran cisco systems ( CSCO 1.23 % ) was among [them]4752-them . Shares reached a 52 - week high of $ 58.19 on Sept. 1 . But the stock plunged in mid - November after [Cisco]761-cisco released earnings for [its]761-cisco fiscal first quarter , which ended Oct. 28 . [Investors]1102-investors clearly found something in the earnings report concerning . For [bargain hunters who are wondering if this drop]4754-bargain hunters who are wondering if this drop has created a good buying opportunity , the question is : Are the things that triggered the sell - off long - term issues , or short - term ones that can be expected to eventually dissipate ? Let 's dive in and see . [Cisco]761-cisco 's successes [Cisco]761-cisco actually delivered amazing results in the latest quarter . It was the strongest Q1 in company history in terms of revenue and profit . Sales rose 8 % year over year to $ 14.7 billion , and net income grew 36 % to $ 3.6 billion as [the company]1085-the company met pent - up demand that had been left previously unfilled due to supply chain constraints . The balance sheet was strong as well . At the end of the quarter , [Cisco]761-cisco 's assets totaled $ 98.8 billion compared to $ 53.6 billion in liabilities , and [it]761-cisco had $ 23.5 billion in cash , cash equivalents , and investments . Pending challenges So why did the stock sink after [Cisco]761-cisco posted such spectacular results ? Because [management]1174-management warned [it]761-cisco was seeing signs that the surge in demand was starting to subside -- namely , product orders declined 20 % in the quarter . As a result , [the company]1085-the company offered revenue guidance of at least $ 12.6 billion for [its]1085-the company fiscal Q2 , which would be down significantly from the prior - year period 's $ 13.6 billion . [Management]1174-management also forecast that the period of waning customer demand could last a couple of more quarters before it rose back toward normal levels . That weak near - term outlook led to the sell - off of Cisco stock . But [investors who are focused on the long term]4759-investors who are focused on the long term should keep in mind that this short - term headwind is expected to subside eventually , after which the stock will be poised to recover . And one key reason to be confident in [Cisco]761-cisco 's ability to bounce back is [its]761-cisco software business . Though [Cisco]761-cisco built [its]761-cisco reputation as [a computer networking company]4760-a computer networking company , [it]761-cisco has also developed a substantial set of software offerings , including IT systems monitoring and cybersecurity . This allows [it]761-cisco to generate predictable recurring revenue through software - as - a - service ( SaaS ) subscriptions . [[Its]761-cisco SaaS segment]4761-its saas segment is n't as sensitive to cyclical ups and downs as [its]761-cisco hardware business . To buy or not to buy Cisco [Cisco]761-cisco 's SaaS offerings will strengthen after [the company]1085-the company closes [its]1085-the company acquisition of [cybersecurity analytics firm Splunk]4763-cybersecurity analytics firm splunk in 2024 . [Splunk]988-splunk 's solutions provide complementary capabilities that will enhance [[Cisco]761-cisco 's cybersecurity product suite]4764-cisco 's cybersecurity product suite . Also , [Splunk]988-splunk 's revenue , net income , and free cash flow all grew year - over - year in [its]988-splunk fiscal third quarter , which ended Oct. 31 . [[Splunk]988-splunk 's business]4765-splunk 's business is prospering with $ 1.1 billion in fiscal Q3 sales -- revenue that will add to [Cisco]761-cisco 's top line next year . [Splunk]988-splunk 's free - cash - flow growth should be a particularly attractive feature for [income investors]3284-income investors since it will add to [Cisco]761-cisco 's ability to maintain [its]761-cisco dividend , which yields over 3 % at the current share price . And [Cisco]761-cisco has raised [its]761-cisco payouts for 13 consecutive years , a solid track record . So long - term [investors]1102-investors can collect [Cisco]761-cisco 's dependable dividend while waiting for [its]761-cisco stock to bounce back . In the wake of [Cisco]761-cisco 's recent share price drop , now is a good time to buy the stock to hold for the long term . [Cisco]761-cisco 's business will be even more well - positioned once [its]761-cisco acquisition of [Splunk]988-splunk closes and [its]761-cisco sales bounce back from the looming cyclical downturn . In the meantime , [investors]1102-investors can benefit from [Cisco]761-cisco 's dividend , which makes it a good income stock . These factors point to [Cisco]761-cisco as a worthwhile investment for the long haul .
